","sourceId":null},{"id":12242,"label":"Withering Touch","description":"

Necrotic energy wreathes your hands and corrupts the flesh of a creature you try to touch. Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is not wearing armor. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity based ability check or attack roll it makes until the end of its next turn.  Instead of dealing damage to a living creature, this spell may be used to restore 1d8 hit points to a willing undead creature or to an undead creature you control, within melee range.  This spell may not be used to increase an undead creature's hit points beyond its hit point maximum. 

\r\n

The spell's damage/healing increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

","sourceId":null},{"id":12642,"label":"Hoard Gullet","description":"

You move your hands to your throat, chanting in low murmurs as you trace an imaginary line from your lower jaw down to your abdomen.

\r\n

You gain a magical second stomach, which can be used to transport objects securely.

\r\n

You can safely swallow and transport any object you could normally swallow (including items at least three size categories smaller than you).

\r\n

The maximum capacity of your hoard gullet is 50 pounds and/or 5 cubic feet.

\r\n

You can't remove individual items from your hoard gullet, but as an action, you can expel its entire contents into your square.

\r\n

It otherwise functions as a bag of holding (Dungeon Master's Guide, page 153).

\r\n

At the end of the spell's duration, anything still in your second stomach is immediately and instantly brought up, falling to the ground next to you.

\r\n

You can't have more than one hoard gullet active at one time.

\r\n

The spell's maximum capacity is increased by 50 pounds and/or 5 cubic feet when you reach 5th level (100/10), 11th level (150/15), and 17th level (200/20).

\r\n

Dragons often use this spell to transport their treasure hoards safely, but it is equally useful to those who would loot such hoards.

","sourceId":null},{"id":12649,"label":"Noxious Cloud","description":"

You create an area of extremely aromatic poisonous gas in a 5-foot-radius centered around you. Each creature that enters or moves within the area, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 1d4 poison damage and have disadvantage on their next attack against you.

\r\n

This spell’s cold damage is increased by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

","sourceId":null},{"id":12708,"label":"Rending","description":"

This spell creates a clean single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a chain link, a key, a cloak, or a wineskin. The break or tear is limited to one foot in any dimension.

","sourceId":null},{"id":13592,"label":"Warp Sight","description":"

This spell bends light directly to your eyes. This spell can be used to look around corners, check small places for items, and to watch someone behind an obstruction. It can only bend light by 180 degrees total (i.e. bending around two 90 degree turns).

","sourceId":null},{"id":15973,"label":"Sphere of Curiosity","description":"

A translucent amorphous sphere appears at a point you choose within range. If you are not able to see then the sphere will appear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. It disappears if you lose concentration  or if it is more than 40 feet from you for more than a minute.

\r\n

You can use your bonus action to move the hand along any surface or object within range and it will convey any or all information you would normally gain by touching or tasting the surface or object. The sphere cannot convey pain however, so you could know what the taste of a glass of wine was to know if it was poisoned or know the temperature of a piece of burning log and not be burned or poisoned.

\r\n

The sphere, as an action, can be used to survey the surface you are walking across for pressure plates, wires, or invisible objects. It can also bestow blindsight upon you but only for 5 feet around you.

\r\n

The sphere cannot attack, activate any items, or carry anything. Neither can it be felt or detected by any creature or construct save those with truesight.

","sourceId":null},{"id":18167,"label":"Manipulate Lifeforce","description":"

You grasp at a creature's vital essence within range. The creature must make a Constitution save, which it makes with disadvantage if it is below half of its maximum HP. On a failed save, the target takes 1d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, on a hit, you or one ally within range may regain hit points equal to the damage done. This spell has no effect on constructs and undead.

\r\n

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

","sourceId":null},{"id":22533,"label":"Control Rigging","description":"

You reach out with your magic to furl, unfurl, or otherwise manipulate one sail, stretch of rigging, or other movable ship component you can see within range.  If your last short or long rest was spent on a ship other than the ship the target is part of, you must make a DC 15 ability check with your spellcasting ability.  If you fail, the spell fails and the action is wasted. 

\r\n

At Higher Levels.  You can choose more than one target when you reach higher levels: two at 5th level, three at 11th level, and four at 17th level.

\r\n

You target a creature, teammate, or an undead you control. You then give up any number of temporary hit points you currently have, imbuing them into your target.

\r\n

You may not use any of your actual Hit Point for this spell. You cannot use this spell on the same target again within 18 seconds. The temporary hit points diminish by 1d8 an hour.

","sourceId":null},{"id":23835,"label":"Arcane Warrior","description":"

The weapon you are holding is imbued with arcane power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d8. The weapon also becomes magical, if it isn't already. The spell ends if you cast it again or if you let go of the weapon.

\r\n

If the strength of your wisdom is sufficient, you can always perceive what the situation is. If your body moves freely in the way of strategy, if you accurately probe the mind of your adversary, you will find many ways of winning. - Miyamoto Musashi, The Book of Five Rings

","sourceId":null},{"id":28306,"label":"Acrid Maw","description":"

The target must make a Constitution saving throw or take (1d10) necrotic damage as the acrid toxic cloud surrounds them and burns away at their skin.

","sourceId":null},{"id":32438,"label":"Alter Face","description":"

You change minor details about your face and hair for the duration, which can include any of the following effects:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You change your hair color and/or the length of your hair by 10 inches. 
    • \r\n
  • You change your eye color. 
    • \r\n
  • You cause a single facial feature of yours to either grow, shrink or change shape (for example, you can make your nose bigger or smaller, or make your eyebrows appear bushier). 
    • \r\n
\r\n

The changes you can make to your appereance are limited to your face only, and you can't change your skin color. Your voice, height, sex and weight stay the same. 

\r\n

Creatures who know you can possibly tell it's you, and creatures who have seen you before and are actively looking for you can tell it's you by passing a Wisdom (Perception) or Intelligence (Investigation) check countered by your Charisma (Performance) or Charisma (Deception) check. 

\r\n

The spell lasts for the duration, until it is dispelled, or until you end the spell. Ending the spell requires no action.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":32453,"label":"Invisible String","description":"

You touch an object that you can hold in your hand. You create an invisible string up to 20 feet long that connects you to the object for the duration. The object's distance from you cannot exceed the length of the string. If a creature tries to exceed that limit, they must make a Strength saving throw or drop the object. On a success, the string breaks and the spell ends. You can alter the length of the string at will, allowing you to pull the object closer to you or to prevent you from dropping it. If you attach the string to a weapon with the thrown properties and make a ranged attack with it, you can return the weapon to your hand on a hit or miss. The weapon's normal and long range is reduced to the string's max length.

\r\n

The string's max length increases by 20 feet when you reach 5th level (40 feet), 11th level (60 feet), and 17th level (80 feet).

","sourceId":null},{"id":32503,"label":"Create Item","description":"

\r\n
\r\n

From thought you create matter, equipping yourself with a simple implement you need. You summon one piece of adventuring gear worth 2 gp or less which you can hold in one hand, and which must weigh less than 10 pounds.

\r\n

If the item is more than 10 feet away from you at the end of your turn, the spell ends. This object may simulate the effects of a tool which requires proficiency, but it can only be used to make one ability check, for a task that takes 1 round or less, after which time the spell ends. Anyone who holds the item or examines it closely can tell it is not real.

\r\n

When the spell ends, the item disappears.

","sourceId":null},{"id":35021,"label":"Manipulate Life","description":"

The caster touches a target creature with an empty hand. One of the following effects happen:

\r\n

1. Steal Life: Immediately drain the target's lifeforce. The target takes 1d4 necrotic damage, and the caster gains half that amount in hit points rounded down. If the target dies, gain 2 additional hit points. If the target's original hit points is lower than the maximum damage dealt by this spell, gain no hit points. 

\r\n

2. Grant Life: Immediately supply the target with lifeforce. The caster takes 1d4 necrotic damage, and the target gains half that amount in hit points rounded down.

\r\n

3. Combine Life: Combining the above two features, the caster stores the stolen lifeforce instead of absorbing it. The caster must use a bonus action to pass the stolen lifeforce on to another target creature within the next minute or absorb it yourself. If not, the lifeforce dissipates. Attacks made against the caster requires you to pass a concentration check (WIS), or the effect ends. The caster does not take extra damage when transferring lifeforce this way.

\r\n

A creature whose lifeforce has been stolen becomes Exhausted for one round. Undead, constructs, and elementals are not affected by this spell.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: This spell's effect increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":40802,"label":"Detect Temporal Anomaly","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Divination)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)
Range: 90 ft / level while cast is in Reality, Unlimited while on the demiplane of time

\r\n

When this spell is cast, the caster is attuned to turbulence in the timestream and can scan a 90-degree by 90-degree area (one eighth of a sphere) each round while concentrating. After locating an anomaly, the severity can be determined by concentrating on it for an additional round. The caster has a 5% chance per level to recognize the cause. On the demiplane of time, distance is not a factor, and the spell detects the nearest source of turbulence in any scanned direction. On a Prime Material, Elemental, or Outer plane, the range is 90 feet per level. In both cases, sight is also a limiting factor.  The spell can effectively be maintained for as long as the caster concentrates.

\r\n

Based on the 2e AD&D spell of the same name, from the Chronomancer suppliment (TSR 9506).

","sourceId":null},{"id":40804,"label":"Date Object","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Divination)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

The caster is able to determine approximately how old a specific non-living object, item, or material is. This could be a small statue, furniture, weapon, food, etc. If used on the dead remains of a lifeform, the results will indicate how long it has been dead. Immediately, the caster gains a sense for eras: Current age, some previous age, future age. The DM determines what constitutes an \"age\" in that reality. If concentration is held for an entire round, the estimation becomes accurate to the century. For the next level of accuracy, the target item must be touched at some point. As concentration is held approaching 1 minute, age of the item can be known with accuracy somewhere between 1 decade and 1 year.

\r\n

For higher accuracy, the item must be touched, and contact with it maintained for the entire duration of the spell. If touched or held for the full 5 minutes, accuracy may be possible in terms of months.

\r\n

The degree of accuracy possible, regardless of how long concentration is maintained, is always determined by the DM. Some items may simply be too hard (or perhaps too powerful) to estimate at scales smaller than centuries, for example. On the other hand, some items may be trivial to determine, and accuracy to the day (or even hour) might be possible, perhaps even without the full 5 minutes of concentration.

\r\n

This spell is an original work.

","sourceId":null},{"id":40879,"label":"Condition Weather","description":"

This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for air conditioning and controlling the temperature. You create one of the following magical effects on yourself or a target creature within range:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You humidify or dehumidify the air around the target creature for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You alter the temperature around the target creature by up to 10 degrees for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You protect the target creature from nonmagical solar and other radiation for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You protect the target creature from nonmagical rain, snow, and other precipitation for 1 hour, as it magically slopes to the creature's sides.
    • \r\n
  • You protect the target creature from nonmagical dust and debris for 1 hour, as if there were a bubble around the creature.
    • \r\n
  • You cause bright light in the target creature's vision to become dim light for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
\r\n

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action. If a target creature is unwilling, it must pass a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":41506,"label":"Dissolving Touch","description":"

Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature is reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell. This spell has no effect on Constructs.

\r\n

This spell’s damage increases by 1d12 when you reach 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

","sourceId":null},{"id":44091,"label":"Mind to Book","description":"

You touch a pen and cause it to fly over to a book or scroll within 30 feet of you, after which the pen writes up to 240 words on the said text in a language you know how to write, which takes only 1 round. You can also use this spell to create scrolls of the controls you can cast, with a material requirement of a scroll, a pen, and your choice of a control you can cast. You may produce these scrolls at a rate of 1 per long rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":45900,"label":"Pocket Dimension","description":"

When you use this cantrip to store an item you create a pocket dimension that is a a miniature demiplane the size of a 5 foot cube. Only you have access to this pocket dimension and you can only store one object within it. The pocket dimension disappears when the object stored in it is retrieved from it. You may only have one such pocket dimension active at any time.

\r\n

With your action you may either store an item or retrieve it. When storing you target an object that you can see within 5 feet that is not worn or carried by a creature other than you; the object is sent into the pocket dimension if it would fit. When retrieving something you target an object in the pocket diemsnion and can summon it to an unoccupied space you can see within range which may include upon your person or in your hand. You cannot summon the object in a way that would cause it to be worn or carried by a creature other than you.

\r\n

If you die while you have a pocket dimension active the pocket dimension disappears and the object stored within will instantly appear in a random unoccupied space within 5 feet of you. If there is no space within 5 feet of you that the object can be summoned to then it is instead sent into the Astral Sea.

\r\n

The object used in this cantrip can be a container for other items like a backpack as long as it would fit within a 5-foot cube. The pocket dimension is technically a demiplane so it does not cause problems with storing an object containing its own pocket dimension like a Bag of Holding.

","sourceId":null},{"id":60476,"label":"Witherblight","description":"

You unleash your pain towards the target, withering it at its core. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 1d4 psychic damage, and the first time you take damage before the start of your next turn, the target takes necrotic damage equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

\r\n

This spell’s damage increases when you reach higher levels. Both damage rolls are increased by 1d4 at 5th (2d4), 11th (3d4) and 17th (4d4) level.

    • \r\n

","sourceId":null},{"id":82229,"label":"Find Book","description":"

Why bother walking around the library for hours if you already know what you're looking for?

\r\n

Rumor has it that this spell was once used by a desperate wizard to deal the final blow to a lich.
Most librarians strongly discourage its use.

\r\n

While standing in a library or other repository of knowledge, the caster may use this spell to call a single book within a 200ft horizontal or vertical radius to their hand. The book will travel in a straight line to the caster if not impeded by walls or bookshelves, or will travel parallel to walls or bookshelves until able to travel to the caster in a straight line. . The caster must know either the title or author of the book. If the caster only knows the author, they will receive a random book by that author. If the book does not exist or the book is not in that library, the spell will fail.

\r\n


This spell can and will hit people in the head with books. If a creature or object gets hit by a book propelled by this spell, they must make a Dexterity DC 12 saving throw or take 2d4 bludgeoning damage.

","sourceId":null},{"id":84228,"label":"Soul Manacles","description":"

Before a target is killed you have the choice of instead forming a set of magical manacles. (Light if Lawful,Darkness if Chaotic, or Mixed if Neutral) These magical cuffs stabilize the creature,renders them restrained, and act as regular manacles but with your spell attack modifier added against any escape attempts. These are capable of binding all beings and for each spell slot added you may as an action attempt to bind one more creature against it's will and if successful they are restrained.

","sourceId":null},{"id":89336,"label":"Molecular Dissonance","description":"

You attempt to disrupt the molecular structure of one creature or object you can see within range.  The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d6 force damage.  This damage ignores resistance and immunity to force damage. 

\r\n

If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it dies and is reduced to its component atoms. 

\r\n

This spell has no effect on a target with no physical form, such as a ghost or a fire elemental.  A target that doesn't have molecules or doesn't need its molecules intact, such as a water elemental or an air elemental, has advantage on the saving throw and resistance to the spell's damage. 

\r\n

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6). 

","sourceId":null},{"id":94459,"label":"Minor Alchemy","description":"

You change the chemical makeup of one object that you touch. The transformation ends if the duration ends or if you choose to end the transformation as a bonus action on your turn, letting the object instantly revert. Using this spell you can convert part of an object from one of wood, stone, copper, iron and silver to any of the others, as long as the object is non-magical.

\r\n

You can have up to three types of transformation in this way active at once, with the first casting reverting if you exceed this number. You can use an action on your turn to keep a transformation that has nearly ended from ending, giving it a fresh duration.

\r\n

You can convert up to a cubic foot of material in this way, and while transformed the objects that you have converted behave exactly as they would in their new material form; for example, wood will burn, stone is heavier, copper is malleable, and so on.

\r\n

This spell does not work if you try to convert an object that an unwilling creature is holding or wearing.

\r\n

You can decide on the quality of the material that you convert to (finely polished oak or weak limestone), but it should reflect the material that was converted from.

\r\n

You can also cause shapes, colours, or both to appear in the surfaces of objects made of the above materials, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns in a 5 ft area. These changes last for 1 hour.

","sourceId":null},{"id":98370,"label":"Decay","description":"

Your Patron uses you as a conduit to touch the World, but their touch brings only ruin.

\r\n

Necromantic energy washes over any creature that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes 4d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

\r\n

If you target a plant creature or a magical plant, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and the spell deals maximum damage to it.

\r\n

If you target a nonmagical plant that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, it doesn't make a saving throw; it simply withers and dies.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8

This effect is removed if the ally reaches half of their maximum health or takes damage. It can not be used on an ally who is above half of their maximum health or is downed.

","sourceId":null},{"id":106864,"label":"Fake Illness","description":"

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You have a fever and raspy voice.
    • \r\n
  • You have cold symptoms (Snot, cough, red eyes).
    • \r\n
  • You have a full body rash.
    • \r\n
  • You throw up once every fifteen minutes.
    • \r\n
\r\n

None of these effects actually harm you long term. You feel the full effect of the illness of your choice for the hour. It stops immediately and all effects dissipate after the hour has elapsed.  

","sourceId":null},{"id":107963,"label":"Camouflage","description":"

When this spell is cast the creature or object touched blends into its surroundings for a short time making it difficult to perceive by sight.  Additionally it muffles and distorts the sounds of their movement making them equally difficult to locate by hearing.  An affected creature gains advantage on all Stealth checks made while the spell lasts.  When this spell is cast on an item, that item is concealed from everyone not in direct contact with it who does not succeed on  an Investigation  check equal to the caster's spell save DC.  Moving an affected item does not interfere with the item's camouflage, it adapts to the items new environment for as long as the spell lasts.

","sourceId":null},{"id":111581,"label":"Radiant Eldritch Blast","description":"

For Warlock/Celestial

\r\n

A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

\r\n

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

\r\n

For each beam, the user can channel one point of healing light. An arc of radiant healing branches from the point of impact. An unconscious ally within 15 feet of the target rolls a d6 and heals for the result. If no allies are unconscious, the healing arc is randomized to the closest ally in range.

","sourceId":null},{"id":117485,"label":"Pest","description":"

You command a swarm of pests to overwhelm one creature within range. You can choose one of the following effects:

\r\n

Melting Roaches: Cockroaches crawl all over a creature within range, spraying it with acid. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take 1d4 acid damage, and have its AC lowered by 3 until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature only takes half damage, with no additional effects.

\r\n

Hornet's Nest: Hornets swarm around a creature within range, stinging it. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take 1d4 poison damage, and be poisoned until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature only takes half damage, with no additional effects.

\r\n

Swamping Leeches: Leeches drop onto a creature withing range, biting into it. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take 1d4 necrotic damage, and lose one of its resistances or immunities, which you can choose, until the start of your next turn. You learn about the creatures resistances, immunities and vulnerabilities. On a successful save, the creature only takes half damage, with no additional effects.

\r\n

Alternatively, you can make a Melee spell attack against a creature as an action. Flies, fleas, worms and various other pests swarm the creature. It must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or take 1d4 acid damage, 1d4 poison damage and 1d4 necrotic damage. On a successful save it takes half as much damage.

\r\n

The damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4). Optionally, you can choose to extend the secondary effect by 1 turn when you would increase the damage at 5th level (2 turns), 11th level (3 turns) and 17th level (4 turns).

\r\n

The Melee spell attacks damage increases when you reach 5th level (2d4 extra on one damage type), 11th level (3d4 extra on one damage type) and 17th level (4d4 extra on one damage type).

\r\n

 

\r\n

 Uses Outside of Combat: All creatures mentioned below have 1 hit point and an AC of 5, and can be dispelled by you at any time. You may only have one effect active at any given time.

\r\n

Horrid Burial: You can summon maggots on a corpse within range. These maggots take 10 minutes to consume flesh and organs of a medium sized creature, and 1 hour to consume bones of a medium sized creature. For each size larger than medium, double the time it takes to consume. For each size smaller than medium, halve the time it takes to consume.

\r\n

Deconstruct: You can summon termites on any wooden surface or item that isn't being worn or carried, and that is within range. The termites will begin chewing and biting through the wood, creating a 5 foot hole in 10 minutes. Any surface or item smaller than 5 feet in any dimension is completely consumed within this time. 

\r\n

Infested: A centipede crawls into any body opening of a creature that is willing or unaware of your presence, and is within range. You can pinpoint the approximate location of this centipede, as long as it is on the same plane of existance as you. The centipede will not leave the host unless you command it to or it dies. If it is removed from the host body, it will immediately attempt to enter the host body again. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":119654,"label":"Putrid Chains","description":"

You create a chain dripping with putrid ichor that hurtles towards a creature in range. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become wrapped in chains and pulled ten feet towards you if the creature is Large or smaller. Creatures who become wrapped in chains emit putrid fumes in a 5-foot radius, dealing 1d4 poison damage to creatures within 5ft of them, but not affecting the chained creature, prior to being pulled. The chains fade immediately after pulling, or attempting to pull, the creature.

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

","sourceId":null},{"id":121230,"label":"Grievous Wounds Strike","description":"

As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell's range, otherwise the spell fails.
On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and it takes necrotic damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (min. 1) as it applies Grievous Wounds, so the target creature can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.
This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. 

\r\n

At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra 1d8 necrotic damage. Both damage dice increase by one again at levels 11 and 17.

","sourceId":null},{"id":126810,"label":"Necrotic Strike","description":"

As part of the action used to cast this spell, you must make a melee attack with a weapon against one creature within the spell’s range, otherwise the spell fails. On a hit, the target suffers the attack’s normal effects, and takes necrotic damage equal to your spell-casting modifier and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

\r\n

This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (1d4), 11th level (2d4), and 17th level (3d4). 

","sourceId":null},{"id":127256,"label":"Memory Capture","description":"

You've gained the ability to crystallize a brief period of time in perfect clarity. Once cast, the caster recalls the next minute exactly. They recall all aspects of the memory (sight, sound, smell, touch, taste) even if they are not understood it at the time. The caster can capture up to three different 1-minute memories and each can be retained indefinitely. Any new memory beyond this will replace one of the existing memories. The lost memory then fades into obscurity and can only vaguely be recalled.

\r\n

At higher levels, the duration of the memory captured increases: at 5th level to 10 minutes, at 11th level to 30 minutes and at 17th level to 1 hour.

","sourceId":null},{"id":129702,"label":"Mold Earth (Fix)","description":"

You choose a portion of unrefined earth-origin material that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube (10 ft. on the 5th level, 15 ft. on the 10th level and 20 ft. on 15th level).
You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • \r\n

    If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.

    \r\n
    • \r\n
  • \r\n

    You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

    \r\n
    • \r\n
  • You can carve shallow patterns in hard materials (of earth-origin) witch last until destroyed.

    • \r\n
  • You crush chosen part of earth changing it to sand-like form.

    • \r\n
  • You squeeze part of earth reducing its size, but keeping its weight and composition, but that process has a limit depending on the material.

    • \r\n
  • To form earth in the fixed form you need to have some information about craftsmanship (may do WIS check), be aware, an item created with this method is really heavy - before each use, make STR check. Creating something so complicated need more time, respectively.

    • \r\n
  • You can extract some clear ores from earth but after that, it becomes refined and you lose control over it.

    • \r\n
  • \r\n

    If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already a difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.

    \r\n
    • \r\n
\r\n

All changes are visible for creatures in spell area and slow enough to be easily avoided. You can dismiss such an effect as an action.

","sourceId":null},{"id":131188,"label":"Blood Bullet","description":"

Make a range spell attack against a creature you can see within range. Every use the caster loses 1 hit point. On a hit, target takes 1d4 piercing + Spell Casting Mod. If the caster has temporary hit points, this spell subtracts from the temporary HP before the standard HP.

\"You point at an enemy you can see in range. The tip of your finger bears a tiny pain, in an instant a bead of blood shoots at your target piercing them. Inside the target the bullet transforms into glass-like shards than pierces the internal bits.\"

","sourceId":null},{"id":134621,"label":"Corrosion","description":"

Out of your outstretched hand spurts a shower of sickly, green acid.  Choose a square of 5 feet on each side within range.  Any creature in that space must make a dexterity saving throw or take 2d4 acid damage.  Any object in the area takes double damage from the acid. This spell’s damage increases by 2d4 when you reach 5th level (4d4), 11th level (6d4), and 17th level (8d4).

","sourceId":null},{"id":135145,"label":"Sculpt Time Pockets","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

You create small pockets of time where you can manipulate the time within it in slight ways. The area these small pockets of time cover are just 5' cubed areas and within them you can reverse, freeze and accelerate time respectively. You initially can only create one pocket, but as you go up in level you will be able to create more.

Reverse Time: You can reverse a series of events within a 10 minute span of time inside the pockets of time you create, this only affects nonliving objects and it does not really reverse time. It merely places things back to the way they were up to 10 minutes in the past, this adjustment happens in the span of just one round. This can only be done outside of combat as it requires too much concentration. The effects of this spell can mend non magical items, but it does not change any effects that may have occurred from the items moving in the first place. For example, if a lever was switched, the spell will merely reset the switch, but if there was a triggered event created by moving the switch in the first place, it may still be in effect. This is up to DM discretion. 

Freeze Time: You are able to freeze time in these respective pockets so that your own spells will not affect those within them. Any area effect spell that you cast that includes those pockets of time makes anyone within them immune to that spells effects until start of your next turn.

Accelerate Time: You are able to give those who are standing in these pockets +2 on Initiative. This must be cast prior to initiating combat, typically this is usually only available if you and your group are initiating combat as the locations of the pockets need to be determined beforehand.

The number of pockets you can create increases by 2 when you reach 5th level, 11th level, and 17th level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":137838,"label":"Poisonous Veil","description":"

You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and summon a cloud of poisonous gas around the targets head. The creature must then succeed on a Constitution saving throw or the fumes parch the targets lungs and eyes; the target is affected even if they do not breathe or hold their breath. If the target fails the save, they take 1d6 poison damage and they suffer disadvantage on any perception checks as well as have their vision distance reduced to 15 feet. The cloud fades after the casting of the spell, however the effects on the target remain until the end of their next turn.

\r\n

This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

","sourceId":null},{"id":139524,"label":"Minor Invention - Clockwork Hand","description":"

You have created an invention in the form of a clockwork hand. You can activate the invention by speaking a command word. The hand's battery lasts for the duration (1 minute) when not in its charging place on you or until you deactivate it as an action. The clockwork hand uses its action to crawl to you if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you say the command word again.

\r\n

You can use your action to control the clockwork hand with a remote. You can use the clockwork hand to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the clockwork hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

\r\n

The clockwork hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

\r\n

This is a minor invention you have on yourself all the time after you have learned how to craft it, therefore you wont need to continue crafting it and spending components.

\r\n
 
","sourceId":null},{"id":140325,"label":"Scribe","description":"

This spell allows you to create a copy of a written work. By placing a blank scroll, book, or page near the work that you are copying, all the writing, illustrations, etc., in the original reproduces itself in the new document, in your handwriting. The new medium must be large enough to accommodate the original source. Magical properties of the original aren't reproduced, so you can't use scribe to make usable copies of spell scrolls or magic books.

","sourceId":null},{"id":143982,"label":"Alter Familiar","description":"

As an action, you cause your Familiar to take on your own shape and statistics. While your familiar is changed in this way, your own body enters a state of catatonia and can take no actions until the spell is dismissed. Attacks against you are made at advantage, and you can take no reactions. You are not aware of anything happening nearby or of any damage taken or spells cast against you. You automatically fail any and all saving throws. If your HP drops to zero in this state, your familiar is instantly dismissed and you make any necessary death saves as normal.

","sourceId":null},{"id":144226,"label":"Blood Siphon","description":"

You extend your arm and siphon life energy from one creature’s blood. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to resist the effect. If the creature succeeds, the spell fails and nothing happens. If they fail, they take 1d6 necrotic damage and you restore half that many hit points (minimum of 1).

\r\n

This spell has no effect on creatures that are not living or do not use blood to live.

","sourceId":null},{"id":145233,"label":"Necrodigitation","description":"

Drawing on the powers that permeate both life and death, you manifest a minor display of necromancy magic. As an action, you can create one of the following effects:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You summon a small wisp or skull-shaped spectre at a point within range. While summoned, the spirit floats in place for the duration, emitting dim light in a 10ft radius. You can dismiss this spirit as a bonus action, causing it to disappear immediately.
    • \r\n
  • You infuse a wandering spirit into an inanimate object within range, animating it for up to 1 minute. While inhabiting an object, the spirit has 1 hit point and cannot attack by any means, and is unable to move or communicate beyond the capabilities of the object that it is inhabiting. Other relevant game statistics such as AC are determined by the DM.
    • \r\n
  • You conjure the chill of the grave within a 10ft radius of yourself, causing the temperature to plummet and immediately extinguishing any unprotected flames. This change in temperature is not significant enough to cause damage.
    • \r\n
  • You can animate portions of materials used for necromancy rituals such as bones, blood, dead wood or tombstones, forming them into simple shapes that last for the duration. If you do so, the targeted materials must fit within a 5-foot cube.
    • \r\n
  • You can target a creature within range that has a Challenge Rating of 0 (or does not have a Challenge Rating assigned to it). If the creature has exactly 1 hit point, it dies immediately.
    • \r\n
  • You can target a dead creature or plant within range that previously had a Challenge Rating of 0 (or did not have a Challenge Rating assigned to it) and has been dead for no longer than 24 hours. The target is reanimated and returns to life as an Undead creature with 1 hit point. The reanimated target resumes cannot attack by any means, and immediately resumes any suitable behaviours that it would have been reasonably been performing prior to death. After 10 minutes, the reanimation effect ends and the target's form crumbles into dust and cannot be reanimated again by this effect.
    • \r\n
\r\n

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

","sourceId":null},{"id":149477,"label":"Rexin's Life Siphon","description":"

Two shadow-wreathed hands project out of your body in any direction to touch two creatures within 10 Feet of you. The left hand draws the life force out of a creature and the right hand injects the life force into another creature that has recently taken damage. Your body acts as a siphon, redirecting life force from one creature to the other, healing wounds and restoring hit points. Make a ranged spell attack against the creature touched by your spell's left hand. On a successful attack, the target takes 1d4 necrotic damage, and the creature touched by the spell's right hand regains hit points equal to HALF the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

\r\n

You are permitted to be one of the creatures touched by the left or right hand of this spell. If you are the creature being bolstered with health, then roll your attack as usual. But if you choose to sacrifice your own life force to help heal another creature, then you automatically trigger a critical hit against yourself.

\r\n

Critical Hit: When you roll (or automatically trigger) a critical hit on this ranged spell attack, then you will not only double the number of dice dealing necrotic damage against the creature touched by the spell's left hand but also restore to the creature touched by the spell's right hand a gain of hit points equal to the FULL amount of necrotic damage dealt, not HALF like usual.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. This spell's damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

","sourceId":null},{"id":159994,"label":"Minor Polymorph","description":"

This spell allows you to take the form of a beast for up to 1 hour. You can use an action to transform back to your natural form, but will also revert back if you drop to 0 hit points or die. 

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You can take the form of any beast with a challenge rating of zero (0), however, the new form can not have a swimming or flying speed until after you have reached 5th level.
    • \r\n
  • Alignment and personality remain unchanged, but game statistics, including mental ability score and hit points are replaced by those of the new form. When you regain your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before the transformation.
    • \r\n
  • If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. If the excess damage carried over reduces your normal form to 0 hit points, you are knocked unconscious.
    • \r\n
  • You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of the new form, and can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. All gear melds into the new form and you can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any equipment.
    • \r\n
\r\n

Higher levels: As your proficiency with shape-changing increases, you gain the ability to use this ability more often. Minor Polymorph can be cast a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier per long rest. Increasing to 3 times at 5th level, 4 times at 9th, 5 times at 13th, and 6 times at 17th. You regain the ability to shape-change again after a long rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":165805,"label":"Arcane Wax Seal","description":"

You touch a non magical Scroll or folded letter with the gold infused candle wax, the wax coalesces into a arcane seal an the scroll or letter becomes sealed with an arcane lock spell for the duration. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can open the object by breaking the seal to end the spell, if the seal is broken by anyone not designated by the caster, all that was written on the letter or scroll is erased.

\r\n

Casting dispell magic  on the object breaks the seal without erasing the contents. Once dispelled, the seal breaks and cannot be reused. The broken seal remains on the object and letter/ scroll was read by use of dispell magic.

\r\n

At higher spell slot level choose the following effects:

\r\n

1st level spell slot you may seal scroll/ letter with magical writing.

\r\n

2nd level spell slot or higher you may seal books, magical spell books or normal books.

","sourceId":null},{"id":166642,"label":"Diagnose","description":"

You touch a target and extend your senses through its body, this allows you to determine the state of the targets health.  The target perceives this as a shock akin to plunging into cold water making it very difficult to conceal.  You immediately discern is the target is alive or dead, and conscious or unconscious and whether it is afflicted by any diseases and whether those diseases are mundane or magical in nature. You also become aware of any status effects currently applied to the target including any levels of exhaustion and the presence or absence of any madness and the type of madness if present ( short-term , long-term, or indefinite).  Any additional medicine checks you make with regard to the target have advantage for the next hour and during this time the creature regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing by you.  If this spell is cast again before that time elapses the benefits apply only to the most recent target.

\r\n

This spell has no effect on nonliving creatures such as constructs and the undead.

    • \r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":220750,"label":"Find Grand Familiar","description":"

You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes the form you choose  (List Below)              

\r\n

(when you can cast 1st level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-1,

\r\n

 when you can cast 2nd level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-5,

\r\n

 when you can cast 3rd level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-9,

\r\n

 when you can cast 4th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-13,

\r\n

 when you can cast 5th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-17,

\r\n

 when you can cast 6th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-21,

\r\n

 when you can cast 7th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-24,

\r\n

 when you can cast 8th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-28

\r\n

 When you can cast 9th level spells you can choose a form that has a CR of 0-30)

\r\n

 

\r\n

Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a dragon, or beast ,etc..

\r\n

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. The familiar summoned can attack, and it can take other actions as normal.

\r\n

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again.

\r\n

While your familiar is within 1000 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

\r\n

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 100 feet of you.

\r\n

You can't have more than one familiar at a time. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you instead cause it to adopt a new form. Choose one of the forms from the game. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

\r\n

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

\r\n

If the familiar is Large, Huge, or Gargantuan you can ride it

","sourceId":null},{"id":223804,"label":"Embolism","description":"

On a hit, the creature takes 1d4 necrotic damage, and must make a constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target has disadvantage on the next constitution saving throw made before the end of your next turn.

","sourceId":null},{"id":262686,"label":"Encrypt","description":"

","sourceId":null},{"id":279956,"label":"Time Bubbles","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with a Chronomancer subclass such as the School of Temporal Magic)

\r\n

With knowledge of the Demiplane of Time, you manipulate the mist-smoke to recreate its effects within tightly enclosed spaces.

\r\n

Halted Bubble You create bubbles of arrested time within the effects of your spells. When you cast a spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to your spell casting ability modifier. Using your reaction, you halt the flow of time around the chosen creatures, allowing them to automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save. Alternatively, you can use your action to surround yourself in the bubble, giving disadvantage on the next ranged attack against you till the start of your next turn.

\r\n

Backwards Bubble Using an action, you create a bubble of restorative time around a single inanimate object that is not being worn or carried. As long as the object is no larger than the spells area of effect, the bubble moves it backward along its timeline to a point before it was damaged, soiled, or otherwise interacted with. This spell can repair physical aspects of an item or construct, but cannot restore any aspects such as text or magic. The bubble also restores objects, such as a sprung trap or pressed switch, to their previous states. Any effects triggered stay in effect unless such a restoration would trigger a secondary effect such as a lever that opens or closes a door based on its position. 

\r\n

Accelerated Bubble With an action, you create a bubble of carefully accelerated time around a point within range. You can instantly make a seed pod open, a leaf bud bloom, or a flower blossom or wilt, but not to the point of death. You can also decompose a single non-living object made of organic materials that can fit within the bubble, but not to the point of nonexistence. Finally, you can alter a non-organic object within the bubble in a similarly accelerated way, such as an hourglass draining sand faster, a rusted chain weakening, or a warm bath becoming cool in an instant. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":292030,"label":"Weld","description":"

You choose two objects within range that must remain within range for the duration of the casting of this spell. For the duration of this spell, harmless sparks of electricity bind the objects to one another. If you concentrate on the spell for its full duration, the objects bound together physically fuse at the points where they connect and can no longer be separated.

(For clarity's sake, during the concentration of the spell, something like dispel magic will cause the items to come apart. After the duration is finished, dispel magic would not be able to separate the objects, but mundane means such as hitting the object with a hammer would)

","sourceId":null},{"id":294074,"label":"Accelerate","description":"

This spell accelerates an object you are holding out to a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage according to its distance from you

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n

Within 30 ft.1d6
Between 30 and 60 ft.1d8
Between 60 and 90 ft.1d10
Between 90 and 120 ft.1d12

This spell's damage increases by 1 die when you reach 5th level (two dice), 11th level (three dice), and 17th level (four dice). The dice are all the same type.

","sourceId":null},{"id":330771,"label":"Rancid Leech","description":"

The warlock points with his hand at his victim, commanding his rot fly to attack and create a stream of necrotic flies between him and a target creature. The flies return to their maker with bits of the victims flesh strengthening him and weaken the target.

\r\n
\r\n

Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the damage taken. Until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on your spell attack roll with this spell against the same target.

\r\n
\r\n

At Higher Levels. This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 3rd level (2d6), 5th level (3d6), 7th level (4d6), and 9th level (5d6).

","sourceId":null},{"id":330822,"label":"Withering Defence","description":"

Make a melee spell attack against the target. You have advantage on the attack roll if the target is not wearing armor. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and has disadvantage on the next Strength or Dexterity based ability check or attack roll it makes until the end of its next turn.

\r\n
\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

","sourceId":null},{"id":336096,"label":"Arcane Blast","description":"

You throw a translucent bolt of force streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, it takes 1d8 force damage. The creature must also make a strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet.

\r\n

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

\r\n

The distance a creature is pushed back increases by 5 feet when you reach 5th level (10 feet), 11th level (15 feet) and 17th level (20 feet)

","sourceId":null},{"id":348125,"label":"Lay to Rest","description":"

 

\r\n

As an action you sprinkle some soil over the corpse of a medium or smaller creature within range. Over the next minute the ground will swallow the corpse, burying it six feet below the surface of the land.

\r\n

You may concentrate on the spell for longer than a minute to bury the corpse of a larger creature, the DM decides how long this will take depending on the size of the corpse.

","sourceId":null},{"id":363882,"label":"Exchange Currency","description":"

When you cast this spell, up to 10 coins within range that you have legitimate ownership of or have touched within the last 24 hours are exchanged into an equal amount of up to 10 different coins of your choosing. For example, 10 copper coins could be changed into 1 silver coin, or 1 gold coin could be changed into 1 electrum coin and 5 silver coins.

","sourceId":null},{"id":365405,"label":"Arcane Diagnosis","description":"

Target one willing creature within range and line-of-sight. After 1 minute, the caster learns the target's remaining hit points, death saves, and any diseases, conditions, or ailments afflicting them for the duration. The information appears as a visual chart next to the target creature. This chart also displays an estimated remaining lifespan, unless the creature's remaining lifespan is unpredictable, such as an immortal or ageless being.

\r\n

The caster can only see this information while looking directly at the target of the spell. Casting the spell again dispels the previous effect. The spell's effect can also be dismissed at any time as a free action.

\r\n

Creatures that are not technically alive are not affected by this spell, such as constructs, specters, undead, and aberrations.

","sourceId":null},{"id":389168,"label":"Complicate/Simplify","description":"

You cause a written statement of any kind or size that you can touch to become as complicated as possible, or as simple as possible. Any number of words can be added, adjusted, or removed so long as the nature of the statement is not lost. You may also cast this on any creature, willing or unwilling, so long as it is capable of communicating in any fashion. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

\r\n

Complicate. The content of a written statement is inflated and edited as much as possible without losing its' meaning, within the surface area of the material it is written on, and within the legibility of the text to the naked eye. When successfully cast on a creature, the next statement it makes will be effected in the same way. The following statement must be stretched out as much as possible within the creature's intellect, if their vocabulary is sufficiently exhausted and the meaning of the statement has not been lost, they will be able to complete their statement. The effect of the spell ends as soon as the affected creature completes it's statement.

\r\n

Simplify. The content of a written statement is reduced and edited as much as possible without losing its' meaning, whether or not the text increases in size to fill the limits of the surface it is written on is up to the caster. When successfully cast on a creature, the next statement it makes will be effected in the same way. The following statement must be reduced as much as possible within the creature's intellect, or lack thereof. Once the statement has been uttered after becoming as dumbed-down as possible, the effect of the spell ends.

\r\n

The effect of this spell on the written word is permanent and can only be undone by a Wish spell, or by simply redoing the statement.

","sourceId":null},{"id":391927,"label":"Alchemical Exploit","description":"

You target an unprotected, inert, simple substance such as water, oil, dirt, or sand. The volume of material that you can target with this spell can be no more than half a foot in any dimension. You can change the state of matter that the substance is in by one step (solid to liquid, liquid to solid, liquid to gas, or gas to liquid), alter its color slightly, or add or remove a polished sheen to it.

\r\n

Alterations caused by this spell cannot directly cause damage.

","sourceId":null},{"id":405649,"label":"Prestidigitation (New Variants)","description":"

This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for practice. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.
    • \r\n
  • You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.
    • \r\n
  • You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.
    • \r\n
  • You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and that lasts until the end of your next turn.
    • \r\n
  • You cause a page of a book to appear blank for 1 hour.
    • \r\n
  • You cause a glowing green arrow to appear; it will point in a cardinal direction you choose for 1 round.
    • \r\n
  • You can cause one creature you touch to become sterile for one hour.
    • \r\n
  • You count the number of objects of one type that are no smaller than a grain of rice that are within a single pile, container, or a 5-yard square.
    • \r\n
  • You can sort small objects (none of which may be heavier than half an ounce) into discrete piles based on one criterion of your choice (such as color or shape).
    • \r\n
  • You touch a plate of food or cup of drink and learn it’s quality: rotten, poor, average, good, or gourmet. This does not reveal the existence of poison or other contaminants.
    • \r\n
  • Your hair or beard is neatly trimmed by 1/2 inch or grows by 1/2 inch.
    • \r\n
  • You shape a Medium-sized or smaller patch of nonmagical smoke or fog into any shape you wish, although you’re incapable of fine detail. You can even cause it to move slightly.
    • \r\n
  • You make an object waterproof for the duration, although fully immersing it in liquid for 1 minute or more will end the spell.
    • \r\n
  • You create an umbrella of magical force. You can choose its appearance or make it invisible.
    • \r\n
\r\n

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":428669,"label":"Graviturge's Orbit","description":"

You touch up to two small nonliving objects that weigh no more than 5 pounds and suspend them in orbit around you.

\r\n

As an action, you can launch one of the items at a target within 60 ft; the objects use your spell attack bonus for attack rolls and deals 1d6 + your spellcasting bonus.

\r\n

As a reaction, you can have one of the objects intercept an attack from an enemy, forcing them to attack at disadvantage.

\r\n

Regardless of how you use the objects, the spell will no longer affect them after use.

\r\n

The number of objects you can target with this spell increases at 5th level (3), 11th level (4), and 17th level (5).

","sourceId":null},{"id":444770,"label":"Preserve Organ","description":"

You touch an organ or detached body part and flood it with necromanctic energy. The body part becomes preserved from decay, blood loss or other natural changes for the duration. It remains in the exact state it is currently in (i.e. a heart that is still beating remains beating, or a dried up kidney remains dry).

\r\n

This spell has no effect on the body parts of celestials, oozes or constructs. If attempting to cast this spell on the body part of a dragon, fey or fiend, the caster must first succeed on an Intelligence(Arcana) check where the DC is the creature's Challenge Rating.

","sourceId":null},{"id":448254,"label":"Remote-Control Drone","description":"

A small magically powered mechanical drone comes to life and travels to a point that you specify. The drone has enough energy to act for the duration or until you command it to return as an action. The drone immediately powers down if it is ever more than 30 feet from you.

\r\n

You can use your action to control the drone. You can use the drone to manipulate an object, open an unlocked door or container, stow or retrieve an item from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. You can move the drone up to 30 feet each time you use it.  You can see what the drone sees by using an interface in your tinker's tools.

\r\n

The hand can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

","sourceId":null},{"id":448341,"label":"Drone Worklights","description":"

You activate up to four magically-powered tiny drones that ascend into the air from where they were stored and hover for the duration.

\r\n

Each drone can emit a dimmable light in any of the following configurations:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • A dimly illuminated 10-foot radius
    • \r\n
  • A well-illuminated 30-foot cone
    • \r\n
  • A spotlight with a 5-foot radius at a range of up to 60 feet
    • \r\n
\r\n

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the drones up to 60 feet to a new spot within range. A drone must be within 20 feet of another drone created by this spell, and a drone powers down if it exceeds the spell's range.

","sourceId":null},{"id":459077,"label":"Sapping Sting (Homebrew)","description":"

You sap the vitality of one creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 necrotic damage and fall prone.
