\r\n

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can’t see the area when the spell is cast must take a Search action and succeed on a Wisdom (Perception or Survival) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619080,"label":"Darkness","description":"

For the duration, magical Darkness spreads from a point within range and fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere. Darkvision can’t see through it, and nonmagical light can’t illuminate it.

\r\n

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the Darkness to fill a 15-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the Darkness.

\r\n

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Bright Light or Dim Light created by a spell of level 2 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619082,"label":"Darkvision","description":"

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619099,"label":"Detect Thoughts","description":"

You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

\r\n

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

\r\n

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

\r\n

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

\r\n

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an Intelligence (Arcana) check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619101,"label":"Suggestion","description":"

You suggest a course of activity—described in no more than 25 words—to one creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must sound achievable and not involve anything that would obviously deal damage to the target or its allies. For example, you could say, “Fetch the key to the cult’s treasure vault, and give the key to me.” Or you could say, “Stop fighting, leave this library peacefully, and don’t return.”

\r\n

The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the Charmed condition for the duration or until you or your allies deal damage to the target. The Charmed target pursues the suggestion to the best of its ability. The suggested activity can continue for the entire duration, but if the suggested activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends for the target upon completing it.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619116,"label":"Invisibility","description":"

A creature you touch has the Invisible condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

\r\n

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619124,"label":"Nystul's Magic Aura","description":"

With a touch, you place an illusion on a willing creature or an object that isn’t being worn or carried. A creature gains the Mask effect below, and an object gains the False Aura effect below. The effect lasts for the duration. If you cast the spell on the same target every day for 30 days, the illusion lasts until dispelled.

\r\n

Mask (Creature). Choose a creature type other than the target’s actual type. Spells and other magical effects treat the target as if it were a creature of the chosen type.

\r\n

False Aura (Object). You change the way the target appears to spells and magical effects that detect magical auras, such as Detect Magic. You can make a nonmagical object appear magical, make a magic item appear nonmagical, or change the object’s aura so that it appears to belong to a school of magic you choose.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619133,"label":"Misty Step","description":"

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619134,"label":"Moonbeam","description":"

A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, Dim Light fills the Cylinder, and you can take a Magic action on later turns to move the Cylinder up to 60 feet.

\r\n

When the Cylinder appears, each creature in it makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 Radiant damage, and if the creature is shape-shifted (as a result of the Polymorph spell, for example), it reverts to its true form and can’t shape-shift until it leaves the Cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A creature also makes this save when the spell’s area moves into its space and when it enters the spell’s area or ends its turn there. A creature makes this save only once per turn.

\r\n

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 2.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619137,"label":"Gust of Wind","description":"

A Line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the duration. Each creature in the Line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the Line. A creature that ends its turn in the Line must make the same save.

\r\n

Any creature in the Line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

\r\n

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

\r\n

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can change the direction in which the Line blasts from you.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619145,"label":"Heat Metal","description":"

Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 Fire damage when you cast the spell. \r\n

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for each spell slot level above 2.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619170,"label":"Enlarge/Reduce","description":"

For the duration, the spell enlarges or reduces a creature or an object you can see within range (see the chosen effect below). A targeted object must be neither worn nor carried. If the target is an unwilling creature, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the spell has no effect.

\r\n

Everything that a targeted creature is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item it drops returns to normal size at once. A thrown weapon or piece of ammunition returns to normal size immediately after it hits or misses a target.

\r\n

Enlarge. The target’s size increases by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. The target also has Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target’s attacks with its enlarged weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal an extra 1d4 damage on a hit.

\r\n

Reduce. The target’s size decreases by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. The target also has Disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target’s attacks with its reduced weapons or Unarmed Strikes deal 1d4 less damage on a hit (this can’t reduce the damage below 1).

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619192,"label":"Enthrall","description":"

You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that you can see within range to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature you or your companions are fighting automatically succeeds on this save. On a failed save, a target has a −10 penalty to Wisdom (Perception) checks and Passive Perception until the spell ends.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619203,"label":"Warding Bond","description":"

You touch another creature that is willing and create a mystic connection between you and the target until the spell ends. While the target is within 60 feet of you, it gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws, and it has Resistance to all damage. Also, each time it takes damage, you take the same amount of damage.

\r\n

The spell ends if you drop to 0 Hit Points or if you and the target become separated by more than 60 feet. It also ends if the spell is cast again on either of the connected creatures.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619208,"label":"Web","description":"

You conjure a mass of sticky webbing at a point within range. The webs fill a 20-foot Cube there for the duration. The webs are Difficult Terrain, and the area within them is Lightly Obscured.

\r\n

If the webs aren’t anchored between two solid masses (such as walls or trees) or layered across a floor, wall, or ceiling, the web collapses on itself, and the spell ends at the start of your next turn. Webs layered over a flat surface have a depth of 5 feet.

\r\n

The first time a creature enters the webs on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the Restrained condition while in the webs or until it breaks free.

\r\n

A creature Restrained by the webs can take an action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer Restrained.

\r\n

The webs are flammable. Any 5-foot Cube of webs exposed to fire burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 Fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

","sourceId":148},{"id":2619221,"label":"Zone of Truth","description":"

You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there makes a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether a creature succeeds or fails on this save.

\r\n

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive yet must be truthful.

","sourceId":148},{"id":14482,"label":"Mind Spike","description":"

You reach into the mind of one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, you also always know the target’s location until the spell ends, but only while the two of you are on the same plane of existence. While you have this knowledge, the target can’t become hidden from you, and if it’s invisible, it gains no benefit from that condition against you.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":27},{"id":721187,"label":"Summon Beast","description":"

You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Bestial Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature resembles an animal of your choice that is native to the chosen environment, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

\r\n

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

\r\n
\r\n

Bestial Spirit

\r\n

Small beast

\r\n

Armor Class 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

\r\n

Hit Points 20 (Air only) or 30 (Land and Water only) + 5 for each spell level above 2nd

\r\n

Speed 30 ft.; climb 30 ft. (Land only); fly 60 ft. (Air only); swim 30 ft. (Water only)

\r\n

Senses darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

\r\n

Languages understands the languages you speak

\r\n

Challenge — Proficiency Bonus equals your bonus

\r\n

Flyby (Air Only). The beast doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

\r\n

Pack Tactics (Land and Water Only). The beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

\r\n

Water Breathing (Water Only). The beast can breathe only underwater.

\r\n

Actions

\r\n

Multiattack. The beast makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell’s level (rounded down).

\r\n

Maul. Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell’s level piercing damage.

\r\n
","sourceId":67},{"id":2485,"label":"Transference","description":"

This spell will transfer the magical properties of one permanent magic item owned by the caster to another permanent magic item also owned by the caster. This is a permanent transference. All abilities and magic will be transferred from one item to the other, leaving the item from which the magic properties came from, mundane.

","sourceId":null},{"id":3973,"label":"Alchemical Transmutation","description":"

You magically transform a potion you touch into a magic potion of the same rarity level.

\n

When the spell is cast, you must pass an Intelligence check to determine if the transformation was successful. The DC for the check is determined by the rarity of the potion you are attempting to transmute. Characters proficient with Alchemists' tools may add their proficiency bonus. On a failure, the potion loses its effect and becomes an inert vile of foul-tasting water. Attempting to make a \"blend\" is possible, but the check is made with disadvantage. The player still rolls on the potion miscibility table (DMG p. 140) as normal.

\n

Common- DC 10
Uncommon- DC 15
Rare- DC 20
Very Rare- DC 25
Legendary- DC 30

","sourceId":null},{"id":4062,"label":"Chilling Scythe","description":"

You create a scythe of necrotic energy in your free hands. The scythe is similar in size and shape to an agricultural scythe, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the scythe, it disappears, but you can create the scythe again as a bonus action.

\r\n

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the necrotic scythe. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage.

\r\n

If you hit an undead target wit the necrotic scythe, it also must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you in a straight line.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":4146,"label":"Assimilate Knowledge","description":"

You place your hand on a book or some other collection of written text for 1 minute. During this time, you magically draw the essence of the text and copy it into your mind. Once the spell is complete, the book is unchanged but you mentally retain a visually identical copy of the images and text contained within the book, of up to 500 pages.

\n

Any text written in a language you know becomes immediately familiar to you as if you had read each page recently, but not thoroughly.

\n

Regardless of the language, you also understand which important topics are covered in the text as well as the names of important characters and locations. In addition, you understand the basic structure of the book, as if you had read a table of contents and index in a language you know.

\n

Any time after assimilating a text, you can identically write out the entire book or specific pages as they appeared in the original, even if it was written in a language you do not know. Doing so requires proper inks and parchment, as well as approximately 10 minutes per page and between 2 and 8 hours per image. Any magical properties of the original text cannot be replicated, such as text from a wizard's spellbook, a spell scroll, or a magical tome.

","sourceId":null},{"id":5024,"label":"Life Transfer","description":"

You draw on a target's life force to bolster another's. Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 necrotic damage, and another target within range regains hit points equal to the amount of damage dealt.

\n

At Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d8 per spell level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":5704,"label":"Muggler's Dwarven Wall","description":"

You conjure up to 150 solid stones that form a single contiguous shape (IE a wall 15ft x 10ft high). The stones are each no more than 1 cubic foot and fit together tightly as if made by the finest Dwarven masons in a single formation the caster chooses and require a base strong enough to support their weight. Stone edges will magically conform perfectly and snuggly to the shape of any floor, roof or wall placed against. The stones are not cemented together but are dry fit and creatures of sufficient size and ability can destroy the formation; large creatures attacking it can topple 4 stones per turn, medium creatures can topple 2 stones per turn, small creatures cannot topple it. Large and medium creatures passing an intelligence check can dismantle the formation at double the rate per turn if the are not attacked and spend their turn carefully dismantling it. If the formation remains undisturbed (no stones moved, destroyed or removed) the caster may through concentration maintain the formation for up to 1 hour, otherwise the formation dissipates in 10 minutes (without requiring concentration). 

\r\n

The stones can be formed into any simple contiguous shape the caster desires provided it can stand on it's own and is made of stones no larger than 1 cubic foot:
- A small arched bridge sufficient to span a distance of no more than 15ft capable of holding 2 horses and riders.
- A circle 10ft high large enough to surround a medium sized creature.
- A wall with cut-out arrow slits.
- A stone staircase up to 8ft high.

\r\n

The stones fit together so well that formations not disturbed by an attacking creature are water and air tight. The formation can be cast with holes in it to climb or attack through but the holes count towards the total dimensions. 

\r\n

If cast by a Dwarf an extra 50 stones are added to the base spell but no extra time is added.

","sourceId":null},{"id":6608,"label":"Regenerate","description":"

Miraculous Necromancy from the Codex of Life. The use of this spell in a campaign assumes that there is a possibility of suffering various forms of permanent injuries that may require medical care or magical healing.

\r\n

You remove one permanent injury from a creature you touch, the injury can be a broken bone, infected wound, dislocated shoulder or a traumatic brain injury. Other injuries can also be removed at the Dungeon Master's discretion. Additionally the creature regains hit points equal to 2d6 + your spell casting ability modifier.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the hit points regained increases by 1d6 and you can remove one additional permanent injury from the creature. For each spell slot of 3rd level or higher the material cost increases by 10 gold pieces.

","sourceId":null},{"id":8783,"label":"Create Campsite","description":"

You create a squadron of tiny unseen servants that create a campsite for you and your companions. They will clear the land of debris, set up tents and bedrolls, start a fire, fetch water and even begin cooking (although they are not particularly good cooks). They cannot create the materials needed for the campsite; the can only use what is available to them in the immediate area and what you and your companions have brought. These servants have no other abilities.

\r\n

Appears in the complete Tome of Spells.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":8909,"label":"Abi-Dalzim's Toxic Fumes","description":"

A line of billowing gas 30 feet long and 5 feet wide emanates from you in a direction you choose.  Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw.  On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 poison damage and is poisoned for 1 round.  On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.  A creature that doesn't need to breathe is immune to this spell, and a creature that is holding its breath when you cast the spell has advantage on the saving throw. 

\r\n

At Higher Levels.  When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":14303,"label":"Necrotic Weaving","description":"

 You empower an ally's attack with necrotic energy. The damage for the  targeted strike deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage. In addition the creature that takes this necrotic damage cannot be healed until the end of your next turn.

\r\n

At higher levels: When you use a spell slot of 3rd level or higher the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot used above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":14439,"label":"Dewyck's Alchemical Assistant","description":"

The casting of this ritual during the practice of alchemy will provide advantage on any check made for the use of Alchemical Supplies.  Sources of questionable reputation have reported that this spell may also be of use while making poisons and herbalist's concoctions.

\r\n

If cast using a 3rd level spell slot, the caster may target an individual engaged in the alchemical arts other than themselves.

\r\n

If cast using a 4th level spell slot, the caster may target any two individuals engaged in the alchemical arts.

","sourceId":null},{"id":14466,"label":"Decaying Smite","description":"

The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during the spell's duration, your weapon is cloaked in dark shadows, and the attack deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target and eats away at the wound. The target must make a Constitution Saving Throw or become unable to heal by any means for the remainder of the spells duration or until you lose concentration.

\r\n

Casting this spell at a higher level adds an additional 1d6 necrotic damage per level above level 2.

","sourceId":null},{"id":14543,"label":"Visceral Mending","description":"

Manipulating the blood of a wounded creature, you force a surge of blood outwards which rapidly clots the creature's open flesh. The target of this spell immediately suffers 1d4 points of damage from the sudden loss of blood, at the start of that creature's next turn, they regain 2d12 plus your spellcasting modifier in Hit Points. As more blood must be spilled to mend the wound, this spell will not function on creatures that do not have some manner of vascular system such as undead or constructs, and one must be careful that the shock does not incapacitate the recipient with the immediate surge of blood.

\r\n

For every level you cast this spell above 2nd, the magnitude of the healing received increases by 1d12; as does the immediate suffered damage, which increases by 1d4.

","sourceId":null},{"id":17477,"label":"Pass through Shadow","description":"

You become as shadow and are able to move through darkness and shadows at great speed. When casting this spell, choose a location within 60 feet that you can see that is located in darkness or shadow. Your body disappates into shadow and dashes towards the chosen location, where it reappears. While moving as a shadow, you have no physical form and are able to squeeze through small openings.

","sourceId":null},{"id":20604,"label":"Bliss","description":"

Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you. A creature charmed by this spell is lost in a trance of extreme happiness for the duration. It is incapacitated and must roll a d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn.

\r\n
\r\n

D10 - Behavior

\r\n
    \r\n
  • 1 - The creature begins singing, and roll again.
    • \r\n
  • 2 - The creature begins crying, and roll again.
    • \r\n
  • 3 - The creature begins laughing, and roll again.
    • \r\n
  • 4 - The creature begins muttering about a nonsensical topic, and roll again.
    • \r\n
  • 5-6 - The creature drops everything it’s carrying and begins drooling.
    • \r\n
  • 7-8 - The creature moves half its speed in a random direction, wide-eyed.
    • \r\n
  • 9 - The creature lies down and curls up in a fetal position.
    • \r\n
  • 10 - The creature drops to its knees and stares into the sky.
    • \r\n
\r\n
\r\n

At the end of each of its turns and each time the target takes damage, it can attempt another Wisdom saving throw, ending the spell for that target with a success. The target cannot recall any events it experienced while under the effects of this spell other than its euphoria. As a cleric spell, this spell is exclusive to clerics of Lliira and those with the Trickery domain.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

","sourceId":null},{"id":23782,"label":"Forget","description":"

You affect the short-term memories of a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or completely forget what transpired during the last minute, as if waking up from a dream. The spell does not affect a person’s abilities, only their recent memories. Forget in no way negates any charm, suggestions, geases, quests, or similar spells, but it is possible that the creature who caused such magic to be placed upon the victim of a forget spell could be forgotten by this means.

\r\n

A greater restoration spell restores the lost memories.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of forgotten minutes increases by 1d4 for each spell slot above 3rd level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":25018,"label":"Arcane Evasion","description":"

When an attack you can see is made against you or an event such as a trap, hazard or spell occurs that would require you to make a Dexterity save you may use your Reaction to cast this spell. When you do time slows just for a few moments for you to select an occupied space you can see within 30 feet of you and when you do you are instantly teleported to that space. If that space is away from the triggering event or is not within the targeted space of the triggering attack you evade it and are completely unharmed.

\r\n

This spell requires you to have the ability to make a step - a small start of movement that forms the somatic component of the spell, so unless you have the means to eschew the somatic component (such as a Sorcerer's Suble Spell Metamagic) you must have have a speed greater than 0 and not be Restrained.

\r\n

Channeling the magics in this way and using such dimensional magics - manipulating space and the flow of time - in a single moment is very taxing on the body. After using this spell you suffer 1 level of Exhaustion. This spell cannot be cast if you have 2 or more levels of Exhaustion.

","sourceId":null},{"id":35830,"label":"Augment Familiar","description":"

You touch your familiar and empower it, making it quicker and stronger.

\r\n

Your familiar's speed, hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and gains resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. 

\r\n

The spell has no effect on other creatures.

","sourceId":null},{"id":40818,"label":"Age/Rewind Plant","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)
Duration: Determined by caster: up to 10 minutes / level, or up to 20 minutes / level if reversed
Area of Effect: 100 sq ft / level

\r\n

Age Plant:
When this spell is cast, it manipulates time to accelerate the aging of plants. This does not allow them to grow beyond their maximum natural size. The area of effect is up to a maximum of 100 square feet per caster's level, and the spell can affect all plant life or be limited to affect only one category (eg. \"trees\") or one species (eg. \"wheat\") of plant in that area. The caster can accelerate the growth of plant life by up to one month per level. The actual amount of aging (to the nearst week) must be decided before the spell is cast. Aging occurs at a rate of 1 month of aging every 10 minutes of time passed. If the normal cycle of the plant is exceeded (for a seasonal crop or biannual flower), the plant life withers and dies. This spell is particularly useful when early winters or harsh summers threaten crop yields.

\r\n

A material component is necessary only if the caster wishes to affect a single category or species of plant. A sample of that plant type is then required.

\r\n

Rewind Plant:
The reverse of this spell, Rewind Plant, cannot bring back plants that have completely died. It can reverse the aging of live plants by up to one month per level of the caster, the total age rewound being set before the spell is cast. Reverse aging occurs at a rate of 1 month of de-aging every 20 minutes of time passed. A popular use of this form is to get second harvests, but this can only be done with plants that persist year round (fruit trees, berry bushes).

\r\n

The same rules on material components apply.

\r\n

Based on the 2e AD&D spell Accelerate Plant Growth, from the Chronomancer suppliment (TSR 9506).

","sourceId":null},{"id":40820,"label":"Age/Rewind Object","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

Age Object:
As the caster focuses on the object or area, they determine a volume in cubic inches they wish to affect.  Every second they concentrate, the non-living material inside the volume either ages or moves through time at a rate of (caster level x 1000) / (2 x cubic volume) days per second.  An example here would be an 8-cubic-inch padlock aged by a level 3 caster for a full 5 minutes would advance a maximum of ~150 years.  A level 20 caster doing the same would advance it ~1000 years.  A level 20 caster attempting to age a child-sized statue (2500 cubic inches) for 5 minutes would age it 800 days.
NOTE: The minimum dimension that can be used in this calculation is 1/2 an inch, so a 8.5 x 11 inch piece of paper, for example, which normally has a thickness of 0.004 inches, can at the very least be calculated as 8.5 x 11 x 0.5 inches, yielding 46.75 cubic inches, NOT 8.5 x 11 x 0.004 inches, which would have yielded 0.374 cubic inches.

\r\n

Rewind Object:
Attempting to reverse the age of the item instead yields half the results.  This spell only works on non-living material, as time potential is much greater (and thus harder to alter) where living beings are involved (even more so as their agency or potential for influence increases).

\r\n

Casting Modes:
There are two \"modes\", or mind-frames, in which this spell may be cast.  It is simplest to think about this difference in the following way: cast the spell targeting a volume of MATTER, or cast the spell targeting a volume of SPACE.

\r\n

In the former case, the subjective and causal passage of time from the matter's perspective is altered.  Time begins to accelerate, causing the reactions, wear and tear, loss or expenditure, and increase of entropy to affect the matter itself.  Metal could rust, and crumble.  Bread could mold, flowers wither, silver tarnish, a lit log burn to charcoal, etc.  In the reverse form, the spell causes the subjective flow of time to be reversed, rust or broken metal reforming and renewing, moldy food returning to freshness, dead flowers returning, etc.  This is the only \"safe\" form in which this spell can be cast (base 0% chance of a disturbance to the demiplane of time, no chance of paradox), and this is the only functionality this spell can ever have if cast by any magic user other than a Chronomancer (who do not understand the far more advanced details of space and time's codependent relationship).

\r\n

In the latter case, a fixed volume of space is focused upon and -like the window on a slide-rule- is temporally slid forward or backward through time.  This region of space can be anything the Chronomancer decides; the space bounded by a wine bottle, or by a window frame, or immediately surrounding a page of paper, for example.  The contents within the volume of space change to reflect what WAS/WILL BE inside that space at the point in time the spell moves the slider to.  Words on a page that are most likely to be written may appear if sliding forward; or if already written, will disappear if rolled far enough back.  A seemingly-\"empty\" region of space, such as a shattered window-frame, may suddenly fill with intact glass if rolled back to a point when they were undamaged; or if rolled forward, a perfectly fine window may shatter because a rock will be thrown through it in the future (or, may stay completely intact, just gaining some grime, if nothing ever goes on to break the window in the future...)

\r\n

Higher Level Slots:
For each level of spell slot expended above level 2, add another effective caster level when calculating effect, and increase chance of temporal disturbance to the demiplane of time by 5%

\r\n

This spell is an original work.

","sourceId":null},{"id":40825,"label":"Lifeline Ping","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Divination)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

When Lifeline Ping is cast, the caster establishes a temporary link to the subject's lifeline. A magical pulse is sent along the line in both directions, reflecting back whenever it reaches the points of the recipient's birth and death. Using the echo principle, the caster acquires a general idea of the length of the lifeline in each direction. If the subject's age is known or can be guessed, it is then a simple matter of calculating the ratios to discover with fair accuracy how much life the person has left.

\r\n

After 6th level, the caster acquires an innate feeling for the spell's mystical echo and can instantly know the subject's age, as well as how much life it has left, without having to make any calculations.

\r\n

Note that creatures who have traveled through time have incontinuous lifelines as a result of their travels, and this spell will only yield the length of time that creature existed in reality after returning from their last trip through time, and before next departing through time again in the future.

\r\n

A saving throw is not permitted, but physical contact must be maintained throughout the casting. The subject would have to either be a willing participant, or be unable to struggle away.

\r\n

The material component necessary for a Life Sounding is an unblemished silver weight on a 1-foot length of silver chain. The weight must be replaced with a fresh silver weight after every casting.

\r\n

Based on 2e AD&D spell Life Sounding, from the Chronomancer suppliment (TSR 9506).

","sourceId":null},{"id":40826,"label":"Decelerate Creatures","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

You slightly inhibit the flow of time around up to six target creatures in a 40-foot cube.  Each of these targets must succeed on a Wisdom save or be affected by the spell.

\r\n

Each affected target has their movement speed reduced by half, −2 to AC and to Dexterity saves, and cannot use any Reactions. During each victim's turn, they must choose between using an action or a bonus action, instead of using both. Affected victims can also only use a single melee or ranged attack each round, while the spells is in effect.

\r\n

Affected spellcasters who attempt to cast a spell with casting time of 1 action must roll a d20. If the result is an 11 or higher, the spell completion (and effect) is delayed until the caster's next turn, and ANOTHER action must be spent on that turn in order to complete the spell. If an action cannot be used in this way, or all actions are spent performing other actions on that following turn, then the spell is wasted.

\r\n

Affected victims are allowed an additional Wisdom save at the end of each turn. If successful, they break free of the effect, though the spell continues to effect all other victims.

\r\n

This spell is similar to a common 3rd level wizard spell, except that it differs in the exact implementation of the effect, and is available to the practitioners of Chronomancy as a 2nd level spell, due to the caster's advanced grasp of time manipulation.

","sourceId":null},{"id":40828,"label":"Timeslip","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)
Casting Time - 3 rounds + 1 round / extra target

\r\n

By means of a Timeslip, the barrier between reality and the demiplane of time is thinned, and the caster instantly slips between the two. Any creatures intending to attack someone who manages to Timeslip away beforehand lose their attacks for that round.

\r\n

Slipping into the demiplane of time places the caster and his companions immediately downstream of their lifelines (add one round to the casting time for each companion). Lifelines trail off into the silver mist that surrounds them. If there is heavy turbulence in the area, the travelers are displaced slightly so that they are relatively safe.

\r\n

When casting Timeslip from within the demiplane of time in order to slip back into reality, the caster must focus on a lifeline to make the connection with reality. The caster ends up somewhere within 1d10 miles of the creature whom the lifeline corresponds to. This feature also helps a caster who wishes to intersect their fate with that of the owner of a specific lifeline.

\r\n

All that the caster (and any additional target) is wearing or carrying slips with them, up to a maximum of 25 pounds per level. Unwilling targets make a Wisdom save to negate the entire spell and cancel the slip.

\r\n

The material components for this spell are a diaphanous square of fine silk and a small piece of basalt.

\r\n

Based on the 2e AD&D spell of the same name, from the Chronomancer suppliment (TSR 9506).

","sourceId":null},{"id":40831,"label":"Time Trigger","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)
Duration: 1 day* / caster level ; * - Higher spell slots increase the unit of time used for the duration; see below

\r\n

The caster affixes a single target object of Small size or smaller in time for the duration of the spell. Momentum, thermal energy, electrical potential, etc are all preserved as well. The item cannot be moved or otherwise interacted with. It behaves as though an indestructible, immovable rod. At the time of casting, the caster determines a trigger that will end the spell early. It can be simple something like a password or gesture, or it could be as complex as a specific person attempting to interact with the object at just the right time in history (think Excalibur in the stone). It can be used to secure one's belongings for a duration, like a temporal lock box, or to set up a parameter trap to guard a sleeping camp, to preserve some perishable or other package until just the right recipient comes to claim it, etc. Arrows in flight, bombs mid-explosion, or other such items can be frozen with this spell such that their destructive energy is released upon trigger, making an effective trap. The trigger can be set to activate out to a distance of 15 feet from the object. A successful Dispel Magic, or similar spell, cast by a spellcaster of higher level than the caster was at time of casting can also terminate the effect.

\r\n

The material component necessary is a tiny ornate hourglass worth at least 50 gp, which must be irrecoverably smashed at the time of casting.

\r\n

At Higher Levels:
For every 2 spell slot levels higher than normal used to cast this spell, the maximum size of the object affected is increased by one size category, up to a maximum of Huge, while simultaneously, every 3 levels of spell slot used to cast above normal increases the time units of duration by one category.
2nd level spell slot - Maximum target size of Small, for 1 day per caster level
4th level spell slot - Maximum target size of Medium, for 1 day per caster level
5th level spell slot - Maximum target size of Medium, for 1 week per caster level
6th level spell slot - Maximum target size of Large, for 1 week per caster level
8th level spell slot - Maximum target size of Huge, for 1 month per caster level

\r\n

Additionally, spell slot levels may be increased to extend the duration. For every level increase that isn't used for increasing target size category, duration units of time go up one category:
+1 spell slot level - Days to Weeks, Weeks to Months, Months to Years, and finally to a maximum of Years to Decades.

\r\n

This scaling may be used in conjunction with the size scaling, but each portion of the spell slot's level will only apply to one or the other.  For example, a 6th level spell slot may either be used to affect a Large object for 1 week per caster level (2 levels to cast the spell, 4 levels applied to size only), to affect a Medium object for 1 month per caster level (2 levels to cast the spell, 3 levels applied to size, 1 to duration), or to affect a Small object for 1 decade per caster level (2 levels to cast the spell, 4 levels applied to duration only), etc.

\r\n

This spell is an original work.

","sourceId":null},{"id":41250,"label":"Spatial Incontinuity","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

A forced error in spacetime.  You were there... suddenly now you're here.  You are now occupying a space that you could see, up to 20 feet from your starting space.  If that space was already occupied by a movable object or a creature, you traded places with them, and they now reside in your starting square.

\r\n

This spell is an original work.

","sourceId":null},{"id":41546,"label":"Burrow Trick","description":"

You touch the ground and an underground area becomes accessible through an invisible entrance at the point you touched. 

\r\n

The underground space can be reached by crawling through the invisible entrance. The space can hold as many as eight Medium or smaller creatures. The entrance will be visible only from inside the space. 

\r\n

Attacks and spells can't cross through the entrance into or out of the underground space, but those inside can see out of it as if through a 3-foot-by-5- foot window centered on the entrance.

\r\n

Anything inside the underground space is expelled when the spell ends.

","sourceId":null},{"id":44035,"label":"Lesser Paralysis","description":"

You cause a creature temporary paralysis by tensing its musculature so as to cause a short period of paralysis. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs or creatures immune to the paralyzed condition. This spell also has no effect on creatures that lack a musculature, such as oozes. Make a melee attack using your spellcasting attack modifier, if it hits the creature must make a constitution saving throw with disadvantage. If the creature fails on the saving throw they are paralyzed for 3 rounds and take 2d10s of psychic damage. Otherwise the target takes 3d6s of psychic damage on a successful save.

","sourceId":null},{"id":46158,"label":"Gravity Warp","description":"

You distort the pull of gravity on an object. Touch a medium or smaller object that is not being worn or carried. For the duration, it is considered to be half of its normal weight. Furthermore, if it falls, it does so at a rate of 120 meters per round, taking half damage upon landing. Alternatively, you may increase the weight of the object. If you do so, it is considered to be twice as heavy as normal, and falls twice as quickly. If it does fall, it takes twice as much damage from the impact.

A creature that you can see within range gets some of is vitality drained and transfered to another creature of your choice.

\r\n

The target creature must suceed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer 2d6 necrotic damamge. On a save the creature suffers only half as much damage. The life force will then be transfered to another creature you can see within 30 feet of the initial target. Such creature heals as many hit points as the necrotic damage suffered by the initial target.

\r\n

This spell has no effect on constructs and undeads.

\r\n

","sourceId":null},{"id":55126,"label":"Navigation","description":"

For the next twenty four hours you know the precise direction to one place you have visited before. The place must be within 100 miles at the time of casting and on the same plane that the caster is on. The spell doesn't tell you the route to take. If the caster changes the place, falls unconscious, sleeps, or dispels it the spell ends.

\r\n

If casted at a higher level it extends the distance by 100 miles per spell slot above 2nd level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":56761,"label":"Dismember","description":"

As a reaction, after an Ally uses a melee attack against a target, You project an illusion into the mind of the target that makes them believe one of their appendages has been cut off by the Ally. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the Ally for the duration.

\r\n

While frightened by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from the Ally by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of on your ally,The  frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

","sourceId":null},{"id":59517,"label":"The Artisan's Nest","description":"

As you concentrate on a specific Crafting or Artisan's skill you are proficient on and envision everything needed for a project of that craft, a 10-foot-cube workstation of force springs into existence around you. The workstation (common) has all necessary tools for a common quality project conveniently and ergonomically organized. You may touch another creature proficient with a Crafting or Artisan's skill, even if you don't have it, to canalyze your energy building the workstation around the target for its needs.

\r\n

Creatures within the workstation and proficient on the appropriate Artisan's Tools have advantage on their Strength and Dexterity Crafting Checks.

\r\n

The workstation may be a forge, alchemist laboratory, cooking table and furnace, etc. All tools are magical and unbreakable (unless they're supposed to break) and are slightly transparent. They instantly fade if removed from the area of the workstation but may be used to attack within the area using the appropriate proficiency and stats of similar object (mostly \"improvised weapon\").

\r\n

Once the spell ends, every tool and material created by the spell fades from existance unless the caster use up the last minutes to cast it again prolonging it for more 8 hours. The spell also ends if its caster moves away from 120-foot-radius around the workstation.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both the workstation's quality improves one rank and its radius increases 5 ft for each level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":61605,"label":"Elgrim's Elemental Guide","description":"

You create a small summoning circle on the ground, place your ritual components inside, and perform the spell. Upon completion, you summon a Tiny elemental from a plane you specify while casting, or the DM chooses an appropriate elemental. For the next 8 hours, unless the elemental takes damage or is dismissed by casting the spell again, you gain advantage all Survival checks made to navigate through the terrain appropriate to the elemental.

\r\n

For example, you can summon a tiny water elemental to aid with navigation on or under water, or summon an earth elemental to aid in navigation through natural caverns or mountains.

  • Your melee attacks count as magical and deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage.
    • \r\n
  • You regain half of the necrotic damage done by this spell in temporary hit points.

","sourceId":null},{"id":72930,"label":"Meat Puppet","description":"

Target one creature that you can see within range and attempt to bind it's limbs with necrotic magic. It must make a constitution saving throw, on a fail the spell takes hold. Creatures immune to being charmed, without limbs or with incorporeal bodies are unaffected by the spell.

\r\n

While under the effects of the spell a creatures movement appears more jerky than usual and they feel an unpleasant crawling sensation beneath the skin.

\r\n

You can use your bonus action to force all creatures effected by the spell to suddenly strike them selves for 1d4 bludgeoning + 1d4 necrotic damage.

\r\n

When a creature effected by your spell makes an attack you can use your reaction to influence the target. The creature must make a constitution check contested by your intelligence or charisma (your choice). If you succeed you choose a new target within range. A redirected attack deals half damage. The new target can be the creature that made the attack. If the contest is a tie, a random target within range is chosen by the DM.

\r\n

On the end of it's turn an effected creature can make a constitution saving throw. On a successful save the creature shrugs off your control. The spell ends when no more creatures are under it's effect (or you lose concentration).

\r\n

At Higher Levels. For each slot level above 2nd both of kinds damage increases by 1d4. For every two slot levels above 2nd you can target one additional creature (levels 4th, 6th and 8th).

","sourceId":null},{"id":74632,"label":"Shield of Will","description":"

You exert the full force of your will against all incoming attacks. A transparent field of distorted force snaps into existence along the outside of your forearm. It is the size of a shield, and can be manifested in any 2-dimensional shaped you desire. This force field is weightless, moving with your arm, and provides a +3 AC bonus while it is wielded.

\r\n

As a Reaction, you may use this force field to automatically deflect an incoming ranged weapon or spell attack that targets you. If you do, this spell ends, and the force field dissipates.

\r\n

If you use your Action to make a melee attack with your other hand, you may use a Bonus Action to make a melee attack to bash with this force field. The field inflicts 1d6 Force damage on impact.

\r\n

At Higher Levels.  When you cast this spell using a 4th-level spell slot, the AC bonus increases to +4, and the bash damage increases to 2d6.  When you cast it using a 6th-level spell slot, the AC bonus increases to +5, and the bash damage increases to 3d6.

","sourceId":null},{"id":77888,"label":"Arcane Sticky Grenade ","description":"

The Knock spell is can be used to pick locks and open pathways. However, blowing up the lock and destroying barricades can also open pathways. This spell does the later.

\r\n

When you cast this spell, you must hold a iron block in your outstretched hand.  Once cast you must either throw or drop the iron block or touch a solid surface with iron block. These count as being part of the action you used to cast the spell and so don't require any additional actions or bonus actions. The iron block will then stick to the surface you touched with it or the first solid surface it touches after you threw it. If you fail to throw or drop the iron bar or touch a solid surface with it when casting the spell, it will stick to your hand.

\r\n

The iron block does not stick to anything (but it can still explode) if it is submerged in liquid. A creature can use an action to make a DC17 STR check to remove the iron block from the surface it is stuck to. Once removed, the bar loses its stickiness but not it's explosive capabilities.

\r\n

After the spell has been cast, you may use a bonus action or a reaction to cause the iron block to explode. On your turn, you can also use an action to remove the spell. In this case, the block becomes a normal iron block and so the material component is not consumed. To detonate the block you must be within 200ft of it. You are not required to be in this range if you wish to remove the spell. If you neither detonate the block or remove the spell, the block will explode automatically after 1 minute has passed since the spell was cast.

\r\n

When the iron block explodes, it damages everything in a 5ft radius from the block. Any creature in the blast radius must succeed a DEX save or take 4d6 Force damage. This spell does an additional 4d6 force damage to constructs and objects.

\r\n

If you wish to stick this iron bar to a creature, you must make an attack roll against the target using DEX as the ability modifier. The creature can use an action to make a DC17 STR check to remove the block from him. If the iron block is detonated while it is stuck to a creature, the creature automatically fails the DEX save associated with this spell and takes maximum damage.

\r\n

At higher levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of higher level, the damage done by the explosion increases by 1d6 for every level higher than 2nd. If you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher to cast this spell, then the blast radius increases from 5ft to 10ft in addition to the increased damage.

","sourceId":null},{"id":82105,"label":"Clean Air","description":"

You create a 20 foot sphere of pure air that removes all poison, fog, or other harmful air effects. This allows you to breathe where it would otherwise not be possible. This will not destroy water or materials. The spell effect ends if the radius is filled.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the pure air increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":83545,"label":"Twin Attack","description":"

The caster channels their magic into themselves and doubles their attack speed, granting them one extra attack.

","sourceId":null},{"id":88444,"label":"Pleural Infusion","description":"

You raise your hand, and your target’s lungs begin to fill with water. They must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 cold damage. On each of your turns, you can use your action to deal 1d12 cold damage automatically. While affected by the spell, the creature cannot speak, as it is functionally holding its breath in order not to drown. 

\r\n

The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else, lose concentration, or the target moves outside the range of the spell. The spell has no effect on constructs, the undead, or creatures that can breathe underwater.

","sourceId":null},{"id":94164,"label":"Merge with Shadows","description":"

Your body becomes ethereal and you can literally lurk within the shadows. As an action and while in an area of darkness, you can meld into a pool of shadows within 5 feet of you that is at least 10 feet long and an equal distance wide for the duration of the spell. You speed is reduced to 0, you are immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition, you have resistance to all Nonmagical damage, except radiant damage. Any attempts to cause you to become grappled or restrained automatically fail. You are undetectable, unless a light source causes the shadows you are in to disappear, which then you are shunted into the nearest unoccupied space and the effect is lost. The spell ends early if you take any action or if you take radiant damage.

At the end of each of its turns for the duration of the spell, that creature regains a amount of hit points equal to half your proficiency bonus. The spell ends early if the creature takes fire or acid damage before the spell ends. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

On a failed save, the creature is considered blinded, deafened, and unable to smell when it attempts to detect you. This spell ends early if you attack the affected creature or force it to make a saving throw.

","sourceId":null},{"id":100012,"label":"Unholy Transformation","description":"

Until the spell ends you transform yourself into a ghoul-like beast, your flesh peeling away and your nails becoming talons.

\r\n

When a beast, celestial, fey, giant, or humanoid type creature starts its turn within 5 ft. of you or when it moves to a space within 5 ft. of you for the first time on its turn, it must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the start of its next turn. If a creature successfully saves against the effect, it is immune for the next hour. In addition your unarmed strike deals 1d6 + ability score mod slashing damage, and has the finesse property. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":121664,"label":"Electrify Water","description":"

You pass electrical currents through a body of water or water-like liquid, potentially harming creatures that are within it. Choose a point in a body of liquid that you can see within range. Each creature touching the same body of liquid as the point must make a Constitution saving throw if they within 20-feet of the point. A creature that has a swimming speed makes this save with advantage. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 lightning damage and is paralyzed until the beginning of your next turn, or half as much damage and isn't paralyzed on a successful one.

","sourceId":null},{"id":132375,"label":"Appendage Growth - Blood Magic","description":"

You invoke a horrifying ritual of blood magic, causing a new arm to grow on a humanoid of your choice from the bone you use to cast this spell.

\r\n

The creature can use the arm appendage to make an unarmed melee attack as a bonus action. The attack deals 1d10 plus the target’s strength modifier bludgeoning damage when it hits.

\r\n

Additionally, the creature now has a climb speed equal to its walking speed and has advantage on all strength ability checks while the arm remains in place.

\r\n

When this spell ends, the flesh surrounding the bone that was used deteriorates over 1 round, leaving behind the bone. This spell ends early if the arm is removed from the body.

","sourceId":null},{"id":132697,"label":"Alacritic Casting","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

Rules Note: This spell is intended to allow the caster to ignore both the RAW restrictions and the errata ruling which, under normal circumstances, prevent more than one non-Cantrip spell from being cast per round.  While this spell is in effect, each Action, Reaction, and Bonus Action available to the caster each round may be used to cast a qualifying spell of any affected level.  Consult with your DM for a final ruling in your game.

\r\n

Alacritc Casting allows you to speed up the casting time of your spells of 5th level and lower. Only spells that are cast within Alacritic Casting's duration are affected. The end result of this is that you may use 2 Reactions total per turn so long as both Reactions are used only to cast Reaction-time spells of an effected level. You gain one additional Bonus Action per turn which may only be used to cast a Bonus-time spell of an effected level.  You also gain one additional Action per turn which may only be used to cast a spell of an effected level. Finally, the casting times for effected-level spells, whose normal casting times are longer than 1 Action, are reduced by 20%.

\r\n

Effect on Caster Per Round:
Normal amount of actions, and
+1 Bonus Action for a Bonus Action spell
+1 Reaction for a Reaction spell
+1 Reaction for a Reaction spell
+1 Action for any spell
Spells with casting time > 1 Action are reduced by 20% of original casting time

\r\n

The material component is a miniature hourglass which is destroyed when the spell is cast.

\r\n

At Higher Levels:
For every 2 additional levels of spell slot expended to cast this spell, spells of 1 level higher will be effected.  So, a 4th level slot will effect 6th level and lower spells; a 6th level slot will effect 7th level and lower spells; and an 8th level slot will effect 8th level and lower spells.

\r\n

Loosely inspired by a 2e AD&D Wizard spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":135878,"label":"Alatir’s Extradimensional Expansion","description":"

You touch the wall of a room no bigger than 20 feet by 20 feet.  The room becomes an extradimentional space and its interior triples in size.  Any nonmagical amenities in the room also triple (beds, wardrobes, chairs, etc.) for the duration but cannot leave the room.

\r\n

If this spell is cast on the same room every day for a year it becomes permanent.

\r\n

At higher levels this spell's room size maximum increases 10 feet by 10 feet for each level above 2nd.

\r\n
\r\n

\"This is your best room?!  No, no, I can make it work.  Just bring me a few more pillows alright?\" ~Alatir the Artisan

\r\n
\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":137619,"label":"Cosmic Workshop","description":"

You choose a 15-foot cube of empty space you can see within range. This area magically becomes an artisan's workshop of your choosing, complete with all of the tools necessary for basic crafting and repairs, though it does not contain any materials. None of the items created by this spell can be removed from the workshop. Additionally, any creature may enter the workshop and make use of it.

\r\n

The workshop disappears after 24 hours, leaving behind any items that were brought into it after its creation. Any items crafted using the workshop remain, and any changes or repairs made to items using the workshop's tools are permanent.

","sourceId":null},{"id":138613,"label":"Crippling Fatigue","description":"

You engulf the target in a black mass of tendrils that drains it's strength. The target must make a constitution saving throw. The target takes 2d6 necrotic damage or half as much on a successful save. On a failed save the target suffers a -2 penalty to dexterity, strength and constitution saving throws for 1 round.

\r\n

You may cast this spell if you have expended all your available spell slots by taking 1d4 necrotic damage as part of casting the spell. You may do this up to 4 times per long rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":139492,"label":"Invention - Hologram Multiplier","description":"

When you learn how to create this invention you always have this on you from then on. Components are needed for new batteries but the invention is already crafted. You have created an invention similar to a hologram projector. The invention can be activated with an action. When activated the invention creates three  illusory duplicates of yourself who appear in your space. Until the effect ends when the battery dies (1 minute), the duplicates move with you and mimic your actions, shifting position so it's impossible to track which image is real. You can use your action to dismiss the illusory duplicates.

\r\n

Each time a creature targets you with an attack during the effects duration, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates.

\r\n

If you have three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher to change the attack's target to a duplicate. With two duplicates, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one duplicate, you must roll an 11 or higher.

\r\n

A duplicate's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a duplicate, the duplicate fades away. A duplicate can be destroyed only by an attack that hits it. It ignores all other damage and effects. The spell ends when all three duplicates are destroyed.

\r\n

A creature is unaffected by this effect if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

\r\n

There is a motor sounds that makes it clear that this is an illusion when the invention is activated. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":141828,"label":"Lofiso's Esoteric Knowledge Search","description":"

Placing the focus on your forehead you speak aloud the word or subject you want searched and for the sake of the spell is known as the search term. You search the surrounding area for information, written or currently being spoken matching the search term. This spell searches the range for any information matching that search term, and in the case of more general subjects such as math use the searchers comprehension of what constitutes that subject to determine what is found. Upon finding more than one term a list of found results is projected into the user's mind allowing them to choose which result they wish to use. Upon choosing the result they will know the location of the information and any relevant information for finding the information such as page number or who was speaking it.

\r\n

 If a higher level spell slot is used the range increases by 10 feet per spell slot.  

","sourceId":null},{"id":141881,"label":"Contaminate Food and Drink","description":"

All food, drink, and crops within a 5-foot radius centered on a point of your choice within range becomes magically contaminated by necrotic energy. The affected substances appear unchanged until they are consumed or the spell is detected by magical means. Any creature that consumes the contaminated food, drink, or crop must make a Constitution saving throw. On failed save, the creature takes 2d8 necrotic damage, or half as a much on successful one. The purify food and drink spell removes the effects caused by this spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":142194,"label":"Temporal Transfusion","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

You focus on channeling your own immediate future into a target, giving them more time to complete their tasks.

\r\n

Select a living creature you can see.  So long as you can continue to see them, they get to take a turn on their initiative, and another turn on your initiative each round.  As you continue to pour your own immediate future into them, you forfeit each of your turns for as long as you continue to concentrate on the spell.

\r\n

Casting this spell on a non-linear creature (for example, a native of the Demiplane of Time) has an unusual effect.  Instead of granting the target an extra turn on your initiative, you heal them of 2d8 + 1/level damage for each turn you continue concentrating.  You still forfeit your own turn when doing so.

\r\n

You may also cast this on an object or abstract scenario.  For as long as you continue to concentrate, candles and fuses don't burn out, hourglasses never run out, falling objects somehow never quite hit the ground, flying arrows never quite reach their targets, etc.  Whatever the scenario or object, you buy just \"a little more time\" before the undesired effect occurs.

\r\n

A single casting may be maintained for up to an hour, but the spell may be cast again at the end of each hour to extend this limit another hour without interrupting the effect.

\r\n

At Higher Levels:
For each level of spell slot above 2nd, you may target 1 additional creature, object, or abstract scenario.

\r\n

This spell is an original work.

","sourceId":null},{"id":142737,"label":"Walking Bomb","description":"

Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a constitution saving throw or take 2d6  necrotic damage. At the start of each of its turns the target takes another 2d6 necrotic damage. The target can make another constitution saving throw at the end of its turn. On a success, the spell ends.

\r\n

If the target dies while the spell is active they explode in a spray of blood, flesh and bones. All creatures within 5ft of the target must make a  dexterity save. A creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a success.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd

","sourceId":null},{"id":144104,"label":"Flesh Rot","description":"

The flesh of a creature within range turns sickly and begins to slough off. The creature must pass a Con save or suffer 3d6 necrotic damage per round and is considered poisoned. On a passed save the creature takes 1/2 damage and the spell ends. Each round the creature may make a a Con save to end the effect.

","sourceId":null},{"id":144632,"label":"Recall the Mundane","description":"

Touch any object that is small enough to hold in your hands. As you utter the words of the spell your eyes roll back into your head and you enter a trance for 1d4+4 minutes. For the duration, your third eye beholds a vision of all that has transpired around that object in the last 12 hours. The range of the vision is a sphere with a 5 ft radius centered on the object. Beyond the sphere is swirling white fog.

\r\n

When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the duration of the trance by an additional 1d4 and the span of time recalled by 12 hours for each spell level above the 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":147832,"label":"Xephy's Arcane Escalation","description":"

As a reaction, you may add your power to a spell being cast within 30-feet of you. You must make an Intelligence saving throw against the spell save DC of the caster of the targeted spell. On a success the target spell is cast at a higher level by one spell level. On a failure you immediately take Psychic damage equal to 2d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. If this spell is subjected to a Counterspell, you automatically fail the save and take damage.

\r\n

So Far Beneath Me. Spells that are lower than one spell slot level than this spell is cast at may be automatically elevated by one level without making the saving throw. Any higher than one level still requires the Intelligence saving throw versus the target spell's save DC. For example: casting this spell at a 5th level may automatically elevate a 2nd level spell being cast to 3rd level, but you are required to succeed on the save if you aim to elevate the target spell from 2nd level to 4th or even higher to 5th.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may elevate the spell an additional spell level on a successful save per spell slot level used above 2nd. Damage incurred is also increased by 1d6 on a failed save per spell slot level used above 2nd. According to Cosmic Law, no spells cast may be raised higher than the 9th level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":148875,"label":"Listening Coin","description":"

You create a magical link between two similar coins, turning them into a magical listening device. One coin becomes a sensor, and the other becomes a receiver. When you hold the receiver coin up to your ear, you can hear anything you could hear if you were in the location of the sensor coin. There is no range limit on how far the coins can hear each other from, although they fail to function if they are ever on separate planes. The spell ends if you lose concentration or if you cast it again.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell no longer requires concentration.

","sourceId":null},{"id":158122,"label":"Alter Self (Disguise Enchantment)","description":"

You assume a different form.

\r\n

Change Appearance. You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

","sourceId":null},{"id":162191,"label":"Shackles of Fatigue","description":"

A weary spirit, burdened by four ghostly yet heavy chains, takes shape in front of the humanoid target.  With great effort, the spirit lifts one of the heavy, ghostly chains and bestows it to the target.  Target gains one level of exhaustion and 1d4 Necrotic damage from chain.  With each further casting on the same target, the spirit removes yet another chain.  A creature cannot gain more than 4 levels of exhaustion from this spell.  

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

Spell Level:
LP : +6 (Exhaustion condition) + 2 (1d4 of damage) + 1 (Necrotic damage) + 0 (Same die higher-level spell slot increase) + 0 (Distance of 30 ft ) + 0 (Instantaneous duration) + -2 (One target aiming) + 4 (No save protection) + -3 (Humanoid only limitation) + -2 (Cancelled by Spell Great Restoration 5th level limitation) = 6 LP

Spell Level: 6 (LP Total) / 3 = 2 st Level

On a failed save, an item that the target is willingly selling is now being sold for 20-50%(dm's choice) less. On a successful save, the spell ends with no effect.
