","sourceId":null},{"id":193233,"label":"Vault of Souls","description":"

When you cast this spell, you immediately drink the blood of someone who has died within the last 15 minutes. By doing so, you absorbed their soul, preventing them from traveling to their afterlife. Instead the soul travels to an extra dimensional space within yourself. While in this space, the soul is able to hear and see what you experience, however it cannot interact with the outside world. You are able to freely communicate and mentally shape the extra dimensional space the souls resides in. Casting this spell again can allow you to inprison another soul in the same space, or free any number of souls from this space. 

\r\n

If you die while there are souls within this extra dimensional space. Your body, upon death, explodes dealing 1d4 force damage in a 5ft radius centered on you, as blood and gore splatters everywhere from the souls escaping from the space inside you. Spells such as deathward or other similar spells prevent this effect from happening. 

\r\n

When cast using a spell slot 3 or higher, you can absorb two additional souls for each slot above the original.

\r\n

When cast using a spell slot 5 or higher, you extend the radius in which you can absorb souls by 15ft for each spell level of 5 or higher.

","sourceId":null},{"id":195081,"label":"Palimpsest's Construct Mending","description":"

A spell devised by a Warforged wizard that wished to relieve the burden of her constant repairs from her allies, this spell affects only Warforged and Constructs, using the principles of the Mending cantrip and the Fabricate spell along with her observations of the Cure Wounds spell and the Paladin's Lay on Hands ability to repair structural damage and replenish the energy of these beings and even restore functionality to lost or severely damaged limbs. The target construct recovers hit points equal to 2d12 + your Spellcasting modifier.

\r\n

While the spell can restore limbs to constructs, this is limited only to mundane materials such as wood, stone, and metals on the level of iron and bronze; exceptionally hard materials, or materials with magical properties such as Mithral and Adamantine resist the effects of the spell and cannot be used. Stone taken from sources such as a creature affected by Petrification crumbles to dust, as the spell recognizes the nature of it and triggers a failsafe.

\r\n


At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":198692,"label":"Forge Fire","description":"

You touch an object of Medium size or smaller or a section of an object no more than 5 feet in any dimension.

\r\n

If the material of the object touched is metal or glass, the material is heated it to a workable state. This spell is sometimes the only way to work with certain rarer metals such as Mithril or Adamantine. The metal or glass remains in a workable state for as long as you work on it, no more than 8 hours. [Item]Smith's Tools[/Item] or [Item]Glassblower's Tools[/Item] are still required to work the material.
If the material of the object touched is unfired clay, this spell acts as a kiln, firing the clay and hardening it.

","sourceId":null},{"id":203882,"label":"Rot Stuff","description":"

 

\r\n

You make a performance so gruesome and vile that it starts rotting the flesh of nearby creatures. Each round for the duration of the spell, you can use your Action to target up to two creatures that you can see within range that are experiencing your performance. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 1d10 necrotic damage and has their speed reduced to half until the start of your next turn. On a success, they take half damage. Constructs and undead aren't affected.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":216786,"label":"Language Acquisition","description":"

Casting this spell on yourself or another willing creature, the target of this spell then proceeds to consume the flesh of a sentient creature. Upon doing so, they permanently learn one language that the creature knew, if the target of this spell didn't already know the same languages as the creature they partook of.

","sourceId":null},{"id":219098,"label":"Noxious Cloud","description":"

In your hand you gather a ball of toxic magic and hurl it at a point you can see within range, where it explodes into a cloud of deadly miasma.  Each creature within 10ft of that point must make a Constitution saving throw.  A creature takes 3d6 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.  A creature must repeat this saving throw when it enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or when it ends its turn within the cloud. 

\r\n

The cloud lasts until the end of your next turn or until it is dispersed by a strong wind.  Creatures and objects within the cloud are lightly obscured. 

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":221754,"label":"Conjure Explosive","description":"

You conjure a simple magical explosive next to you or in your hands. This explosive is spherical and weighs about 10 lbs. It has an AC of 13 and 5 hit points. When its hit points drop to 0, when the spell ends or when you stop concentrating on the spell, each creature within a 15 foot radius sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 3d8 force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. This explosive can affect creatures behind solid objects, but those creatures take half damage.

","sourceId":null},{"id":238981,"label":"Boundless Athenaeum","description":"

You use chalk to inscribe arcana sigils upon a wall or vertical surface. At the completion of the casting, a 10 ft. x 10 ft. portal opens up within the space of the sigils, leading into an extradimensional library unique to the caster. Any objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from the library, and when the spell ends, any creatures inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance, as well as any objects other than books or other reading materials. While this portal remains open, the library and everything within it appears to be on the same plane of existence as the portal. 

The library is well lit, and always at a comfortable temperature. Decor is chosen by the caster at the time of casting, and can include desks, writing tables, and shelves. The library is never smaller than a 10 ft. x 10 ft. room, but will grow to accommodate any number of books added to it.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":248981,"label":"Decompose","description":"

You touch a corpse or other remains. The target instantly decay into nothingness, with only skeletal bones unaffected by the spell.

\r\n

The spell has no effect on a target that is magically animated, undead, or under the effects of a gentle repose spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":253343,"label":"Alter Self (Psionic)","description":"

You use the power of your mind to assume a different form in the eyes of all who observe you. When you manifest this power you decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal, for instance. At any time for the duration of the spell, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again.

\r\n

Unlike the arcane spell of the same name, nothing about you is physically changed, therefore you cannot, for example, grow gills and adapt to an aquatic environment. You can appear as an aquatic creature, but you cannot gain any physical skills from that illusion. Likewise, this power does not allow the benefit of natural weapons. 

Augment: 

The duration is increased by one hour per level manifested. 

\r\n

This spell allows you to communicate complex thoughts (such as maps, diagrams, explanatory images-- which may move in a sequence to show a procedure-- and the like) silently to a willing participant upon touch. Uses for this spell include showing the target a creature's likeness to aid in recognition or a clear route to an unfamiliar place. If the recipient is not willing, this spell automatically fails.

","sourceId":null},{"id":302894,"label":"Angelfall’s Arcane Evasion","description":"

When an attack you can see is made against you or an event such as a trap, hazard or spell that would require you to make a Dexterity save you may use your Reaction to cast this spell. When you do time slows just for a few moments for you to select an occupied space you can see within 30 feet of you and when you do you are instantly teleported to that space. If that space is away from the triggering event or is not within the targeted space of the triggering attack you evade it and are completely unharmed. If it is still within the effect, you can make your Dexterity Save with advantage, taking no damage on a successful save.

\r\n

Tiny creatures, including familiars, are teleported with you if they are touching you and not hostile toward you. 

\r\n

This spell requires you to have the ability to make a single step - a small start of a movement that forms the somatic component of the spell, so unless you have the means to eschew the somatic component (such as a Sorcerer's Subtle Spell Metamagic) you must have a speed greater than 0. 

\r\n

Channeling the magics in this way and using such dimensional magics - manipulating space and the flow of time - in a single moment is very taxing on the mind and body. Roll a DC14 Constitution saving throw. On a fail, you are [Condition]Stunned[/Condition] for 1 round as you are winded, and briefly overcome with exhaustion, similar to when the [Spell]Haste[/Spell] spell ends.  On a success, you are not [Condition]Stunned[/Condition] but your speed is halved and melee attacks are made at disadvantage for 1 round. Ranged attacks are unaffected. This spell cannot be cast if you have 2 or more levels of [Condition]Exhaustion[/Condition]

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When cast at 4th level or higher, the constitution saving throw is negated (as are the negative effects of both success and failure), and you can choose 1 willing target within 30 feet of you to take with you for every spell slot used above 3rd. All creatures are teleported to the same point with 5 feet of each other. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":310998,"label":"Destructive Knowledge","description":"

You gain an intuitive understanding of any written content that the object contained, but you must understand the language in which the content was written. You don't recall the content word for word, but you remember the concepts and facts found within, as though you had thoroughly read the content multiple times.

","sourceId":null},{"id":324030,"label":"Analyze Remains","description":"

This cantrip can tell the caster something about a specific creature from samples of its anatomy.

\r\n

When cast on a sample of fresh blood or a part of a body (less than 24 hours old), the caster gains knowledge about the nature of the creature. With a DC 15 Nature or Medicine check, the caster learns what kind of creature this was, in addition, they learn two of the following facts:

\r\n

Roll two d6 to determine what information is learned. If the same number is rolled twice, choose from the list at will.

\r\n

1: Resistances 2: Immunities 3: Vulnerabilities 4: Size 5: Alignment 6: Alive or Not Alive

","sourceId":null},{"id":343299,"label":"Fortune's Favor","description":"

You touch a willing creature, imparting them with a fragment of possibility. A small ethereal bead floats into the creature's head, and last the duration or until dispelled.

\r\n

After a creature with the fragment of possibility makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, they can expend the fragment of possibility to roll another d20 and use either result. Alternatively when an attack roll is made against the creature with the fragment of possibility, the creature can expend the fragment of possibility to force the creature to roll another d20 and use the lower of the two rolls.

\r\n

A creature cannot possess more than one fragment of possibility at any given time.

","sourceId":null},{"id":347238,"label":"Vulberg's Fleet Feet","description":"

If any creature under the effect of this spell makes an attack roll or saving throw, or travels over rough terrain, the spell no longer affects them.

","sourceId":null},{"id":348583,"label":"Create Greater Spell Scroll","description":"

By means of this spell, you create a greater spell scroll. Choose from the options below. For a level spell, you must expend a spell slot of the appropriate level in addition to the other costs. You suffer exhaustion as normal from lack of sleep while casting this spell.

\r\n

Cantrip: You inscribe a cantrip you know into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 10gp.

\r\n

1st level: You inscribe a 1st level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 15gp.

\r\n

2nd level: You inscribe a 2nd level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 200gp.

\r\n

3rd level: You inscribe a 3rd level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 400gp.

\r\n

4th level: You inscribe a 4th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 2,250gp.

\r\n

5th level: You inscribe a 5th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater  spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 4,500gp.

\r\n

6th level: You inscribe a 6th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 12,500gp. The casting time required to create this spell is increased to 2 days.

\r\n

7th level: You inscribe a 7th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater  spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 22,500gp. The casting time required to create this spell is increased to 3 days.

\r\n

8th level: You inscribe a 8th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 45,000gp. The casting time required to create this spell is increased to 4 days.

\r\n

9th level: You inscribe a 9th level spell you know and have prepared into a greater spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is 250,000gp. The casting time required to create this spell is increased to 6 days.

\r\n

Quickened Spell: You inscribe a spell of a level of your choice, as above, but add a quickening enchantment. If the spell has a casting time of 1 minute or longer, its casting time is halved. If it has a casting time of 1 action, you can make it take a casting time of 1 bonus action instead. The cost of the gem that must be provided is doubled.

\r\n

Universal Spell: You inscribe a spell of a level of your choice, as above, but add simplifying magics. There is no Intelligence score requirement for the using of the spell scroll. The cost of the gem that must be provided is doubled.

","sourceId":null},{"id":348926,"label":"Aruel's Improved Wild Shape","description":"

A spell created by a wizard that envy the druid's wild shape skill.

\r\n
    \r\n
  • when cast you assume the form of a beast or monstrosity that you had a part of. Your game Statistics are replaced by the Statistics of the beast, but you retain your Alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all of your skill and saving throw Proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature. If the creature has the same proficiency as you and the bonus in its stat block is higher than yours, use the creature's bonus instead of yours.
    • \r\n
  • When you transform, you assume the creature's Hit Points and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of Hit Points you had before you transformed. However, if you revert as a result of Dropping to 0 Hit Points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 Hit Points, you aren't knocked Unconscious.
    • \r\n
  • You can't cast Spells, and your ability to speak or take any action that requires hands is limited to the capabilities of your wild form. 
    • \r\n
\r\n

the max Cr creature you can assume is equal to the spell slot level you use.

","sourceId":null},{"id":369281,"label":"Air Forge","description":"

You heat a patch of air to the great temperatures of a forge. You can hold up metal to that area and soften it just as a real forge would and then work the metal appropriately. Only items placed in the heated area by the caster are affected; the heat doesn’t affect anything else, and it can’t be felt by living creatures at all. This spell, along with a portable anvil, greatly lessens the difficulty for a craftsman repairing equipment in the field.
Enhancement: If air forge is cast using a spell slot higher than 2nd level, it heats a number of cubic feet of air equal to the spell slot used.

","sourceId":null},{"id":385790,"label":"Transfusion","description":"

Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach that has blood in its body. On a hit, the creature takes 2d4 necrotic damage and you drain a number of vials of blood equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt, which you may automatically store into an empty vial in your possession. If the number of vials of blood you drained equals or exceeds the target's drain threshold (based on size as shown in the table below), the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n

","sourceId":null},{"id":393076,"label":"Alter Aspect","description":"

You permanently change one aspect of a willing target. You can grow facial hair, take it away, change hair or skin color, change height or weight and even the sex of the target, and many more options. You can't, however, change the race of the target, or the height/weight to a point where it would change their size. The target's sex can become sexless or intersex. 

\r\n

This spell cannot change any aspect that has already been changed by a Sorcerer's Wild Magic or a curse. It also can't be used to regrow lost limbs, eyes, etc. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":394196,"label":"Vincent's Disassembly","description":"

You attempt to unmake an object you can touch. A nonmagical manufactured object of dimensions up to 10 feet by 10 feet that you touch is instantly disassembled, breaking down into base component parts. For example, if you cast this spell on a cart, it would collapse into piles of wooden plank and solid iron from the nails and bracings.

\r\n

If you target a held or carried object with this spell, you must make a successful spell attack against the creature holding or carrying the object for the spell to take effect. If you target a construct with this spell, you make a spell attack against the target, dealing 4d8 force damage on a hit.

","sourceId":null},{"id":394354,"label":"Cauterize Memory","description":"

With this special ten-minute long ritual you can remove some of another willing creature's most recent memories: generally allowing for the removal of a traumatic event, an unintentionally learned secret, or some kind of dark thought. Together you--and your willing participant--must mutually decide what portions of the last 24 hours are removed from the target's memories.

\r\n

If the ritual ends before you have finished, the target's memories aren't altered. Otherwise, the memories vanish when the spell ends and the target is incapable of forming memories for a period equal to what was just removed. This generally manifests as a gap or period of unaccounted for unconsciousness and is highly disconcerting for targets who do not retain prior memory of how this spell functions.

\r\n

A greater restoration spell cast on the target restores the creature's memory.

","sourceId":null},{"id":403335,"label":"Major Mending","description":"

It is a favored way to restore ships that have been severely damaged in battle, especially when they can’t be taken to a drydock. The object or construct that you touch regains the lesser of 20 hit points or half of its total hit points.
At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 10 for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":403904,"label":"Earth Glide","description":"

You give the subject the ability to glide through earth and stone as easily as an earth elemental does.
The affected creature can glide through stone, dirt, or almost any other sort of earth except metal as easily as a fish swims through water.
Its burrowing leaves behind no tunnel or hole, nor does it create any ripple or other signs of its presence.
A move earth spell cast on an area containing the affected creature flings the creature back 30 feet and stuns the creature for 1 round unless it succeeds on a DC 15 Fortitude save.

\r\n

Here is a list of examples you may use the disk for:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You can study the sky and the planets.
    • \r\n
  • You can identify the face of a person from up to two miles away.
    • \r\n

    • \r\n
  • You can see the most meticulous details of an object from up close.
    • \r\n
\r\n

","sourceId":null},{"id":498578,"label":"Camouflage","description":"

You camouflage yourself to easily blend in with your surroundings, making it easier for you to hide. For the duration, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth)  checks and you can take the hide action as a bonus action.

\r\n

","sourceId":null},{"id":543295,"label":"Arcane Forensics","description":"

For the duration, you see the presence of residual magic in a 30 feet cone in front of you. While concentrating, you can use your action to focus on the different particles around any visible creature, object or area that appears to have been affected by a spell in the last 24 hours. You learn its school of magic, if any, and the types of components (verbal, somatic, material) used to cast it.

\r\n

If the residual magic is caused by a creature's innate spellcasting ability, you instead learn the creature's type (fiend, celestial, construct, etc.).

\r\n

You can also determine when such magic was used by the density of particles left in the area. Any spells or magical phenomenon that occurred more than 24 hours prior to casting this spell cannot be detected.

\r\n

Finally, you can make Intelligence (Arcana) checks against the responsible creature or magic item's spell save DC to determine the spell used. If the magical phenomenon is not caused by a creature or item, for example a divine intervention or planar anomaly, the DC is left at the DM's discretion.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":544117,"label":"Camoflauge","description":"

When you cast this spell, you may choose up to four creatures within range. The chosen targets seem to fade away, becoming almost translucent. The chosen targets gain advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) checks, and may attempt to use the Hide action even when only lightly obscured.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, you may target two additional creatures for every slot level above 2nd.

This spell was made by tumblr user 5ecardaday.

","sourceId":null},{"id":560066,"label":"Artificer's Workspace","description":"

You conjure a small lab, workbench, or other space that helps Artificers in their brand of work and allows them to achieve things that they never could before. You summon this lab at a place within 15 feet. The lab can be anywhere from 5-15 feet in length and up to 10 feet in height and provides the benefit of half cover. While working at the lab, any Artificer who works on it gains advantage on any Artisans Tools with which they have proficiency. This lab disappears if you cast it again.

","sourceId":null},{"id":560543,"label":"Accelerate Ally","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with the Chronomancer subclass)

\r\n

A single willing creature that you can see within range allows you to accelerate its relative passage of time.  The target's gains +2 to AC, has its movement speed doubled, gains advantage on all Dexterity saves, and may take one additional action each turn until the spell ends. This additional action must be used to Attack with a single weapon, Dash, Disengage, Hide, use an item, or interact with an object.  Upon termination, the flow of time snaps back like a stretched rubber band, resulting in the effected creature being unable to move or take any actions for 1 whole round.

\r\n

This spell is similar to a common 3rd level wizard spell, except that it differs in the exact implementation of the effect, and is available to practitioners of Chronomancy as a 2nd level spell, due to the caster's advanced grasp of time manipulation.

","sourceId":null},{"id":583521,"label":"Conjure Portable Forge","description":"

The forge cannot be moved by any means. It has an AC of 17 and 20 hitpoints. If the forge is destroyed forcefully, you cannot conjure it again for 1d4 + 1 days.

\r\n

After drawing a rectangle on a plain surface, you can create a magical screen inside the shape. On this screen, you can display any event which you know or remember of.
The images are animated and silent. You can also increase or decrease the speed of the images. If you don't know the exact looks of a person or object present in the projection, it appears as a blurred figure.

","sourceId":null},{"id":599021,"label":"Reparo","description":"

This spell magically reverses any damage done to any objects or structures within a 5-foot cube, collecting all the pieces or components and reassembling them. Anything previously contained by the broken target, like a spilled liquid, is not placed back inside it. Anything affected by the breaking of the target, like a person who fell through a broken platform, is not undone. There is no effect on anything within the area that's undamaged, nor on anything damaged by time or decay.

\r\n

This spell can physically repair a magic item, but the spell can’t restore magic to such an object.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the size of the cube increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":605973,"label":"Create Campsite","description":"

You create a squadron of tiny unseen servants that create a campsite for you and your companions. They will clear the land of debris, set up tents and bedrolls, start a fire, fetch water, and even begin cooking (although they are not particularly good cooks.)

\r\n

They cannot create the materials needed for the campsite; they can only use what is available to them in the immediate area and what you and your companions have brought. These servants have no other abilities.

","sourceId":null},{"id":606529,"label":"Arcane Augmentation","description":"

This spell was invented by Mordenkainen while studying an ancient artifact known as a mythallar. It was developed on the plane of Calmorda, where the Weave is fragile and the goddess of magic, Mystra, does not have a conscious presence. This spell removes many of the safeguards placed on mortal magic by the divines, and as such it is a closely guarded secret, lest an incautious mage draw the ire of those who safeguard the Weave.

\r\n

Faintly glowing arcane runes encircle each of your hands, greatly focusing your magical ability. For the duration, you gain the ability to concentrate on a number of additional spells up to your intelligence modifier. If you take damage, you make Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration for each of the spells separately, but if you lose concentration on this spell, you can only maintain concentration on one other spell. You gain additional bonuses to your spellcasting when casting this spell at higher levels.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot 4th level or higher, you may use your bonus action to cast a spell of 1st level or higher that has a casting time of 1 action.

\r\n

If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you may cast a spell that is not a cantrip for your action, if you used your bonus action that turn to cast a spell.

\r\n

If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you may combine two spell slots of the same level into a single spell slot of 1 level higher, repeating as many times as you wish, whenever you cast a spell. If you combine two spell slots in this fashion, you take psychic damage equal to the level of the combined spell slot. For example, you can use 2 1st level spell slots and a 2nd level spell slot as a 3rd level spell (5 points of damage). This damage cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.

","sourceId":null},{"id":607721,"label":"Enhance Familiar","description":"

You bestow upon your familiar heightened Intelligence and special powers. This is not a true spell–and thus cannot be dispelled–instead this is a series of special processes you develop for one of your familiars. Special familiars (imps, quasits, etc.) cannot be enhanced in this way.

\r\n

Each enhancement requires research that takes an amount of time and money, as shown in the Enhancement Costs table.This research requires access to a well-stocked library as well as proficiency in the Arcana skill. Each enhancement (1–8) must be completed in order and cannot be redone.

\r\n

As the enhancement of a familiar continues, the familiar should develop a personality that seems almost human, displaying specific traits, likes, dislikes, opinions, habits, and foibles. Its animal qualities also develop as its personality matures. A black cat might develop discriminating and expensive tastes in food and creature comforts; a crow might become a collector of gaudy gemstones and jewelry; and an otter might develop a frolicsome personality combining a short attention span for serious matters with a love for playful pranks.

\r\n

The familiar takes on some of your alignment and attitudes, though a leaning toward a neutral alignment, a holdover from its simple animal origin, will always remain. The familiar may tend to become more of an independent NPC as it is enhanced. The DM should carefully consider if relaxing the dependency of the familiar on the wizard will improve the campaign play.

\r\n
Enhancement Costs
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
Enhancement
Minimum Character LevelTimeCost
131 day100 gp
25half workweek350 gp
371 workweek2,500 gp
492 workweeks5,000 gp
5114 workweeks7,500 gp
6138 workweeks10,000 gp
71512 workweeks15,000 gp
81716 workweeks20,000 gp
\r\n
Enhancement 1
\r\n

The familiar's intellect improves, its Intelligence becomes 4 + 1d3. It can now think in your native tongue and communicate with simple sentences through your empathic link. The familiar gains one special power from Enhancement Table 1. Unless otherwise noted (or obvious), the familiar's spell abilities affect only the familiar. The familiar's spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

\r\n
Enhancement 2
\r\n

The familiar's Intelligence rises to 7 + 1d3. The familiar can, with patient tutoring by you, learn to communicate in other languages, up to a number of languages equal to its Intelligence modifier (minimum of one language). The acquisition of certain special powers may enable a familiar to learn languages from someone other than you. The familiar gains another special power, as determined by a dice roll. Note that stronger powers will replace weaker powers of the same general type.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d10Special Power
1–8One from Enhancement Table 1
9–0One from Enhancement Table 2
\r\n
Enhancement 3
\r\n

The familiar's Intelligence improves one more time, becoming 10 + 1d2. It can now think in your native tongue and communicate with simple sentences through your empathic link. The familiar can now be tutored to read languages as well as communicate with them through the empathic link to you. The familiar acquires another special power as decided by a dice roll.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d10Special Power
1–6One from Enhancement Table 1
7–0One from Enhancement Table 2
\r\n
Enhancement 4
\r\n

The familiar's Intelligence will not improve further. The familiar can now be tutored to read languages as well as communicate with them through the empathic link to you. The familiar acquires another special power as decided by a dice roll.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d10Special Power
1–3One from Enhancement Table 1
4–8One from Enhancement Table 2
9–0One from Enhancement Table 3
\r\n

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n

Enhancement Table 1
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d100Special Power
01–05Dancing lights, twice per day.
06–20Detect magic, twice per day. The familiar cannot learn the school of magic.
21–25Feather fall, twice per day.
26–30Jump (only 1 jump), three times per day.
31–40Pass without trace, once per day. Only the familiar gains the benefits of the spell.
41–60Protection from evil and good, once per day.
61–75Speak with animals, twice per day. Restricted to own general family; for example, a cat could talk to any feline.
76–80Spider climb, once per day.
81–95Unseen servant, once per day.
96–00Familiar can detect substance, three times per day. For 10 minutes, the familiar can detect one type of metal, mineral, vegetable or other substance within 30 feet. The DM determines the type of substance. At DM's option, familiar may display an obsessive interest in the substance, and may seek and collect it at inopportune times.
\r\n
Enhancement Table 2
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d100Special Power
01–10Blur, twice per day.
11–20Disguise self, once per day. Must still be own essential animal form, but can change color/pattern, subtle body features (black cat to siamese or manx), and size (±25%)
21–25Comprehend languages, once per day. Reading a written message requires Intelligence of 10.
26–35Detect evil and good, once per day.
36–45See invisibility, once per day, duration reduced to 10 minutes.
46–50Grease, once per day.
51–60Fog cloud, once per day.
61–75Shield, once per day.
76–80Speak with animals, twice per day. Restricted to own biological class; for example, a cat could talk to any mammal.
81–85Familiar can sense true north, three times per day. Roll a d20, on a 3–20, the familiar accurately senses true north. If wrong, the DM determines which direction the familiar calls north–for instance by rolling a d6, 1,2 east; 3,4 south; 5,6 west.
86–00Familiar can meld into its environment, once per day. The familiar moves into an object it can touch made of natural materials–like stone or wood–melding itself and all it's equipment into the object. Detecting the familiar's presence requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against it's spell save DC.
\r\n
Enhancement Table 3
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d100Special Power
01–10Alter self, once per day, can only use the change appearance option, must transform into the form of another animal familiar.
11–20Animal friendship, once per day. Must be of the same family (cat/feline).
21–25Fly, once per day. Familiars already able to fly instead gain +50% speed.
26–40Invisibility, once per day; or knock, once per day (50% chance of either).
41–50Mirror image, once per day.
51–65Water breathing, once per day.
66–70Speak with animals, three times per day.
71–80Familiar can sense hostiles, three times per day. For the next minute, it knows the direction of the nearest creature hostile to it within 30 feet, but not the creature's distance from it. The familiar can sense the presence of hostile creatures that are ethereal, invisible, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight.
81–85Familiar can detect secrets, twice per day. The familiar knows the direction of the nearest trap or secret door within 30 feet.
86–95Intelligence raised to 12 + 1d2. If already as high or higher, reroll.
96–00Familiar gains a normal voice and can speak any language it knows.
\r\n
Enhancement Table 4
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d100Special Power
01–10Blink, once per day.
11–20Animal friendship, once per day. Must be of the same biological class (cat/mammal).
21–25Nondetection, once per day.
26–35Hold animal, once per day. Same as hold person, but targets only beasts of Medium size or smaller. Can only target beast of same family.
36–45Familiar can shrink nonmagical objects, once per week. Touched object shrinks to 1/16 of normal dimensions and ca. 1/4,000 original volume and mass. Optionally, object becomes a cloth patch like those of a robe of useful items. Only affects objects <10 cubic ft. that aren’t being worn or carried. Object returns to normal if any creature other than the familiar touches it, or if the familiar decides it does.
46–55Knock, once per day.
56–65Conjure animals, once per week. Summons 8 beasts of the same species as the familiar.
66–70Tongues, once per day. If familiar does not have speech, reroll.
71–80Gaseous form, once per day.
81–85Glibness, once per week. Duration reduced to 10 minutes. If familiar does not have speech, reroll.
86–95Intelligence raised to 14 + 1d2. If already as high or higher, reroll.
96–00Polymorph, once per day. Like the spell except the familiar assumes a specific humanoid form. The DM decides exact details of appearance. Intelligence is retained, enhanced animal senses are lost in its humanoid form.
\r\n
Enhancement Table 5
\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
1d100Special Power
01–10Animal friendship, once per day.
11–20Dimension door, once per week. Up to 200 lbs. in the familiar's grasp or jaws can be taken.
21–35Hold animal, once per day. Same as hold person, but targets only beasts of Medium size or smaller. Can only target beast of same biological class.
36–45Greater invisibility, once per day.
46–55Stoneskin, once per week.
56–70Conjure animals, once per week. Limited to beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower, that are within the same biological family (cat/panther).
71–75Telekinesis, once per day. Can only manipulate objects.
76–80Familiar becomes very persuasive, once per day. For 10 minutes the familiar gains a +5 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) checks–and for the duration–it can cast suggestion once.
81–90Intelligence raised to 16 + 1d2. Also gains proficiency with Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
91–00Polymorph, once per week. Familiar assumes a specific beast of the same family (e.g. cat to leopard). Duration reduced to 30 minutes.
","sourceId":null},{"id":614995,"label":"Ash to Ink","description":"

While speaking encantations, you can enchant water and remains of charred wood to create an inklike liquid, fit to scribe spells into a spellbook.
Each ounce of ink created requires one cubic inch of charred wood. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":620803,"label":"Moment of Contemplation","description":"
You put two fingers to your temple and your mind begins to work at lightning speed. While only a moment passes in real time, in your mind you have the equivalent of ten minutes to think over a problem at hand, dive into nearly-forgotten corners of your memory, and evaluate immediate threats around you, helping you determine the best course of action to take in the next few seconds. This grants you the following benefits until the start of your next turn:
\r\n
\r\n
    \r\n
  • You gain advantage on ability checks
    • \r\n
  • You add 1d4 to your AC and saving throws
    • \r\n
  • Potentially other insights, as determined by the DM
    • \r\n
\r\n
At higher levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can affect a willing creature you touch in addition to yourself. During the spell you can telepathically communicate with the other creature if it has a language, and can exchange memories (if willing), allowing you to mentally collaborate with perfect clarity.\r\n
 
\r\n
\r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":623281,"label":"Daardendrian's Diminutive Construct","description":"

You convert raw materials into products of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a dagger from an ingot, a rope from a patch of hemp, and clothes from flax or wool.

\r\n

Choose raw materials that you can see within range. You can fabricate a Tiny or smaller object (contained within a 1.3-foot cube), given a sufficient quantity of raw material. 

\r\n

Creatures or magic items can't be created or transmuted by this spell. You must have proficiency with the type of artisan's tools used to craft such objects.

","sourceId":null},{"id":630031,"label":"Immovable Object (Homebrew)","description":"

You touch an object that weighs no more than 10 pounds and cause it to become magically fixed in place. You and the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can move the object normally. You can also set a password that, when spoken within 5 feet of the object, suppresses this spell for 1 minute.

\r\n

If the object is fixed in the air, it can hold up to 4,000 pounds of weight. More weight causes the object to fall. Otherwise, a creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the creature can move the object up to 10 feet.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or 5th level, the DC to move the object increases by 5, it can carry up to 8,000 pounds of weight, and the duration increases to 24 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the DC to move the object increases by 10, it can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight, and the effect is permanent until dispelled.

","sourceId":null},{"id":630036,"label":"Wristpocket (Homebrew)","description":"

You flick your wrist, causing one object in your hand to vanish. The object, which only you can be holding and can weigh no more than 5 pounds, is transported to an extradimensional space, where it remains for the duration.

\r\n

Until the spell ends, you can use your action to summon the object to your free hand, and you can use your action to return the object to the extradimensional space. An object still in the pocket plane when the spell ends appears in your space, at your feet.

","sourceId":null},{"id":633232,"label":"Clara's Eavesdrop","description":"

You create a sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The sensor stays in place for the duration of the spell. The sensor cannot be attacked or otherwise interacted with.

\r\n

When you cast the spell, you only hear things from your sensor's point of hearing as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between your hearing and the sensor's hearing.

\r\n

The sensor is invisible. A creature that can see the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from see invisibility or truesight) sees a luminous sphere around the size of a button.

","sourceId":null},{"id":643085,"label":"Preservation (Miasmism Magic)","description":"

You prevent further effects of disease, poison, and decay on anything living or dead for 1 week. This does not purify food, neutralize poison, or cure disease but halts spoilage of food, stops disease progression, and halts damage caused by poison until the end of the spell duration. This spell will also preserve a body for the Raise Dead spell, adding 1 week to the time that the creature can be dead before being raised. Multiple castings of this spell will extend this preservation by 1 week from the most recent casting. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

","sourceId":null},{"id":698786,"label":"Arcane Analysis","description":"

You begin magically analyzing an object of small size or smaller. This gives you all physical information about this, but will not reveal any magical information, such as a magic items properties. When you are done, the DM might give you an appropriate Investigation check, based on how complex the analyzed object is. If you succeed you understand how to use it and gains all relevant information about the objects physical form. 

\r\n

If you succeed the Investigation check by 10 or more, you learn how to recreate the object. If it is a magic item, you will learn to recreate it without its magical properties. 

\r\n

All information you obtain with this spell, will automatically be written down in a book or scroll of your choice.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a 3rd-level spell slot, the maximum size of the object increases to Medium. When you cast this spell using a 4th-level spell slot the maximum size increases to large. When you cast this spell using a 5th-level spell slot, the maximum size increases to Huge and when you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the maximum size increases to Gargantuan.

","sourceId":null},{"id":701325,"label":"Analyze Device","description":"

You touch a nonmagical object and receive a detailed impression of how it was put together. For this particular spell to take hold, the object must be a device with fine mechanical detail, such as moving parts. For the duration, you have advantage on any roll needed to repair or disassemble the object, and for the next hour, you have advantage on any roll needed to reproduce a set of schematics for the device. If the object is a lock of some description, you have advantage on any check made to pick it.

\r\n

As the wealth of information becomes greater, there is a cumulative 25% chance that each additional casting of the spell past the first will fail, if cast on the same object. This effect lasts until you finish a long rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":720406,"label":"Warwick's Wandering Workshop","description":"

 

\r\n
\r\n

The Artificer placed a small, dense, palm-sized clockwork sphere of black metal embedded with cogs and gears and if one studied it closely one could see a tiny hourglass where the sand seemingly fell slower than it should, on the ground with his tinker's tools. He mutteredf an incantation and focused on the items for a moment and one could see the cogs and gears starts to twirl counter-clockwise faster and faster, even the hourglass seemed to spin until it emitted a blinding flash.

\r\n

The sound of creaking metal could be heard for a split second, as if the metal was folding itself out, with a whoosh. I blinked and saw now that instead of the sphere, a fully equipped ten by ten ft workshop had taken it's place and I swear I could could see a forcefield shimmer for a moment before it disappeared. When the artificer started to get to work inside the cube it strangely looked like he was twice as fast that he used to be.  
                                                                                                                                                                                 - Unknown farmer, drunkenly, rambling at a tavern

\r\n
\r\n

 The sphere can be placed on any flat space. In order to properly activate, the sphere needs at least 5 ft of unhindered terrain on each side, or a 10 ft square area. A 10 ft immobile cube of temporal energy springs into existence arond you and the sphere folds out into a workshop and remains stationary for the duration. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than one creature.  If you or any creature attempts to move, cast a spell or attack through the cubes boundary, the forcefield and workshop vanishes immediately and the spell ends.

\r\n

Upon casting, you can choose or focus on an artisan's tool through your tinker's tools that you are proficient with to be available within the workshop, anyone may use chosen tool for the duration of the spell but only one creature can occupy the workshop at a time. The workshop changes its appearance and the materials within the workshop to suit the needs of the chosen tool. (Ex. if the chosen tool is Smith's Tools, then the workshop may contain a forge, anvil and various equipment.) The workshop has enough materials to maintain gear, and to make simple creations or non-magical items. If someone wished to use the work area for something other than simple creations or gear maintenance, then they must provide the required materials. You may touch another creature proficient with a crafting or artisan's skill, even if you don't have it, channel the proper workshop around the target for its needs.

Creatures within the workstation and proficient in the appropriate artisan's tools have advantage on their crafting skill checks. All tools counts as magical and unbreakable. Equipment and other materials created by this spell dissipate into smoke if moved outside the forcefield.

\r\n

Creatures and objects inside the workshop experience time differently to the outside world.  Upon completing the spell, you choose to either speed up or slow down time inside the workshop by a factor of two. 

\r\n

For example, if time inside the workshop is sped up, a task that would take four hours of normal time to complete can be completed in only two hours of normal time.  If time is slowed down, a spell that usually takes ten minutes of normal time to cast, would instead take twenty minutes of normal time. While a creature works at this bench, they do not need to eat, drink, or sleep, and do not suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of sleep. However, they won't gain any of the benefits of a long rest or short rest.

\r\n

Once the spell ends, every tool and material created by the spell fades from existence unless the caster use up the last minutes to cast it again prolonging it for another 2 hours. The spell also ends if its caster moves more than 30 ft from around the workshop.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose between increasing its radius 5 ft, allowing entrance for another creature, so that they can assist or work on their own project, or increasing the factor, for which it can speed up time, by 1 for each level above 2nd. Additionally the number of chosen tools, with which the workshop can merge and evolve, increases by 1 for each level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":786179,"label":"Incarcerous","description":"

Black cords and ropes are conjured and wrap themselves forcefully around a target. If the target is an unwilling creature, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is restrained for the duration. Upon casting, you can choose to anchor the ropes to the ground, preventing the target from being moved by external forces.

\r\n

The restrained creature or someone else who can reach it can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, the restrained effect ends.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the creature is also incapacitated, rendering it unable make a Strength check to escape.

","sourceId":null},{"id":951229,"label":"Effortless March","description":"

You enhance up to six allies, allowing them to continue marching for days on end. Until this spell ends, they can’t gain levels of exhaustion from a forced march or from going without sleep. They can travel at a normal pace for the duration of this spell with no ill effects. This spell does not obviate the need for food or water, nor does it affect the requirements of a long
rest.

\r\n

 

\r\n

 

\r\n

***From Planet Apocalypse***

","sourceId":null},{"id":965064,"label":"Communication Orb","description":"

You create two orbs of light the size of your fist that hovers near yourself and the target of your spell. The orb sheds dim light out to 10ft. and occupies the same space as the creature it is attached to. For the duration of the spell, you can communicate to the target of the spell as if you were right next to them and they can respond in kind. Your voice is as audible as if you were speaking from the orb itself. The orb can not communicate if one of you transfers to a different plane.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell at 3rd level or higher, you create an additional orb and can attach it to another creature for each level above 2nd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":1102700,"label":"Misremember","description":"

You attempt to erase yourself from another creatures memory. One creature in range that you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. If you are fighting the creature, it has advantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, you can affect the target's memory of an event that it experienced within the last hour. You can permanently eliminate all memory of yourself in the event, the target's filling the void you left in its memory with another plausible explanation. 

\r\n

A remove curse or greater restoration spell cast on the target restores the creature's true memory. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":1209963,"label":"Surgeon's Tough Love","description":"

 

\r\n
\r\n

Miraculous Necromancy from the Codex of Life. The use of this spell in a campaign assumes that there is a possibility of suffering various forms of permanent injuries that may require medical care or magical healing.

\r\n
\r\n

 

\r\n

Your hand is covered in a hovering spectral glove, and is able to go through skin and other deep tissue. As apart of the spell you can fix wounds or cause injuries, though the latter is thought of as malpractice, and will cause a member to be cast out of the Guild. 

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Surgery  Choose one willing creature that you can see within 20 ft. You remove one permanent injury from a creature you touch, the injury can be a broken bone, infected wound, dislocated shoulder or a traumatic brain injury. Other injuries can also be removed at the Dungeon Master's discretion. Additionally the creature regains hit points equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting modifier
    • \r\n
  • Organ Twisting  You send the spectral hand into a creature's body within range. You break a bone, or tear a muscle, or squeeze an artery. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or 2d6 + your spellcasting modifier of necrotic damage. 
    • \r\n
\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the effects of Surgery increases by 1d6 and you can remove one additional permanent injury from the creature. The effects of Organ Twisting increases it's damage with 1d6 per spell slot.

","sourceId":null},{"id":628688,"label":"Limited Shapechange","description":"

You assume the form of a different creature for the duration. The new form can be of any small or medium humanoid. The creature can't be a construct or an undead, and you must have seen the sort of creature at least once. Your statistics remain the same. If the new shape does not have wings you lose your flying speed. 

\r\n

You do not gain racial bonuses or traits, nor do you lose your racial bonuses and traits. 

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":625740,"label":"Arcane Gift","description":"

You touch one willing creature who uses magic with your arcane focus. You transfer your spell slot to them, allowing them an extended use of magic.

\r\n

The way this exchange of magic works is as follows: in exchange for the spell slot you use to cast this spell, that creature regains a spell slot of the same level that they have already expended.  Alternatively, the creature can gain spell slots of lower level whose sum equals the level at which this spell is cast.

\r\n

For example, casting this as a 3rd level spell, the creature can gain a 3rd level spell, a 2nd level and a 1st level spell, or three 1st level spells.

\r\n

No creature can use this spell to regain more spell slots than they already have per level.  If this is cast at 6th level but the recipient has only used a 1st level spell slot, they can only regain that slot, nothing more.

\r\n

At higher levels, the sum of the spell slots a creature can gain is equal to the spell slot expended to cast this spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":561288,"label":"Create Construct","description":"

Target one suit of armor, statue, a pile of rocks, or similar target, given that the DM agrees a golem could be made using it as a body. Burn the incense with the charcoal in the pot, and let the smoke fill the air around it. Pour the powdered bone into the pot, followed by all of the gold and valuables, then chant an incantation. All materials are consumed by the spell, other than the pot. Gemstones, enchanted items, or other valuables are a reasonable substitute for gold if a large amount of gold is not readily available. A pile of bones can be targeted with this spell, but it will not technically be considered undead, and will not be sensed by spells or abilities such as Detect Evil unless constructs are mentioned specifically in those spells.

\r\n

Immediately after the days required, the construct will stand on its feet and await orders. The construct can follow orders, but if its intelligence is too low, it may misunderstand the intention behind certain phrases. The construct can communicate with you telepathically if its intelligence is above 6 and it is within 100 ft.

\r\n

The nature of the construct will be determined between yourself and the DM, and its statistics will vary based on the type of construct created, the amount of gold sacrificed, and the target chosen.

\r\n

If the chosen target is a suit of armor, for example, but only a small amount of gold is sacrificed, the construct will become an Animated Armor. If the suit of armor is enchanted, however, or a more substantial amount of gold is sacrificed, a Helmed Horror or Shield Guardian will be produced. If a particularly large amount of valuables are sacrificed, and the suit of armor is particularly large and high-quality, an Iron Golem will be produced. If an insubstantial amount of gold is produced for the target, the spell will fail. Due to this, a short out-of-character dialogue with the DM may be necessary when creating particularly high-level constructs with heavy sacrifices, such as Iron Golems.

\r\n

The DM can prepare the stats of the produced construct by rolling them or by choice if suitable statistics do not already exist. If suitable statistics do exist, the construct will be able to perform actions that the constructs of that type would know. For example, a Shield Guardian produced by this spell would be able to use Regeneration.

\r\n

The construct rolls for its own initiative, and you can spend your action ordering it any command. If the construct reaches 0 hit points, it collapses onto the ground, and the spell must be reperformed. Any enchanted items used will remain enchanted, and clatter to the ground. You can only produce one construct at a time, but you can dismiss them at any time verbally. By default, they will simply follow you around and defend themselves against hostile enemies unless instructed to do otherwise.

\r\n

in addition to this spell, you must cast the spell equal to the level of the CR  +1 that you are making for a number of days equal to double the CR. If the CR is above 8 you must in addition to the spell sacrifice 7500 gold pieces or use the wish spell with a d6 on a 2 and 1 you can never use wish again that thing (just go for the gold) in addition to all of this every time you perform the ritual you must use a hit dice on the creature the hit dice will act as necrotic damage towards you and drain your life force that much for the day the effect ends after the armor has been created

","sourceId":null},{"id":539855,"label":"Arcane Stealth","description":"

For the duration while concentrating on this spell, you may cast any other spell without the Verbal or Somatic components normally required by that spell.   If you use Arcane Stealth to cast another concentration spell without it's verbal or somatic components, the new spell works, but concentration on Arcane Stealth is broken.

\r\n

The verbal and somatic components of the Arcane Stealth spell are very subtle -- creatures within 15 feet of the spellcaster have disadvantage on ability checks to discern its casting and beyond that range, they fail automatically. However, as with any other spell with verbal and somatic components, this spell cannot be cast if the spellcaster cannot make sound (such as in the area of effect of a silence spell) or does not have free use of at least one hand.  

","sourceId":null},{"id":524723,"label":"Separate","description":"

Choose a single substance with a volume of no more than 1 cubic foot and within 15 ft to separate into its chemical elements or individual parts of a mixture. It is up to the player what part they wish to separate, but the can only select one substance at a time. If the substance is being worn or carried, it cannot be targeted. If the substance is floating in the air make an attack roll, with the AC following the table below. Separating a substance into its chemical elements does not work on organic substances like blood. Additionally, the spell has no effect on magical items or constructs.

\r\n

When cast at a level higher than 2nd, the caster can choose to either increase the spell's range by 15 ft each level or increase the area of effect by 1 cubic ft each level. When cast at 7th level, the caster can choose to separate a chemical element from itself, isolating each atom individually. This releases some energy and will result in a very, VERY fine dust of whatever element was separated. When cast at 9th level, the caster can choose for a chemical element (specifically) to undergo nuclear fission due to the separation being so complete via magic. If there is enough fissile material present or a radioactive element or isotope be targeted, the result will be very explosive, hot, blinding, and radioactive.

\r\n

WARNING: THIS WILL LIKELY KILL THE CASTER AND ANYONE NEAR THEM!!!!! DO NOT MESS WITH NUCLEAR PHYSICS!!!!!! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!!

\r\n

Table:

\r\n

Gas: AC 16, Powder: AC 14

\r\n

Note: Any volatility regarding the substance a caster chooses has the potential to harm the caster. Use with caution.

","sourceId":null},{"id":524142,"label":"Abi-Dalzim's Magic Boat","description":"

You summon an arcane boat in an unoccupied space within range. The summoned boat has the statistics of the water vehicle it resembles, but has a hover speed of 5 feet. You are proficient with the boat, and can telepathically steer it or move parts of it as a bonus action on each of your turns. When you cast this spell and while it lasts, you can designate a number of creatures that can interact with the boat, up to your spellcasting modifier. The boat is intangible to all other creatures.

","sourceId":null},{"id":456199,"label":"Create Construct Familiar","description":"

You have created a small metallic shell that a spirit can inhabit, allowing it to function as your familiar. The familiar uses the same rules and options for a familiar conjured by the find familiar spell and has the statistics of its chosen form but is classified as a Construct instead. The construct familiar gains the following benefits, in addition to what the chosen form allows; their AC increases by 1, is immune to poison and disease, and is immune to the following conditions charmed, exhaustion, and poisoned.

\r\n

If you already have a familiar conjured by the find familiar spell, then it may become the construct familiar instead. This construct also counts as a familiar for the find familiar spell.

\r\n
\r\n

If you can't find friends or they're just unreliable or also not expendable, then just make some. At least, that's what I always say.

\r\n

– Gilman Fizzlewix

","sourceId":null},{"id":427491,"label":"Shard Skill","description":"

Through your understanding of bonds and connections, you touch one creature who is friendly to you. For the duration of the spell, so long as you and the individual stay within 200 feet of one another; you two can share the same bonus of one skill or tool proficiency. This sharing of skill bonus can go in either direction, whether it is you sharing a skill/tool with them or them sharing a skill/tool with you. For the purpose of either check, you share the same ability score modifier, proficiency bonus, and expertise as the friendly target. If the individual becomes hostile to you for any reason the spell is broken and the material components are consumed.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If this spell is cast using a 3rd level spell slot or higher the user can designate another creature to also share the skill or toll proficiency bonus for every level above 2nd level. For material components, each creature must have their own silver band.

","sourceId":null},{"id":376558,"label":"Alter Time","description":"

You alter the flow of time around you, granting yourself and an ally a crucial moment to reposition yourselves. As part of the bonus action used to cast this spell, you can immediately take the Dash action. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. If you move at least 10 feet, any ally within 5 feet of you when you end your movement can immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed.

","sourceId":null},{"id":371311,"label":"Adventuring Clone","description":"

This spell summons an exact copy of a humanoid. In order for the spell to work the target must be willing or fail a charisma save. The target of this spell lays in one coffin and the clone is summoned into the other empty coffin within 10 feet. The silver thread connects the two coffins. The target is put into a coma as their spirit moves into the clone. The clone has all the same statistics, skills and memories of the original. The clone is summoned with mundane copies of all the original targets items. When the clone is killed, dies, or the spell duration expires the clone vanishes and the targets spirit returns to their original body with all of the memories and experience of the clone but none of the newly acquired items or injuries.

\r\n

When cast at higher level:

\r\n

If cast as a third level spell the duration is two months. If cast as a fourth level spell the duration is three months. If cast as a fifth level spell the duration is six months. If cast as a sixth level spell the duration is one year.  At seventh level, five years. At eighth level, ten years. If cast as a ninth level spell the duration is permanent.

","sourceId":null},{"id":313786,"label":"Flesh Reknit","description":"

You target a creature that is within range and that is made of flesh. The damaged skin and flesh of the creature suddenly starts to replace itself; shifting, turning and stretching itself into place again! A creature is healed for 1d20 + casting ability modifier. However, the whole process of the flesh being knit again causes the healed creature to make a DC 12 Constitution saving throw, becoming incapacitated until the end of it`s next turn due to the rapid healing of the flesh. Succeeding the saving causes no negative effect. If a creature is healed for a second time with this spell before another turn starts, the saving throw is made with disadvantage. 

\r\n

Undead creatures healed by this spell ignores the Constitution saving throw. 

\r\n


At higher level. Increases the healing done by 1d6 for each spell slot used above 2nd level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":264605,"label":"Commit to Memory","description":"

You can spend time memorizing words and images. When you cast this spell, you must spend time studying the object you wish to memorize. The time is based upon the type of object:

\r\n

Images and Maps: 1 Minute
Documents: 10 Minutes
Books: 1 Hour

\r\n

Once you have memorized an object, you will not forget it, and can recall it with perfect clarity whenever you need to.

","sourceId":null},{"id":263480,"label":"Azure Torch","description":"

Caster snaps fingers in front of pointed index and middle fingers of the other hand. Small flame bursts from snap and ignites 6in blue jet of flame from the caster's fingers. This flame can be used to cut or weld metal. 

\r\n

May use as melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 fire damage. If torch is held to target for entire round uninterrupted additional 1d6 fire damage, and may consider their next attack with the torch a hit if they choose to continue burning their victim, which uses their action. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

\r\n

When you reach 5th level may use bonus action to light Azure Torch in other hand without the use of a spell slot.

","sourceId":null},{"id":1996,"label":"Animate Dead","description":"

This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as an undead creature. The target becomes a skeleton if you chose bones or a zombie if you chose a corpse (the GM has the creature's game statistics).

\r\n

On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell if the creature is within 60 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.

\r\n

The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you've given it. To maintain control of the creature for another 24 hours, you must cast this spell on the creature again before the current 24-hour period ends. This use of the spell reasserts your control over up to four creatures you have animated with this spell, rather than animating a new one.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you animate or reassert control over two additional undead creatures for each slot level above 3rd. Each of the creatures must come from a different corpse or pile of bones.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2012,"label":"Beacon of Hope","description":"

This spell bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2013,"label":"Bestow Curse","description":"

You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
    • \r\n
  • While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
    • \r\n
  • While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
    • \r\n
  • While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage to the target.
    • \r\n
\r\n

A remove curse spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2019,"label":"Blink","description":"

Roll a d20 at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane (the spell fails and the casting is wasted if you were already on that plane). At the start of your next turn, and when the spell ends if you are on the Ethereal Plane, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from. If no unoccupied space is available within that range, you appear in the nearest unoccupied space (chosen at random if more than one space is equally near). You can dismiss this spell as an action.

\r\n

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from, which is cast in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away. You can only affect and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that aren't there can't perceive you or interact with you, unless they have the ability to do so.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2022,"label":"Call Lightning","description":"

A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range directly above you. The spell fails if you can’t see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can’t accommodate the cloud).

\r\n

When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of lightning flashes down from the cloud to that point. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d10 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to call down lightning in this way again, targeting the same point or a different one.

\r\n

If you are outdoors in stormy conditions when you cast this spell, the spell gives you control over the existing storm instead of creating a new one. Under such conditions, the spell’s damage increases by 1d10.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th or higher level, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2028,"label":"Clairvoyance","description":"

You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The sensor remains in place for the duration, and it can't be attacked or otherwise interacted with.

\r\n

When you cast the spell, you choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

\r\n

A creature that can see the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from see invisibility or truesight) sees a luminous, intangible orb about the size of your fist.

","sourceId":1},{"id":2039,"label":"Conjure Animals","description":"

You summon fey spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • One beast of challenge rating 2 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Two beasts of challenge rating 1 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Four beasts of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Eight beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower
    • \r\n
\r\n

Each beast is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

\r\n

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

\r\n

The GM has the creatures' statistics. Sample creatures can be found below.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

\r\n
