14) Curse of the Bestial Form: For the duration of the spell the victims form changes and takes on one aspects of a beast of the casters choosing (such as changing the victims head to resemble that of a cow). This is a purely cosmetic change to appearance and does not grant any special abilities/modes of attack/extra senses/modes of travel or forms of breathing (so although you may change someone's form and give them aspects of a fish they would not gain a swim speed or be able to breath underwater).

\r\n

15) Curse of Harmful Healing: For the duration of the spell, whenever the cursed victim is healed they instead take necrotic damage equal to the amount of healing given. For example if targeted with a level 1 cure wounds spell they take 1d8 (+spell casting mod) Necrotic Damage instead of being healed.

\r\n

16)  Love Curse: For the duration of the spell the cursed victim believes one person or creature of the casters choosing is the love of their life and they become utterly and completely consumed about keeping that person or creature safe. This is beyond a charm or domination, this is the worst kind of obsession. The victim follows the object of their love and eventually stalks them or tries to abduct them in order to keep them safe.

\r\n

17) Corrupt Aura: For the duration of the spell the cursed victims aura is corrupted by necromantic magic. The Caster can choose one of the following:

\r\n
    \r\n
  1. a) Undead Aura: If anyone uses abilities, skills or spells to detect undead the victim will appear to be undead.
    2. \r\n
  2. b) Lying Aura: If anyone uses abilities, skills or spells to detect lies then the victim appears to be lying.
    3. \r\n
\r\n

18) Crimson Rage: For the duration of the spell the cursed victim is unusually angry and aggressive. Whenever they see blood they must make a Wisdom Saving throw (DC equal to the Casters Spell DC), on a success they remain angry/aggressive but can control themselves. On a failure they fly into a berserk rage, viewing all weapon wielding people/creatures as enemies to be slain and no longer recognises friend from foe. Although in a berserk rage, the victim is not in a barbarian rage so does not receive any damage reductions or bonus damage.

\r\n

19) Phobic Curse: For the duration of the spell the cursed victim suffers from a severe and debilitating phobia of the casters choosing. Whenever the victim comes into contact with the source of this phobia they must make a Wisdom Saving throw (DC equal to the Casters Spell DC) or be affected with the Frightened condition and must either move away from the source of their fear as fast as possible or become catatonic and remain stock still.

\r\n

Example phobias are:

\r\n
    \r\n
  1. a) Nyctophobia or Fear of the Dark: At night or when in dark places/caverns or in magical darkness the cursed victim becomes catatonic and remains stock still, should light be available the cursed target tries to remain as close to the light source as possible.
    2. \r\n
  2. b) Arachnophobia or Fear of Spiders: The victim must flee as fast as possible from any spiders or spider like creatures.
    3. \r\n
\r\n

20) Cursed Form: For the duration of the spell the victims form changes. Roll d100 and consult the table in the reincarnation spell to determine what race the new form changes to. No special abilities or Stat increases are gained this is just a cosmetic change of appearance.

\r\n

21) Animating Curse: Using the curse in this way raises the casting time to 10 minutes and it is cast as a ritual and does not use a spell slot but requires 300gp of additional ritual components such as herbs, incense, blood and engraved bones which are consumed by the spell. The caster places a curse to create one of the following effects & creatures created via this curse remain animated until they are destroyed or subjected to a remove curse or dispel magic spell. The Animation lasts for the duration of the spell.

\r\n
    \r\n
  1. a) Animated Armour: If the curse is cast on a suit of armour in a site where some one has died the caster can bind a splinter of a soul from one of the fallen into the armour and animate it as per the Animated Armour construct (see the Monster Manual). It takes the casters bonus action to command the animated armour. The armour must be mundane and you cannot animated magical armour.
    2. \r\n
  2. b) Flying Weapon: If the curse is cast on a weapon in a site where some one has died the caster can bind a splinter of a soul from one of the fallen into the weapon and animate it as per the Flying Sword construct (see the Monster Manual). It takes the casters bonus action to command the Flying Weapon. The weapon must be a normal mundane weapon and you cannot animate magical weapons. If you hold onto the weapon and try to fly with it then you need to succeed on Strength check to maintain your grasp and the weapons speed is reduced by 50%.
    3. \r\n
  3. c) Cursed Rug: If the curse is cast on a rug in a site where some one has died the caster can bind a splinter of a soul from one of the fallen into the rug and animate it as per the Rug of Smothering construct (see the Monster Manual). It takes the casters bonus action to command the Rug of Smothering. The rug must be mundane and you cannot animate a magical rug. The Rug you are cursing must also be worth at least 100gp.
    4. \r\n
  4. d) Animated Scarecrow: If the curse is cast on a mundane scarecrow in a site where some one has died the caster can bind a splinter of a soul from one of the fallen into the scarecrow and animate it as per the Scarecrow construct (see the Monster Manual). It takes the casters bonus action to command the Scarecrow.
    5. \r\n
  5. e) Animate Cursed Stone: If the curse is cast on someone who has been petrified, the caster can bind a splinter of the petrified soul and animate the petrified statue as per the Stone Cursed construct (see Mordenkainens Tome of Foes). It takes the casters bonus action to command the Stone Cursed.
    6. \r\n
\r\n

 22) Cursed Sight: For the duration of the spell the victim becomes convinced they can see invisible creatures moving and constantly flickering in and out of reality in their peripheral vision and becomes filled with dread that the shadows are waiting to jump out and stab them in the back. The victim suffers disadvantage on all concentration, investigation and perception checks due to the constant paranoia of seeing the shadows move.

\r\n

 23) Blood Thirst:  For the duration of the spell the victim needs the flesh and blood of sentient creatures in order to survive. Whenever they eat normal food or drink normal drinks they gain no benefit from doing so and the taste of normal food and drink is rancid to them, only the flesh and blood of sentient creatures will satisfy them.

\r\n

 24) Life Unending: For the duration of the spell, the cursed victim becomes functionally immortal, meaning they won't die from old age. However, they still age, they can still be poisoned, suffer diseases and illnesses and be injured by spells, weapons and accidents and be killed. If the victim does die, either by taking their own life or suffering a fatal accident or through general misadventure, then their soul remains trapped/bound to their remains forever but sometimes victims of particularly strong will can manifest as a poltergeist or ghost. This type of curse is often used as a punishment by Hags, forcing the victim to grow older and older and know that even death will not end their suffering. Should someone try to restore the victim to life the spell automatically fails unless the remains have a remove curse spell cast on them first.

\r\n

(DM Note, This one is manly a plot device for 9th level curses and this may not sound like much but think about it this way, if a human is cursed with this and hangs around to be 700 years old, they are not preternaturally youthful or graceful like an elf, they are a 700 year old human, they look ancient and wizened, their bones are fragile, their muscles wasted, every movement agony and likely suffering from some form of dementia and even death offers no respite).

\r\n

25)  Ritual Curse: The Caster can imbue one object or a piece of food or liquid with one of the curses above and can name a particular person it will affect. The effect of the curse comes into affect when the named individual other than the caster touches the object or eats the food or drinks the liquid. This curse can enchant an item or object at most dagger sized or an item of food no larger than an apple or liquid upto 1 pint.  Using bestow curse in this way raises the casting time to 10 minutes and, regardless of the spell slot used to cast the spell, the caster must maintain concentration on the curse until the object is touched/food or drink is consumed. Once the object is touched/food is consumed the curse lasts for the remaining duration of the spell.

\r\n

(DM note: think the poisoned apple in snow white for how this is used)

\r\n

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.

","sourceId":null},{"id":230627,"label":"Sickening Breath","description":"

Upon casting the spell, you inhale pulverise thw green-yellow powder that is needed for the spell. Upon exhaling, you breath out a thick, sickening fog that spreads in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute and take 1d10 poison damage.

\r\n

A creature that cast the spell may hold their breath to delay the actual effect. The exhalation is, in of it self, not magical, and can thus not be countered with a counter spell. 

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When casting the spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell deals an additional 1d10 poison damage for each spell level beyond third.

","sourceId":null},{"id":234953,"label":"Plague Grenade","description":"

A volatile mixture of poisonous gas explodes at a target location within range. All creatures within a 20-foot-radius-sphere of the location take 1d8 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a creature takes 3d8 poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can remake the save at the end of each of its turns. On a success, the creature is not poisoned.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, increase the initial damage by 1d8 and the damage at the start of each turn by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

\r\n

Inspired by combat skills for Darkest Dungeon, a dungeon crawl RPG by Red Hook Studios.

","sourceId":null},{"id":239998,"label":"Mineral Prospecting [HOL] [Liza]","description":"

The caster places their hand upon the ground and concentrates. After 10 minutes, the caster gains the ability to detect certain raw minerals and ores. The ores detected depend upon the caster's Cleric/Druid level and are subject to the DM's discretion.

\r\n

When cast as a ritual, the spell cannot detect minerals/ores with magical properties. The caster can use a spell slot to detect those ores. The more powerful the ores, the higher the spell slot needed to detect them. This allows the caster to only detect them, not to gain knowledge about their nature that they do not already possess.

\r\n

Important Things To Remember When Using this Spell

\r\n
    \r\n
  • The caster's hand must remain in direct contact with the ground for the duration of the spell. (This spell cannot be cast through a familiar.)
    • \r\n
  • For the duration of the spell, the caster is considered Blind and has disadvantage on all perception checks.
    • \r\n
  • Because of the demands of the spell, casting this spell as a Ritual more than once per day has a chance to add a level of Exhaustion. The chance is equal to the caster's Cleric/Druid level. Each level of Exhaustion adds a 10% penalty to the roll.
    • \r\n
\r\n

Minerals/Ores Detectable by Cleric/Druid Level

\r\n

If the caster is trying to locate a specific mineral/ore and it is present in the search area, then for each (non-cumulative) 10 minutes of concentration, the caster has a chance of detecting it that is equal to 2x their Cleric/Druid level.

\r\n
    \r\n
  • 03-07:  Common ores in dense concentrations.
    • \r\n
  • 08-12:  Common ores in less dense concentration. Uncommon ores in dense concentrations.
    • \r\n
  • 13-16:  Common ores in any concentration. Uncommon ores in less dense concentrations. Rare ores in dense concentration.
    • \r\n
  • 17-19:  Common and uncommon ores in any concentration. Rare ores in less dense concentrations.
    • \r\n
  • 20:  Can automatically identify any ore in any concentration. Automatically detects magical ores without needing to use a spell slot.
    • \r\n
\r\n

Casting Time, Duration, and Range

\r\n

Range:  After 10 minutes of casting and using their hand as the spell's point of origin, the caster becomes aware of minerals and ores within a radius equal to 10 times their Cleric/Druid level and a depth equal to 2 foot per Cleric/Druid level.

\r\n

After each additional minute of concentration, the spell's radius increases by 1 foot per Cleric/Druid level. The depth increases by 1 foot per 10 minutes minutes.

\r\n

At Level 20, the range of the spell increases significantly.

\r\n

Duration:  The spell lasts 10 minutes per Cleric/Druid level.

\r\n

 Reference by Level

","sourceId":null},{"id":249248,"label":"Advari's Meticulous Memo","description":"

Placing a quill or reed in a vial of ink, you are able to record the words of any creature of your choice that you can hear on a piece of paper or vellum within a 20 foot radius of yourself. You do not need to be able to understand the language to record it, but the writing will require translation. The quill will write for 10 minutes before stopping, or after writing one page.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the number of creatures whose words you can write increases by 1 for each slot level used above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":282785,"label":"Chrono Lock","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with a Chronomancer subclass such as the School of Temporal Magic)

\r\n

The caster halts the timeline of a single inanimate object for the duration of the spell. This object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds. The item does not age and cannot be moved or otherwise interacted with. It behaves as though an indestructible, immovable rod and gains immunity to all damage. When cast, a password can be assigned by the caster to end the spell early. This password must be spoken by a creature touching it. 

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 day for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":282792,"label":"Extra-Short Rest","description":"

School: Chronomancy (Transmutation)
(Intended for use with a Chronomancer subclass such as the School of Temporal Magic)

\r\n

You touch a willing creature who can touch another willing creature, making a chain of up to three. By synchronizing their timelines with yours you accelerate time for each target. You and these creatures are considerd unconscious for the spell’s duration. The spell ends early if any target takes damage or breaks physical contact. If a target remains unconscious for the full duration, that target gains the benefit of a short rest, and it can’t be affected by this spell again until it finishes a long rest.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the chain can have one additional willing creature for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":285278,"label":"Izzet Engineer's Lockbox","description":"

On casting the spell, the platinum rod becomes an ornate cryptex with a five letter code known only to you.

\r\n

When the letters are arranged into the correct code, you can use an action to summon a steel chest nearby that can contain up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving material (3 feet by 2 feet by 2 feet). It appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you. You may then use an action to touch the cryptex to the chest and send it into a safe pocket dimension.

","sourceId":null},{"id":288951,"label":"Aura of Transfusion","description":"

A mist of looming sanguine flows from within you in an aura of a 15 foot radius. This red mist drains the energies from living and undead beings. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Once activated you can use it immediately, then, on subsequent turns you can use additional actions to force a creature within the aura to make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a success, the target takes 3d8 necrotic damage, healing you and allies within the radius for the amount dealt divided between you at your choice, on a fail the creature takes half damage and no healing occurs.

\r\n

You cannot heal over your HP maximum and you cannot heal damage from constructs.

\r\n

Using this spell at higher spell slot levels you can target more creatures. At 5th and 6th you can target an additional creature, at 7th and 8th you can target two additional creatures, and at 9th you can target three additional creatures.

","sourceId":null},{"id":310671,"label":"Windforge's Wondrous Workbench","description":"

A large workbench appears in front of you, filled to the brim with drawers and slots. It can be as small as a 5ft cube and as large as a 20ft cube, and takes the shape of a workstation to accommodate for up to 4 different types of Artisan's Tools which you specify at the end of the spell's casting, provided you use those tools to cast this spell. (Forge for Smith's Tools, Distillery for Alchemist's or Brewer's Tools, etc.) One creature can occupy 5ft of this workbench to work at it. The workbench shimmers slightly, and exudes an aura of creation, as if pulling magic from the Genesis Forge itself. 

Whilst a creature proficient with the appropriate Artisan's Tools works at this bench, they can complete progress on Magical Item Crafting at double the regular rate of time, however it requires the regular amount of gold to create the item. While a creature works at this bench, they do not need to eat, drink, or sleep, and do not suffer the effects of exhaustion due to lack of sleep. However, it is impossible for them to gain the benefits of a Long Rest or Short Rest while they work at the bench. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":317955,"label":"Summon Extra Pair of Hands","description":"

A pair of spectral arms sprout from your back, ready to help. These arms can reach 5 feet away from you, and can be given short instructions, and implement them as you intend them. These orders can range from simple, such as holding an object in place, to complicated, such as attaching a component in a specific way, so long as it is a short instruction.. The arms can also work with each other.

\r\n

While the arms are summoned, you gain the following abilities:

\r\n

- You make dexterity checks with advantage

\r\n

- You can complete work twice as fast while the arms are summoned

\r\n

The arms have a strength score of 7 and dexterity equal to your own, but have only a carrying capacity of 5 pounds.

\r\n

 

\r\n

At Higher Levels: For every spell slot level used above 3 to cast this spell, the arms last 30 minutes longer, and for every 2 levels another pair of arms are summoned

","sourceId":null},{"id":352142,"label":"Conjure Lesser Aberrations","description":"

You summon aberrations that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • One aberration of challenge rating 2 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Two aberrations of challenge rating 1 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Four aberrations of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
    • \r\n
  • Eight aberrations of challenge rating 1/4 or lower
    • \r\n
\r\n

Each aberration disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

\r\n

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

\r\n

This is also designed to be used with the homebrew Summoner wizard tradition uploaded to D&D Beyond by AudibleShrug.

","sourceId":null},{"id":353619,"label":"Ashe's Memento Mori","description":"

You part the veil to witness the exact moment of a creature death frozen in time. You must have with you the corpse of the creatures who's death you want to witness when you cast this spell and the corpse can't be undead.

Until the spell ends, you can see the surroundings of the corpse at the moment of it's death. You see these surroundings as though you were standing next to the corpse. This spell doesn't effect the corpse or the creature's soul in any way.

","sourceId":null},{"id":353673,"label":"Dioghaltas' Dreadful Downpour","description":"

Dark clouds spread and rain down blood in a 30-foot-radius, 10-mile-high cylinder for the duration, centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast this spell, and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends, all undead within the spell's area of effect regain 1d4 hit points. Completely covering a creature from the rain blocks this effect.

\r\n

If you cast this spell in an area where a ceiling blocks the clouds, such as inside a cave or building, the rain pours down from the ceiling instead and the hight of the cylinder equals the hight of the ceiling.

\r\n

At higher Levels
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":358479,"label":"Ambidextrous (Augmancy)","description":"

Augmancy. To cast this spell, you must know how to cast mage hand. You do not need to learn or prepare this spell to cast it if you know mage hand and have an appropriate spell slot available.

\r\n

As part of the casting of this spell, you cast mage hand. For the duration, you can use your bonus action to control the hand, and it can make a weapon attack with a light weapon that lacks the two-handed property, using your spell attack bonus. On a hit, you can add your spellcasting ability modifier as a damage bonus. As part of the casting of this spell, the hand can draw a weapon that you are carrying or pick up a weapon that no-one is holding. The hand cannot load a weapon that it is holding, but it can fire a pre-loaded weapon.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When casting this spell with a spell slot level of 7th level or higher, you can make an additional attack with the hand when you use your bonus action to make the hand attack.

","sourceId":null},{"id":368670,"label":"Chain Heal","description":"

You cast a bolt of healing mist that hits up to 4 creatures. Healing the first target for 4d6, the 2nd target for 3d6, the third target for 2d6, and the 4th target for 1d6.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell with a 4th Level Spell slot or higher it increases the healing done to each target by 1d6 for each spell slot above 3.

","sourceId":null},{"id":374787,"label":"Espectral Eye","description":"

You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision, darkvision and can see invisible creatures and objects. The eye can look in every direction. The eye can go through solid objects unless they were protected by magic. As an action, you can move the eye up to 120 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence.

\r\n

If the eye is targeted by a gaze, like the Petrifying Gaze or a psychic attack, the user takes 4d10 psychic and gains one level of exhaustion, and the glass or crystal eye breaks. If the user suffers more than 10 points of damage above than his total hit points, the user becomes blind of one eye.

","sourceId":null},{"id":376964,"label":"Vatramere's Foldable Tent","description":"

In a 5 feet cube you conjure a small tent made of linen, silk or similar suitable materials. On the inside the tent is much larger and consists of three rooms, each about 10 feet tall and containing an area of up to 100 square feet.

\r\n

Each room is decorated differently, as chosen by you when you cast the spell:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • A bedroom with four beds or bedrolls and some chests
    • \r\n
  • A dining space with a table, chairs, containers and a small kitchen
    • \r\n
  • A lounge with couches, armchairs, side tables, footstools and a tiny stove
    • \r\n
  • A bathroom with a large bathtub and a washbasin
    • \r\n
  • An unfurnished, empty room
    • \r\n
\r\n

The interior of the tent is warm and dry, regardless of conditions outside, and it is lit by several oil lanterns. Any equipment or furnishings conjured with the tent dissipate into smoke if removed from it. At the end of the spell’s duration, all creatures and objects within the tent that were not created by the spell appear safely outside on the ground, and all traces of the tent and its furnishings disappear. You can cast this spell again while it is active to maintain the tent’s form for another 24 hours

","sourceId":null},{"id":385780,"label":"Recomposition","description":"

At the end of the casting time of this spell, you touch a dead creature. That creature's corpse undergoes a process of reverse decomposition, restoring it to pristine condition, and any injuries it may have had at the time of its death are repaired. This spell however cannot restore missing body parts unless those body parts are held to the corpse at the time of casting this spell, nor does this reset the time limitations that other spells have in raising the dead.

\r\n

If this spell has been cast on a dead creature that has been subjected to a failed Harvesting check, any unharvested materials become available again and may be subjected to another Harvesting check. A dead creature may only be subjected to this spell once; any subsequent attempts automatically fail.

","sourceId":null},{"id":400284,"label":"Atomic Reconstruction","description":"

You rearrange the atoms that you use as the material components for this spell into another form to create a compound. The following is a few compounds you can make with this spell, use it as a guideline for other things you might want to create with this spell. The amount of material that you rearrange/transform must be able to fit within a 3 by 3 by 3 foot cube. This cannot be used to create a living being.

\r\n
    \r\n
  • If you use charcoal, coal, or graphite as the material component for this spell, you can rearrange the carbon within to make diamond. For every cubic foot of these material components you use, you can make 50gp worth of diamond
    • \r\n
  • If you use charcoal, coal, or graphite as well as iron, you can make steel using the iron and the carbon within the other components.
    • \r\n
  • If you use sand, you can rearrange the silicon to make glass or quartz.
    • \r\n
  • If you use charcoal, iron, wood, salt, and water as your components, you can make arcane quality ink. If these components fully fill the 3 by 3 by 3 foot cube you can make 50gp worth of ink that can be used to transcribe spells.
    • \r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":401333,"label":"Dread Harvest","description":"

Your necromancy manifests as a ghostly blade that harvests life and transfers some of its energy to you. All creatures in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. 

\r\n

For each creature that failed its saving throw, your next weapon or spell attack that hits before the end of your next turn deals an additional 2 necrotic damage.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell damage increases by 1d6, and the attack damage buff increases by 1, for each slot level above 3rd. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":402361,"label":"Chariz' Competent Compass","description":"

Describe or visualize a location. The compass used as a material component for the spell points to the location for the duration.
The spell can find a location such as a town or a specific building, that you have seen at least once, either in person or through magical means.

\r\n

If the location you are trying to find is on a different plane of existence than you, there is a 10% chance the compass will instead point to a portal or other means of getting to that plane, otherwise the compass does nothing and the spell ends.

","sourceId":null},{"id":415579,"label":"Remote Library","description":"

You magically bind a book to a bookshelf, allowing you to remotely read the contents stored within those shelves provided you are on the same plane of existence.

\r\n

Once the spell has been completed, you can use an action whilst holding the spell book to speak the name of a book stored within the bookshelf. Once the name has been spoken, the pages of the bound spellbook will change to a copy of those within that book, although the dimensions of the book itself do not change.

\r\n

You can have a maximum of one bookshelf affecting a particular spellbook at any one time. Casting the spell again on either component ends the effect on the other, however you can have more than one bound pair of books and shelves active.

","sourceId":null},{"id":425724,"label":"Chronurgy Magic - Time Step","description":"

You take hold of the threads of time and pull yourself forward in time. You disappear then reappear in the same space up to 6 minutes later. If someone occupies your original space they get safely nudged to the nearest unoccupied space.

\r\n

Higher level spell slots: If you cast this with a 5th level spell slot, it's 6 hours.  If it's a 7th level spell slot, it's up to 6 days. If it's a 9th level spell slot, it's up to 6 weeks.

","sourceId":null},{"id":434803,"label":"Earth Glide (Elemental Spell)","description":"

While concentrating for the duration, you can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone at a speed of 30 ft. While doing so, you don't disturb the material you move through. When the spell ends, you can be trapped and suffocate, therefore it is important to exit the stone before the duration ends if you are a creature that needs to breathe. While in the stone, your burrowing is silent. While gliding through the stone, you can't see what occurs outside it, and any Perception checks you make to hear sounds outside it are made with disadvantage. 

\r\n

Minor physical damage to the stone you are in doesn't harm you, but its partial destruction or a change in its shape (to the extent that you no longer fit within it) expels you and deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage to you. The stone's complete destruction (or transmutation into a different substance) expels you and deals 50 bludgeoning damage to you. If expelled, you fall prone in an unoccupied space closest to where you first entered.

","sourceId":null},{"id":437302,"label":"Adaptive Body","description":"

 

\r\n

Your body starts to naturally adapt to any change that would harm it, but any adaptation takes 1 minute to take effect.  Only one adaptation can be active at any given moment, and the creature may choose which one is most suitable, or simply allow the body to determine what poses the greatest threat and choose accordingly. These adaptations include, but are not limited to:

\r\n

Gills: Generates fish gills on the sides of your neck that allow you to breathe underwater.

\r\n

Filtering Lungs: Filter out any poison delivered into the body either by the bloodstream or through inhaling, granting poison immunity.

\r\n

Darkvision: In the event the creature can no longer see it develops cat-like eyes.

\r\n

Glass Skin: Part of the creature's skin become glass-like and transparent, granting resistance to acid damage. This also causes it to become brittle and vulnerable to bludgeoning damage.

\r\n

Layer of Blubber: An extra layer of fat is formed beneath the creature's superficial skin that gives it extra insulation and provides resistance to cold damage.

\r\n

Photosynthesise: When hungry, the creature can sprout leaves from anywhere along it's body and perform photosynthesis in order to feed itself. In doing so, roots also sprout from anywhere touching solid ground and immobilise the creature while gathering necessary nutrients from the soil.

\r\n

Insulator: The creature generates a thin layer of wood around any conductive organ within it's body, protecting it form electricity and receiving resistance to lightning damage.

\r\n

Secretion: The creature begin to sweat profusely out of it's pores a substance that is incredibly hard to ignite, receiving resistance to fire damage.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, one additional adaptation can take place at the same time as others, up to 7 adaptations in total at 9th level.

\r\n

* Other adaptations are given at the DM's discretion, but no healing can be adapted into the body.

","sourceId":null},{"id":439506,"label":"Myriil's Interesting Inquiry","description":"

You gently tap into the boundless knowledge of the universe. Present a one sentence question about a subject that would normally require a History, Arcana, Religion, or Nature check in order to deduce. You learn the information as though you successfully passed the intended check, along with supplementary context as determined by the DM. 

\r\n

If the information you seek does not have a skill check associated with it, you receive a brief summary (less than six sentences) of the subject matter. The information you receive is accurate, but may be wrapped up in figurative language, or may lack key context. For instance, asking \"Why do blue dragons breathe lightning?\" may yield a response that references Tiamat and Bahamut, but does not explain who those entities are or their importance in the draconic pantheon. 

\r\n

Responses are always in a language that the caster can understand, and are strictly verbal. Pictures or text are never presented when an inquiry is being answered. Responses are received psychically by the caster- they cannot be heard by bystanders unless they possess telepathy or another means of reading minds. 

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":447597,"label":"Maim","description":"

You touch a creature, transferring a virulent disease into their body. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 8d4 necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The damage can’t reduce a target’s hit points below 1. If the target fails the saving throw, it can’t take reactions for the next 10 minutes as the disease clouds their brain. Any effect that removes a disease allows a creature to remove the secondary effect.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 3rd.

\r\n

From the Dark Arts Player Companion by /u/Jonoman3000 on /r/unearthedarcana

","sourceId":null},{"id":449009,"label":"Crushing Gravity","description":"

Choose a point on the surface of the ground that you can see within range. A 20-foot diameter, 30-foot high cylinder of heavy gravity pulls creatures to the ground. Flying creatures are pulled to the ground and their flying speed becomes 0 while within the area. This area is also considered difficult terrain. When a creature first enters the area and at the beginning of each of its turns it must succeed on a Strength Saving Throw or suffer 4d6 points of Bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. Flying creatures automatically fail this Saving Throw.

\r\n

For each level of spell slots used to cast this spell beyond 3rd, increase the damage by 1d6.

","sourceId":null},{"id":449019,"label":"Chrono-Regression","description":"

You may touch a willing creature, reverting its form to that of a previous second. Any damage that it has taken within the last round is halved instead, and any effects that it had gained or suffered are dispelled. Additionally, the creature is teleported to the same space it was in the previous round. If the creature was neither damaged nor affected by anything the previous round, it restores 6d4 hit points and is then teleported.

\r\n

This spell cannot revert back death, nor it can cause creatures to transport a distance further than 120 feet. If the space the creature is getting teleported to is already occupied by another creature, they both have to make a Wisdom Saving Throw or suffer 6d8 points of bludgeoning damage and the creature is not transported. If the space is occupied by solid matter, the target creature is moved into the closest unoccupied space.

","sourceId":null},{"id":454842,"label":"Collapsing Step","description":"

You tear through the fabric of this reality, allowing you to bypass space in an instant. With this spell, you teleport to an unoccupied location within the spell's range. Your initial position right before casting this spell becomes a void as you tear through reality to traverse space rapidly. All creatures within 15 feet of your location right before you cast this must make a strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d10 force damage and is pulled to the exact spot you were before you cast this spell. On a successful save a creature only takes half damage and is not pulled anywhere. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":485127,"label":"Whimshire’s Ferocious Familiar","description":"

This spell transforms the caster’s familiar into a more ferocious form. Upon casting, the caster’s familiar grows larger and gains a more aggressive appearance. The amount of hit points, stats, and actions the ferocious familiar possess are determinate based on the DM, the type of creature the caster’s familiar is, and the level that this spell is cast at.

\r\n

The transformation lasts for the duration, until combat ends, or until the ferocious familiar drops to 0 hit points and dissipates. While transformed, the caster can not see through the eyes of their familiar, but the familiar can be controlled all the same.

\r\n

Upon casting, the ferocious familiar’s initiative count becomes the same as the caster’s, and the caster can decide whether or not they want themselves or their familiar to move first on each round of combat. Upon casting, the ferocious familiar also regains all lost hit points. This spell can not be cast again while the caster’s familiar is already under it’s effects.

\r\n

When you cast this spell, choose up to 8 willing creatures within range. Each creature takes +12 to all Dexterity (Stealth) ability checks for the duration.

When you dab a specially prepared paste of mint and deep mushroom beneath each ear, make the correct hand motions, and burn a bundle of sage's moss you are able to locate forgotten knowledge within 30 feet by following the smoke from the burning moss which will waft in the direction of forgotten lore. The specifics of what constitutes forgotten knowledge and for whom the knowledge is forgotten may not be knowable for the caster.

","sourceId":null},{"id":567803,"label":"Silent Keeper","description":"

Upon completing the casting, you insert one of the gemstones into an eye socket of the skull.

While holding the other gemstone and on the same plane as the skull, as an action, you can see and hear as if you were the skull (using the base senses of the skull's race) until the start of your next turn. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

If either gem or the skull is dispelled or destroyed, the enchantment ends on all components.

","sourceId":null},{"id":582397,"label":"Dome of Defense","description":"

Prerequisite: A variant of Tiny Hut for those whose background or faith includes the idea of wards to protect your allies and/or frustrate your enemies. It is also more detailed and specific in its effects.

\r\n

As the final part of the spell is cast, a shimmering bubble of force expands out from the caster until it has reached either the maximum distance as specified by the caster or 10', whichever is smaller.  The minimum size it can be cast at is a 5' radius. It will pass thru anything inside its radius until it reaches its intended size at which point it solidifies into an up to a 10-foot-radius ellipsoidal dome of force locked to the surface under it with a 1\" flat surface of force that those inside will find themselves standing or sitting on.  Soft surfaces such as dirt will be pressed down if possible. Once successfully cast, the dome will remain stationary, relative to the surface for the duration, locked to a circular pattern of softly glowing runes around the inside border. Thus a dome cast on the surface of a large ship would move with it, but if cast on a rowboat, it would fail as the surface for it isn't large enough.

\r\n

The spell fails if:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • The area at time of casting includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures of small size or above. So a swarm of bats won't cause the spell to fail, but 5 mages with 5 donkeys will.
    • \r\n
  • The dome is too large for the area it is cast into . Thus a 5' radius dome could fit into a 10x10 room, but a 10' radius dome couldn't and would fail if cast.
    • \r\n
  • The creatures and objects inside at casting are positioned such that more than 100 lbs of force would be required to move them totally inside the dome. Thus an 8' tall ogre standing next to the caster would be fine, but if the same ogre was at the border of the spell and resisted being pushed inside by the spell during its final phase, it would fail.  
    • \r\n
\r\n

Once successfully cast:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • A vertical cross section of the dome is an ellipse specified by the caster ranging from a quarter sphere (height = 1/2 radius) to a hemisphere (height = radius) to an elongated dome (height = diameter). 
    • \r\n
  • Up to nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you, although if the dome is too small this number may be reduced by the GM. Tiny creatures which are not magically bonded or magical in themselves, like a swarm of bats or insects, don't count against this limit. But familiars and pixies, for example, would. A non magical pet bird like a canary, however, would not.
    • \r\n
  • Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it.
    • \r\n
  • Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. However magical items such as armor and swords, which were inside at the time of casting can pass thru it if carried by one of the people allowed to pass.
    • \r\n
  • Spells can be cast inside the dome, but their effects will not pass thru it. Thus if the caster's familiar leaves the dome, telepathic communication to it is blocked by the dome while it is outside since that is a magical effect. Similarly an echo knight's echo can not pass thru the dome. 
    • \r\n
  • Items not carried by a person inside the dome will not pass thru it. So you can't shoot arrows or toss rocks out of the dome, but you can step outside carrying them and then shoot them.
    • \r\n
  • Non magical small objects such as coins, gems, buckets of water, wine bottles, rocks or arrows picked up outside by those allowed to pass may be carried inside. Large objects, magical items, spell books, scrolls and the like which were not inside at casting may not and will bounce off the outer shell of the dome if someone tries it.  
    • \r\n
  • The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable, breathable and dry, regardless of the weather outside. Thus rain and clouds of magical gas will not pass thru it. 
    • \r\n
  • Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark.
    • \r\n
  • The dome is usually opaque from the outside, of any color you choose, but it is transparent from the inside. It may be made almost transparent from the outside, but a DC 10 perception roll will spot the tell-tale shimmer.
    • \r\n
  • As the dome has a floor, tunneling creatures may not bypass its defenses by coming thru it. 
    • \r\n
\r\n

The dome may be destroyed as follows:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • The caster leaves its area
    • \r\n
  • Time expires.
    • \r\n
  • A dispel magic cast at a level equal or higher than the dome will bring it down. This if the dome was cast using a 5th level slot, then a dispel magic would also need to be cast using a slot of 5th level or above to bring it down.
    • \r\n
  • Disintegrate ray or spell
    • \r\n
  • Anti-magic spell.
    • \r\n
  • Limited wish, wish or equivalent spell or ability
    • \r\n
  • Ironically a sphere of annihilation will not pass thru it or destroy it, but merely roll around its perimeter making this one of the few defenses against such. Note, however that no one in the dome can attempt to control such a sphere.
    • \r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":585374,"label":"Safiya's Industrious Worker","description":"

You touch a willing creature. For the next 8 hours, they are able to perform mundane tasks with exceptional speed.

\r\n

 Every hour spent crafting nonmagical items under the influence of this spell provides 4 hours’ worth of output.  This can be combined with other effects; for example, a character with expertise using this spell would produce 8 hours’ worth of work per hour.

\r\n

 At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":587008,"label":"Essence of the Wild","description":"

You gain one ability chosen from the list below until the spell ends.

\r\n

Echolocation. While you can hear, you have Blindsight 60 feet.

\r\n

Keen Hearing. You have tactical advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

\r\n

Keen Sight. You have tactical advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

\r\n

Keen Smell. You have tactical advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

\r\n

Pack Tactics. You have tactical advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are within 5 feet of at least one of your non-incapacitated allies.

\r\n

Pounce. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature immediately before hitting it with a melee attack, the creature must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the creature is knocked prone, you can use a bonus action to make a melee attack against it.

","sourceId":null},{"id":591584,"label":"Create Minor Helm","description":"

By casting this spell, the spellcaster can transform a normal chair or seat into a minor spelljammer helm suitable for powering a ship through space. This does not replace the need for a permanent magical helm on board, and is used primarily in emergency situations.

\r\n

The minor helm can power a ship up to 10 tons. In operation a minor helm is identical to regular, permanent spelljamming helm, with one exception. If a helm created by this spell is successfully dispelled, it will disappear and must be created anew.

\r\n

A ship powered by this spell travels at a speed based on the type of ship (using the ship's stat block) within the phlogiston, a crystal sphere, or in the sky or ocean of a planet and 100 million miles per day when at spelljamming speed while in the phlogiston.

","sourceId":null},{"id":593676,"label":"Griffin's Battlefield Bivouac","description":"

You conjure a 5 foot squared tent. The bivouac is stationary and, for the duration, you must be inside or beside the tent or the spell will end.

\r\n

The bivouac is larger on the inside, housing up to 10 medium creatures. It's lit by lanterns that you can light, dim and snuff at will, and it has cots of appropriate size for every creature that has entered it. It also has enough medical supplies for 4 uses of a healer's kit, and enough stale rations for any creature it houses. There are 3 windows, and the entrance, that allows its inhabitants to view the outside area. Anything conjured by this spell (that isn't already consumed) vanishes when the spell ends.

\r\n

For the duration, you can freely change the colour of the bivouac, including environmental camouflage to hide it from plain sight. When viewed from the outside, the interior seems long abandoned. Upon entering the abode the actual interior is revealed.

\r\n

While not impervious, the bivouac does provide protection to those inside. Creatures inside the tent can't be surprised, and are resistant to all damage types the first time they're damaged inside it.

","sourceId":null},{"id":605367,"label":"Fizzlewix's Portable Workshop","description":"

You conjure forth a single-story workshop, the workshop is 20 feet on each dimension made from stone, wood, or another suitable material. Upon casting, you can choose an artisan's tool that you are proficient with to be available within the workshop, anyone may use chosen tool for during the duration of the spell. The workshop changes its appearance and the materials within the workshop to suit the needs of the chosen tool. (Ex. if the chosen tool is Smith's Tools, then the workshop may contain a forge, anvil and various metals.) The workshop has enough materials to maintain gear, and to make simple creations or non-magical items. If someone wished to use the work area for something other than simple creations or gear maintenance, then they must provide the required materials. 

\r\n

At the end of the spell's duration, all creatures and objects within the workshop that were not created by the casting of the spell will appear safely on the ground where the spell was cast.

\r\n
\r\n

You know, I find it very irritable that most people don't find enjoyment in creating things. At least now those that do can do so while they travel. 

\r\n

– Gilman Fizzlewix

\r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":606292,"label":"Conjure Monstrosity","description":"

You weave arcane energy to produce a magical creature to help you battle your foes.

\r\n

You summon a monstrosity of challenge rating 1 or lower, with an intelligence score of 6 or lower, which appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The monstrosity disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

\r\n

The monstrosity is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the monstrosity, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the monstrosity, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

\r\n

Sample Monstrosities

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n
CRCreature Name
1/2Cockatrice, Darkmantle, Hippocamp
1Hippogriff, Death Dog, Category 1 Krasis
2Ankheg, Grick, Griffon, Mimic
3Owlbear, Phase Spider
5Bulette, Young Remorhaz
\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":626897,"label":"Ray of Fatigue","description":"

A purple coil of energy streaks from your hand toward a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 5d8 necrotic damage and gains one level of exhaustion, and until the spell ends, the target suffers the penalties for at least 3 levels of exhaustion at all times unless it is immune to exhaustion.

\r\n

At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

\r\n

Exhaustion caused by this spell is removed from a creature when it finishes a short or long rest with food and water to snack on.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

","sourceId":null},{"id":630289,"label":"Alcathar's Otherworldly Familiar","description":"

You gain the service of a particularly powerful familiar. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form.

\r\n

The chosen familiar can be a creature that is no larger than Small and has a challenge rating of 1 or lower, and must be from the plane of existance the material component used is attuned to. You can choose for the creature to take the form of an animal spirit, choosing to conjure a beast no larger than Small, though it shares the same creature type and statistics of the creature you choose.

\r\n

Your familiar acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. A familiar can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.

\r\n

When the familiar drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form. It reappears after you cast this spell again.

\r\n

While your familiar is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your familiar's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the familiar has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

\r\n

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your familiar. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. Alternatively, you can dismiss it forever. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

\r\n

You can have up to 3 familiars at a time using this spell. If you cast this spell while you already have a familiar, you can instead cause one of them to adopt a new form. Your familiar transforms into the chosen creature.

\r\n

Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch, your familiar can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your familiar must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

\r\n

Sample Creatures from different planes:
Feywild: Faerie Dragon (Younger), Pixie, Sprite
Shadowfell: Darkmantle, The Wretched
Elemental Plane of Air: Smoke Mephit, Steam Mephit
Elemental Plane of Earth: Dust Mephit, Mud Mephit
Elemental Plane of Fire: Magma Mephit, Steam Mephit
Elemental Plane of Water: Ice Mephit
Nine Hells: Lemure, Imp
Limbo: Choker, Flumph, Gazer
The Abyss: Dretch, Quasit

","sourceId":null},{"id":631723,"label":"Press","description":"

You touch two books, one written and one empty (or the materials to make one), on the same solid surface, next to a bottle of ink. Over time, the ink drains and the contents of the written book are copied into the empty book (which becomes a book if it wasn't already), in the same language, notation, handwriting, etc. as the original book. If at any point during the casting time you take a hand off either book or the ink spills, the spell fails.

\r\n

If you use this spell to copy a spellbook or spell scroll, the cost of the material components increases to match the cost of copying the spells in the spellbook (see Wizard's Spellcasting trait in PHB page 114) or the cost of scribing the scroll (see \"Scribe a Spell Scroll,\" XGtE page 133).

\r\n

At higher levels. When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may change one page per level above the 3rd as you like, so long as you can speak the words in 10 minutes or less. When you cast this spell from a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose to translate the new book into a different language, handwriting, or notation than the original, so long as you know both languages or notations.

","sourceId":null},{"id":631874,"label":"Earworm","description":"

Find out everything a creature knows about a specific person, event, subject, or group. The target creature must be restrained, willing, asleep, or unconscious in order to cast this spell.

\r\n

Gently tie a small thread to the tail of your centipede, and call upon the spirits under your control to inhabit this insect form. Hold on to the other end of the thread and concentrate on the information you wish to discover as you place the centipede inside the ear of your target. Give the bug about 1-3 hours to dig around for information before very carefully using the thread to extract the centipede. Roll a d20.

\r\n

On a 1 through 5, extraction is unsuccessful and the centipede remains within the target. Target loses 1 wisdom. permanently.

\r\n

on a 6+, extraction is successful. Eat the centipede to absorb what it has learned.

\r\n

If the target is awake through any of this process, they must make a Wisdom saving throw, greater than 15. On an unsuccessful save, the target will suffer long-term madness (see dnd madness table.)

\r\n

This spell may be used on a creature more than once, however, doing so is widely considered to be unethical. If the awake target fails a second wisdom saving throw, the target will develop an indefinite madness (see dnd madness table).

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":653161,"label":"Braxases Hyperbolic Time Bubble","description":"

A 10-foot-radius immobile bubble of temporal energy springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. Up to three creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the bubble with you.  The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than three creatures.  If you or any creature attempts to move, cast a spell or attack through the bubble’s boundary, the bubble pops and the spell ends.

\r\n

Creatures and objects inside the bubble experience time differently to the outside world.  Upon completing the spell, you choose to either speed up or slow down time inside the bubble by a factor of two. 

\r\n

For example, if time inside the bubble is sped up, a task that would take two hours of normal time to complete can be completed in only one hour of normal time.  If time is slowed down, a spell that usually takes ten minutes of normal time to cast, would instead take twenty minutes of normal time.

","sourceId":null},{"id":671982,"label":"Enhanced Familiar","description":"

Requires having the find familiar spell.

\r\n

This spell is cast in conjunction with the find familiar spell. Its material components replace the normal components of the underlying find familiar material components. You can cast find familiar as a ritual, but the Enhanced Familiar spell needs to be cast using a spell slot.

\r\n

Your Enhanced Familiar gains the following features:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Hit dice equal to your level in the class used to cast this spell.
    • \r\n
  • Your proficiency bonus increases are added to its to-hit, damage, and skill check modifiers.
    • \r\n
  • Your familiar can now take the attack action.
    • \r\n
\r\n

 When you cast this spell at higher levels (+25 gp additional material cost for each level upcast), for each spell level above 3rd, your familiar gains one of the following enhancements:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • 60 foot Darkvision.
    • \r\n
  • +30 feet to existing sense (Darkvision, Blindsight, Tremorsense, ...).
    • \r\n
  • +10 feet to movement (speed).
    • \r\n
  • Climb speed equal to 1/2 movement.
    • \r\n
  • Swim speed equal to 1/2 movement and water breathing.
    • \r\n
  • Crawling speed equal to 1/2 movement and air breathing (for water based familiars).
    • \r\n
  • +100 feet to communication and spell casting distance with your familiar.
    • \r\n
  • +3 to one stat to a max of 20 (can take once for each stat). Apply any stat modifier increase to the corresponding stat modifier value(s).
    • \r\n
\r\n

NOTES:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • This spell is NOT a ritual. It can not be learned by a Pack of the Tome Warlock with Book of Ancient Secrets invocation or a character with just the Ritual Caster feat. It can be learned by those sneaking, thieving Bards with their Magical Secrets  ability.\r\n
      \r\n
    • To be useful to Bards,  they will also need to have stolen to the original find familiar spell. If they acquired the original spell via the Magic Initiate Feat or levels in Wizard, it would be considered a Wizard spell, and the Enhanced Familiar spell they acquired via Magical Secrets would be considered a Bard spell. They wouldn't be able to cast both a Wizard and a Bard spell at the same time. NOTE: This is my Rules As Intended interpretation; as always, your DM can override this.
      • \r\n
    \r\n
    • \r\n
  • It makes perfect sense to have this spell available to Pack of the Chain Warlocks as a 5th level Invocation.\r\n
      \r\n
    • Should also apply to their Extended Familiar Choices (Imp, Quasit, Sprite, and Pseudodragon).
      • \r\n
    • Because Warlocks have an upper limit of 5th level spell slots available, it may make sense to allow two choices per upcast for Warlocks only.
      • \r\n
    • Because Warlocks don't have control over what level they cast this spell at, if they don't supply the additional material, the spell's corresponding level is based on the value of material components actually used.
      • \r\n
    \r\n
    • \r\n
  • It is perfectly legal to use the enhanced features to give your familiar darkvision and then extend its range using two levels of upcasting.
    • \r\n
  • This spell will NOT work with flock of familiars.
    • \r\n
","sourceId":null},{"id":679250,"label":"Empower Familiar","description":"

You transform your summoned familiar into a more powerful creature of a similar nature. Your familiar continues to act on its own initiative but it is now capable of taking the Attack action on its turns (and appropriate reactions, such as Attacks of Opportunity). You are still able to communicate telepathically with your familiar while it is within 100ft., deliver Touch attack spells through its contact, and see/hear through your familiar's eyes and ears. You may not temporarily dismiss your familiar while this spell is active. The spell ends early if your familiar's empowered form drops to 0 hit points. Your familiar reverts to its previous form when the spell ends.

\r\n

The Dungeon Master has your empowered familiar's full statistics. See the chart below to find the empowered form that corresponds to your familiar's current form:

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n

BatGiant Bat
CatTiger

\r\n
