","sourceId":null},{"id":183560,"label":"Capture Soul","description":"

You surround a creature in range with a foreboding force that threatens to seal its soul. If the creature is killed within the duration, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that can take legendary actions or has the Legendary Resistance feature automatically succeeds on this save. A creature automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it is unintelligent or doesn't have a soul; this includes constructs, most beats, certain types of undead, and other creatures subject to DM discretion. Any type of poe, ghini, ghost, or other spectral forms of undead that don't meet a previous condition automatically fails this save.

\r\n

On a failed save, you rip from the creature's corpse a soul which is sealed in the container used as the material component of this spell. Although this item is inanimate, it represents the creature's literal soul, which by your action cannot return to its body. If this soul is consumed or remains contained, the creature cannot be brought back to life.

","sourceId":null},{"id":184504,"label":"Greater Alter Self","description":"

Astaevian Spell

\r\n

You assume a form radically different from your own. When you cast the spell, choose one of the following options, the effects of which last for the duration of the spell. You can spend a minute to end the effect on yourself and instead choose a different option.

\r\n

Natural Regeneration. Immediately, and at the start of each of your turns your cells regenerate rapidly, you recover 10 hit points.

\r\n

Elemental Affinity. You appearance takes on qualities of a particular element you choose. You can choose between fire, ice, lightning, poison, water, or earth. You decide how these characteristics affect your appearance. If the element you choose has a damage associated with it, than when a creature makes a melee weapon attack against you, they take 2d6 damage of the relevant type. Additionally, you can choose whether you have resistance to the relevant damage type, or whether your weapon attacks (Including ranged) deal an extra 3d6 damage of that type. In the case you choose water, you gain resistance to piercing damage and become invisible when fully submerged in water. In the case you choose earth, you gain +1 AC and have resistance to slashing damage.

\r\n

Wings. You grow wings. Their composition is up to you (leathery, feathery, or some other kind of living material). While you have these wings, you gain a flight speed of 50' and can use a bonus action to bludgeon foes with them, using your spell attack and dealing 2d8 bludgeoning damage on a hit.

\r\n

Superior Enlarge. You grow up to two size categories. You can grow a maximum of four times your size and sixteen times your weight. When you grow a single category, your weapons deal 1d4 extra damage. If you grow two categories instead you deal 2d6 extra damage, and have -1 to your AC. Additionally, until this spell ends you have advantage on Strength saves and Strength checks.

\r\n

Superior Reduce. You shrink up to two size categories. You can instead shrink to a quarter your size and a sixteenth your weight. When you shrink one category, your weapons deal 1d4 less damage (this can't reduce the damage to below 0). If you decrease your size two categories, your weapons deal 1 damage, plus the appropriate modifier, and you gain 1 AC. Additionally, you have disadvantage on Strength saves and Strength checks.

\r\n

You can also choose to instead adapt a singular particular trait of a monster you've seen, such as a Fire Elemental's Fire Form trait, or a Barbed Devil's Devil's Sight. That trait can't be of from a construct, ooze, or undead, and must be from a creature of challenge rating 7 or less. In some cases, your DM might restrict a trait he feels is outside the scope of this spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":188215,"label":"Flesh to Flesh","description":"

You transmute the target creature’s flesh, causing it to rapidly grow around and over itself into terribly bloated, cancerous growths. If the target’s body is made of flesh, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the target creature is unaffected by the spell. On a failed save, the target’s flesh begins to rapidly grow in grotesque and horrid ways. At the start of the creatures next turn, its speed is reduced by half, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as Dexterity ability checks and Dexterity saving throws.

\r\n

If you maintain your concentration on this spell for the entire possible duration, the grotesque growths remain permanent until a Remove Curse or similar magic is cast on the target.

    • \r\n

A monstrosity summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

\r\n

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

\r\n

The GM has the creatures' statistics.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

","sourceId":null},{"id":193927,"label":"Exix's Elemental Polymorph","description":"

This spell transforms the caster into a new form.

\r\n

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any elemental whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the caster's level. The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen elemental. It retains its alignment and personality.

\r\n

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious.

\r\n

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

\r\n

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

\r\n

The spell requires the usage of gemstones depending on the elements, listed as follows:
Amethyst for Air
Garnet for Earth
Emerald for Acid
Ruby for Fire
Sapphire for Water
Topaz for Lightning

Additionally, certain gems can be used to make other elements, listed as follows:
Amethyst and Sapphire for Cold
Sapphire and Ruby for Smoke
Garnet and Sapphire for Poison
Amethyst and Topaz for Thunder

","sourceId":null},{"id":194849,"label":"Greater Detect Magic","description":"

For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 60 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a defined aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any. If you use your action to further focus on the same creature or object, the DM will give you a one-word insight to the purpose of the magic (ex: Control, Preservation, Warding, etc). 

\r\n

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

","sourceId":null},{"id":198314,"label":"Sonic Drill","description":"

You spin the adamantine shield rapidly, then strike it with great force, causing a focused burst of sonic energy to shoot from it in a 5-foot-wide, 100-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

\r\n

You can create a new line of sonic energy as your action on any turn until the spell ends.

\r\n

For the duration, the adamantine shield floats in front of you in your space, spinning and vibrating rapidly. A creature can try to halt the shield's movement, ending the spell early. If the shield is touched before the spell has ended, the creature touching it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature grabs hold of the shield and halts its movement, taking no damage and not being pushed.

\r\n

A line of sonic energy automatically erodes a Large or smaller nonmagical object. If the target is a Huge or larger object, a line of sonic energy disintegrates a 10-foot-long, 10-foot-high, 1-foot-thick portion of it. Magic items are unaffected by this spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":200301,"label":"True Polymorph Self","description":"

You transform yourself into a different creature or nonmagical object. The transformation lasts for the duration, or you drop to 0 hit points or die. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

\r\n

Creature. If you turn into a creature, the new form can be any kind you choose whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level. Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the new form but you retain your alignment and personality.

\r\n

You assume the hit points of your new form, and when you revert to normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you are not knocked unconscious.

\r\n

Your limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form, and can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech, unless the new form is capable of such actions.

\r\n

Your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment.

\r\n

Object. If you turn into an object, you transform along with whatever you are wearing and carrying into that form. The form can be no larger than 20 feet square. Your statistics become those of the object, and you are not aware of your surroundings or time passing in this form.

","sourceId":null},{"id":202482,"label":"Karsus's Avatar (12th Level spell)","description":"

To unlock this spell it requires a \"wish\" spell to gain a 12th level spell slot and then the spell Karsus's Avatar can be used and is a 6 hour ritual spell.

\r\n

Karsus's Avatar:  When Karsus's Avatar is used the caster will be allowed to become a god of their choosing, replacing a current god with themselves this effect lasts for an hour and the caster temporally gains all knowledge & power the god has. When the spell is over the caster may retain some of the knowledge and power the god had or not! But his body,soul and possessions are teleported to the random planes of existence of the DM's Choosing if the caster somehow returned to the material plane they are branded as heretics by the god and all creatures with 1000 miles aligned with the chosen god are compelled to seek and destroy the heart body and soul of the caster until the caster ceases to exist.

\r\n

To Prepare the spell  Karsus's Avatar  The following steps need to be taken.

\r\n

The gizzard of a Ancient gold dragon, The bile from a 12 headed hydra & The Heart of a pit fiend make to make the artifact the \"Unbounded Stone\" 

\r\n

The Blood of a Tarrasque, The body of a Planetar & The head of a Ancient green dragon to make the bodied artifact \"Epyon\" The Mighty Frame

\r\n

The Heart of a Pheonix, The eye of a beholder & The blood of a Kraken to make the artifact \"Embasahs Eye\"

\r\n

Each of the ingredients must be bound in a well, forge or place of tremendous magic to successfully make the artifacts.

\r\n

Once theses Artifacts have been made the ritual will require a 30 ft radius arcane circle with seven Lich phylacteries all placed along the circle as well as seven level 20 mages channeling their magic into each one of the phylacteries, the caster will then need to sit in the centre of the arcane circle surrounded by the artifacts to begin the channeling known as the \"GodBreaker Channeling\" to begin the spell.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":203888,"label":"Awareness","description":"

You create an invisible magical sensor that floats just above your head and shares your space. You can see through the sensor in all directions. For the duration, no melee attack roll can have advantage against you, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks that rely on sight.

","sourceId":null},{"id":204930,"label":"Instantly Permanent","description":"

You draw in great energy from within you and from the world to weave into an existing spell, bringing out it's potential. This spell will speed up the process of making a spell permanent. For this spell you must target a spell currently in effect that is not currently permanent and does not have a duration of \"until dispelled\". The targeted spell must have the possibility of permanence detailed in that spell's description, be it simply permanence or gaining a duration of \"until dispelled\" which will be considered the same for purposes of this spell, either by maintaining concentration for a period of time, such as Wall of Stone or by casting it repeatedly multiple times for a set period such as Teleportation Circle. You must be able to touch some aspect of the target spell's effect - such as the conjured item or affected area or the creature if it had been cast upon one - when you cast this spell.

\r\n

This spell when successfully cast will cause the target spell to become permanent or gain a duration of 'until dispelled' as detailed in that spell's description as if the conditions for such were met.

\r\n

This spell requires a material component of diamond material, be it full diamonds or as diamond dust, with a value in Gold Pieces (GP) determined by how the permanence is normally achieved; if a spell achieved permanence by maintaining concentration for a period of time then the diamonds must be worth 200 gp per level of the spell (the level at which it was cast). If a spell achieved permanence due to multiple castings over a set period the cost is 30 gp for each casting required in total and this amount is not reduced for any such castings already made (so if a spell required one casting per day for a year and we assume 365 days in a year the value of diamond material must be at least 10,950 gp or more).

\r\n

Upon successfully casting this spell you suffer one level of exhaustion and can no longer cast any spells greater than a cantrip by any means until you complete a long rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":206104,"label":"Mass Hemorrhage","description":"

A flash of red, and a lurching feeling downward emit from a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 25ft sqhere makes a constitution saving throw as blood begins to trail down from their ears and eyes. On a failed save, each creature takes 4d10 necrotic damage, and become poisoned, on a successful save they take half as much and resist being poisoned.

","sourceId":null},{"id":206946,"label":"Bodily Examination","description":"

You touch either a willing creature or an opposing creature, that has to make a Constitution saving throw, a willing creature in this case auto fails.

\r\n

You can for the duration look through the targets skin and view its inner organs, and freely manipulate them as you wish.
Some examples are:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Identifying Diseases.
    • \r\n
  • Causing internal bleeding or contortion.
    • \r\n
  • Changing, adding, or removing organs.
    • \r\n
  • Change appearance. (Hair colour, body size*, skin colour)
    • \r\n
\r\n

If you wish to implant something external into the creature's body, the creature can make another Constitution saving throw to reject it. If the creature fails, the external object melds into the creature's body and has to either removed by taking it out the same way it was put in, or physically removed.

\r\n

After the spell duration ends any effects you created during this time are finalised and become permanent. These effects can be reversed also by casting Greater restoration or Wish.

\r\n

*Can not change the effective size of a creature such as large, medium, small.

","sourceId":null},{"id":208333,"label":"Mind Palace","description":"

You close your eyes and utter a chosen word to transport you and a number of willing creatures that you can see equal to or less than your level to a location envisioned in your mind. Unwilling creatures must make an INT saving throw or remain unaffected. For the duration of the spell, time outside of your mind pauses to the perception of you and the chosen creatures, whose consciousnesses are existent in your chosen location. The location you have chosen in your mind is known as your \"mind palace\" and can either be a real place on any of the planes, or it could be completely made up. For the duration, all creatures can interact with anything and everything present in your mind palace, including you.

\r\n

Each creature you have transported gains temporary hit points equal to its maximum number of hit points. If a creature drops to zero hit points while present in your mind palace, their consciousness will return to their physical body in real time and they will be unconscious for eight hours. If you drop to zero hit points while present in your own mind palace, the spell ends, dealing 10d8 psychic damage to all creatures present in the mind palace, and deals one level of exhaustion to the caster. Creatures outside of the mind palace see no disruption in the flow of their own time, and can only witness the caster of the spell blink their eyes before the spell ends.

","sourceId":null},{"id":210672,"label":"Bloodletting","description":"

When extracted and imbued with the magic of this spell, your blood becomes a dark energy with a variety of uses. When you cast this spell, you take 4d4+4 necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount, this necrotic damage cannot be reduced by any means, although the reduction to your hit point maximum is reversed after you complete a long rest. Upon taking damage from this spell, you may choose one of the following abilities to use:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Hemokenesis. One creature of your choice within range takes 6d10 necrotic damage, and they can not gain hit points by any means until the end of your next turn. 
    • \r\n
  • Resilience. Your base AC becomes 15 + your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you gain resistance to non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 hour. 
    • \r\n
  • Vigor. One creature of your choice within range gains 25 hit points, and their hit point maximum increases by 25 for 8 hours. 
    • \r\n
  • Celerity. One creature of your choice within range immediately takes an action. 
    • \r\n
  • Malediction. All creatures within range must make a Constitution saving throw or become blinded, deafened, and frightened of you for 1 minute.

","sourceId":null},{"id":212945,"label":"Summon Major Demon","description":"

You utter foul words, summoning one demon from the Abyss. You choose any type of demon beside a demon lord. The demon appears in a unoccupied space you can see  in range, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when you dissmiss it. Roll initiative for the demon, and you control it, unless incapacitated, in which case it acts under the DMs control according to its nature. If you know the demons true name, it will never disobey you, even if you are incapacitated, and you can permanently destroy the demon outside the Abyss and use its energy.

","sourceId":null},{"id":217311,"label":"True Counterspell","description":"

You make a circular motion with your hands, producing an arcane mirror only you can see. You attempt to reflect the effects of a spell cast by a creature that you can see within range.

\r\n

If the creature is casting a spell of 5th level or lower, roll a d20. If you roll a natural 15 or greater, the effects of the spell are reflected back at the spell caster, and they take any damage or suffer any effects as if you were the caster. When you reflect the spell, use your spell attack or your spell save DC. Any charm effects that allow you to command a creature last for a maximum of one minute only.

\r\n

If you roll a natural 14 or lower, the spell is negated as per a normal Counterspell. 

\r\n

If the target spell is of 6th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. As per a regular Counterspell (PHB 228), the DC is 10 + the spell’s level to Counterspell normally. To successfully True Counterspell and reflect a spell above the 5th level, the DC is 12 + the spell’s level, with a natural 20 being the only means to bounce back 8th and 9th level spells.

\r\n

You may add your spellcasting ability to normally Counterspell, but to True Counterspell you must only use natural rolls on the d20.

\r\n

On a successful True Counterspell, you will be unable to cast this spell for 1d4 rounds. If you fail to reflect the targeted spell, you will be unable to take a reaction during the next round, even if you managed to Counterspell normally using this spell.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell at 6th level or higher, as per normal Counterspell, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used. 

\r\n

Additionally, the DC to True Counterspell and reflect a spell decreases by 1 for each spell slot you spend above the 5th. 

\r\n

On a success, if the countered spell causes damage, add an extra 2d6 damage for each spell slot above the 5th that you used to cast True Counterspell. The damage type is that of the countered spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":220369,"label":"Conjure Major Elemental","description":"

You call forth an elemental servant. Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water large enough to accommodate the elemental you summon. For example, a fire elemental emerges from a bonfire, and an earth elemental rises up from the ground. The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The elemental can  be any level.

\r\n

The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

\r\n

If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

\r\n

The DM has the elemental's statistics.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":220652,"label":"Soulforging","description":"

You and a willing humanoid subject must chant an incantation in unison during the entire casting time. At the end of this period the subject’s soul and consciousness leave its body. The subject must make a DC 14 Charisma saving throw. If it fails, you take 2d10 psychic damage and 2d10 radiant damage from waves of uncontrolled energy ripping out from the disembodied spirit. You can maintain the spell, allowing the subject to repeat the saving throw at the end of each of your turns, with the same consequence to you for each failure. If you choose not to maintain the spell or are unable to do so, the subject’s soul is traumatically drawn back to its body; the subject immediately drops to 0 hit points and is dying. If the save succeeds, the subject’s soul is transferred into the waiting soul gem and immediately animates the constructed body. The subject is now a gearforged. It loses all of its previous racial traits and gains gearforged traits. The subject’s original body dies and cannot be returned to life by any means unless its soul is freed from the soul gem. If the spellcaster dies during a soulforging, the subject also dies and its soul becomes a wraith. Up to four other spellcasters of at least 5th level can assist you in casting soulforging. Each assistant reduces the DC of the subject’s Charisma saving throw by 1. In the event of a failed saving throw, the spellcaster and each assistant take damage. An assistant who drops out of the casting can’t rejoin.

","sourceId":null},{"id":221083,"label":"Submerge Ship","description":"

When this spell is cast upon a vessel, the ship is surrounded by a protective bubble of constantly replenishing, breathable air and sinks beneath the waves. For the duration of this spell, the ship has magical propulsion that gives it a maximum speed of 2 miles per hour in travel, or 120 feet in combat. The ship's pilot uses the normal sailing skill to control the ship while under this spell's effects and can command it to dive and ascend as part of the vessel's normal movement.

\r\n

Despite the magical propulsion, the ship still requires its crew to perform its normal functions.

\r\n

The spell protects the ship and all aboard from the dangers of drowning and pressure, but not from damage from outside obstacles or creatures. The bubble cannot be used offensively and prevents an affected ship from rising into a space that won't accommodate it (like a sea cave too small to contain it, or under another vessel). Creatures can enter or leave the bubble at will, but those outside the sphere cannot be forced inside against their will.

\r\n

At the end of the spell's duration the bubble's pop causes a ship still underwater to gain the sinking condition. This spell has no effect if cast upon a ship in water that cannot cover the vessel entirely.

The illusion affecting a creature ends if it leaves the veiled vessel, even if they later return to it.

","sourceId":null},{"id":224672,"label":"Typhn's Matter Conversion","description":"

Using your knowledge of budding science and the weave, you utilize the connection between states of matter to alter your surroundings. 
You may choose to do either of the following: 

Either you alter the state of any material capable of doing so in the vicinity, into a liquid, solid or gas from its a previous state. E.G., Freezing water around you for 30 feet. as an Action.

Alternatively, you may condense this material from 30 feet around you into a large-sized ball of liquid or gas and then on your turn, use a bonus action or an action to have it move up to 60 feet and take one of the following actions, depending on the action.

Change state: Use a bonus action to change the state of the material, some of the other actions require a specific state to preform.

Crush: Use an action to bash the opponent with a solidified sphere. The foe takes 8d10  bludgeoning damage and 3d4 additional cold or fire damage if applicable, depending on the material. They make a Dex save, and take full damage and fall prone on a fail, and half damage, without falling prone on a success. (requires solid) 

Engulf: Use an action to cover a creature in a liquid or gaseous sphere. This creature begins to take 10d10 damage based on the liquid or gas that is engulfing them. (Acid, Cold, Fire, Bludgeoning, etc) They must then make a strength save or be swept off of their feet, allowing you to keep them inside the orb, to continue using the engulf action on them, and move them with the orb. Additionally, the poisoned condition may be applied if applicable.

Disperse: You release the gas or liquid from your grip temporarily, allowing it to surge in a 20 ft radius. All creatures within this radius must make a Strength or Constitution saving throw. depending on if it is Liquid or Gas. If liquid, then strength, they take 6d4 bludgeoning damage, 6d4 additional depending on the type of liquid, and fall prone on a fail. They take half and remain upright on a pass.  If Gas, then they make a con save, and on a fail take 8d4 damage based on the gas, and inhale it. Taking additional 4d4 damage. 
Note, this gas is Not Breathable.

\r\n

Fill: You can drop the solid material, gas, or liquid into any appropriate depository neatly and without a spill, by magic. However, if the container isn't large enough it will only siphon off the amount that would fit inside, and you would require an additional number of containers for the rest.

","sourceId":null},{"id":226528,"label":"Soulbind","description":"

A magical item in posession of the caster is bound to their soul. This process ensures that the only creature able to utilize the magical properties of the item is the one to whom the item is soulbound. This spell only works with a magical item that has been in use or possession of the caster for a minimum of one (1) year. This spell can be used on any magical item, unless specifically indicated otherwise (in the description of the item). A creature may use this spell on a numberof item equal to their Constitution modifier. If one tries to soulbind another item after that point, there is a stacking 25% chance (ie, 25% for the first, 50% for the second, etc.) that their body will collapse lifelessly on the ground while their soul and conciousness is fractured into the items they have bound. This binding cannot be dispelled or otherwise bypassed without destroying the item. If detected by a Detect Magic spell, the item appears mundane, but if one uses an Identify spell, the nature of the item and the person to whom it is bound are revealed.

","sourceId":null},{"id":227805,"label":"Summon Greater Familiar","description":"

You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose from the chart below. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.

\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n \r\n \r\n \r\n\r\n\r\n
CR Creature Name
0Frog, Sea Horse, Baboon, Badger, Bat, Cat, Crab, Deer, Eagle, Giant Fire Beetle, Goat, Hawk, Hyena, Jackal, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Quipper, Rat, Raven, Scorpion, Spider, Vulture, Weasel
