","sourceId":null},{"id":383614,"label":"Cold Storage","description":"

You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to a freezing cold pocket dimension. If you cast this spell on a living creature, the duration of this spell is 1 minute, and the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished to your pocket dimension. While there, the target is incapacitated and suffers 2d6 cold damage at the start of each of each of its turns and may make a Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If they succeed, the spell ends, and they reappear in the nearest unoccupied space to you.

\r\n

If you target a dead creature with this spell, this duration of this spell is indefinite. The creature's body experiences no decomposition while it is in your pocket dimension and the cold damage does not affect the condition of the body. When the spell ends, the creatures body reappears in the nearest unoccupied space to you and then warms back up to the temperature it had before it was banished.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th

","sourceId":null},{"id":384419,"label":"Aarion's Replenishing Infusion","description":"

You transmute the target creatures blood into that of a troll’s. While this spell is active, you can use an action to regenerate 10 hit points. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":386425,"label":"Time Anchor","description":"

Your magical ability allows you to keep yourself and up to five other creatures that you can see firmly planted within the current timeline.

","sourceId":null},{"id":387536,"label":"Adaptive Clone","description":"

This spell grows an inert fetus that can be developed into any medium or small sized humanoid creature's clone as a safeguard against death. This fetus forms inside a sealed vessel and grows to be ready for development after 120 days. It remains inert and endures indefinitely, as long as its vessel remains undisturbed.

\r\n

At any time after the fetus becomes ready, if a humanoid creature's flesh is put into the vessel, the fetus develops into a full-sized mature clone of that creature in 8 hours. The vessel must be sealed again right after the flesh is put into it. And the flesh must be at least 1 cubic inch and have been taken from the creature while it was alive or had been dead no longer than 10 days. The mature clone remains inert and endures indefinitely, as long as its vessel remains undisturbed and the original creature is alive.

\r\n

And again, at any time after the clone matures, if the original creature dies or has been already dead no longer than 10 days, its soul transfers to the clone, provided that the soul is free and willing to return. The clone is physically identical to the original and has the same personality, memories, and abilities, but none of the original's equipment. The original creature's physical remains, if they still exist, become inert and can't thereafter be restored to life, since the creature's soul is elsewhere.

","sourceId":null},{"id":394065,"label":"Stasis","description":"

This spell makes an object lose all gravity for 1 minute or until you trigger the spell with a reaction. If an attack has hit this object, it will fly in that direction at the speed it would normally fly if it was hit regularly when triggered by the caster. If the object is dispelled, the object will fly forward anyway with the momentum it was carrying. The direction will be the same as if hitting it and the object can not be moved. The item will fly averagely between all hits that it absorbs. The object is invincible when the spell has been cast on it.

\r\n

When the object hits a creature or structure, the enemy takes the same damage done to the item except turned into bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage depending on the object being flung with no added modifiers.

\r\n

You can not apply this spell to living or worn objects.

\r\n

If a creature holds onto the object while it is triggered, the person must make a DC 8+(damage to the item) strength check to be flung with the object. If they fail the check, they will let go of the object and take half damage to the item with no added modifiers.

\r\n

The distance the object gets thrown is scaled with how much damage the object takes.

\r\n

For every 10 Damage = 30 feet is how far it is flung.

","sourceId":null},{"id":398734,"label":"Widogast's Transmogrification","description":"

You permanently alter the physical body of a humanoid creature into another type of humanoid body. After encasing the target in clay, you conduct a rigorous one-hour-long ritual that manipulates the flesh and function of the target's body into that of another humanioid race. They lose their previous racial traits and instead gain the racial traits of another humanoid race of the target's choice, aside from their languages known (which remain unchanged). Should the target wish to alter their gender along with or instead of their race, they can choose to do so as part of the spell. When the ritual is completed, you and the target suffer one level of exhaustion.

\r\n

Once a creature's race or gender has been changed via this spell, they cannot be affected again by this spell for 1 year.

","sourceId":null},{"id":401520,"label":"Timeslip","description":"

You transport yourself back in time by any amount of time of your choice that is less than 5 rounds (30 seconds).
Your mind and soul are transferred to your body from the chosen time ago, complete with the equipment it had at that time. No duplicate bodies or items are made.
When the time travel is complete, each creature except you is unaware that the travel had been made. Until they are influenced or interrupted by you or anyone already influenced by you, they will make the same decisions they made that amount of time ago, and those decisions will bear the same consequences. Once the amount of time elapsed after the travel exceeds the amount of time travelled back, the flow of time will have been caught up, creatures will begin to make new decisions at their own will.
The material compenent of the spell is a sizeable amethyst crystal, valued at around 150gp, of which is shattered in the casting process. When travel is complete, the used crystal, wherever it was at the destination time, forms cracks and becomes unusable as a material component.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the maximum amount of time you can transport yourself back is increased by 5 rounds for each level above 6 this spell was cast at.

","sourceId":null},{"id":403815,"label":"Dig","description":"

From AD&D 1st edition. This spell allows the caster to move a 5'x5'x5' cube of dirt per round. The number of rounds the spell lasts is equivalent to the level of the spell caster and they must hold the materials in their hand for the duration. The spell will also do 5d4 damage per round to a Clay Golem.

","sourceId":null},{"id":406794,"label":"Maurynith's Material Fortification","description":"

Imbuing an object or surface with this spell, it becomes Immune to the effects of \"Fabricate\". It also gains an additional 20 Hitpoints and the DC to damage or destroy it increases by 15. The object gains Resistance to all damage types. For every 1 cubic foot of material affected by this spell, its total weight increases by 1 pound, also visibly shimmering in bright or dim light. At its lowest level, this spell can affect only Cloth, paper, rope, Crystal, glass and ice. This spell can affect a single object or surface that is a maximum of 20 cubic feet in all dimensions.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. Casting this spell at 6th level grants the affected area Immunity to fire acid and lightning damage, as well as the ability to affect wood, bone, stone, iron and steel. At 8th level can affect Mithral and Adamantine.

","sourceId":null},{"id":411107,"label":"Widowgast’s Wondrous Wagon","description":"

You conjure a mystical covered wagon in range that lasts for the duration. You choose its general appearance, but it must be able to be drawn by no more than 2 horses (or mules, oxen, etc.) and it must have a door with a knob. You and any creatures you designate when you cast the spell can enter and exit the wagon for as long as the wagon exists. You can will the door “locked” or “unlocked” if you are within 30 feet of it. While “locked”, the door can still be opened, but whoever opens it sees only an empty space of expected dimensions for a cart of its size. If the door is opened while the wagon is “unlocked”, it opens into an extradimensional space the size of a small, single level house. The atmosphere is clean, fresh, and warm.

\r\n

You can create any floor plan you like, but the space can't exceed 10 cubes, each cube being 10 feet on each side. The place is modestly furnished and decorated as you choose. It contains sufficient food to serve 3 simple meals for up to 10 people. Furnishings and other objects created by this spell dissipate into smoke if removed from the wagon. This space does not prevent noise from passing in or out, but the sensations of the wagon’s regular motion and acceleration felt by those within the space are reduced by half. The orientation of the floor of the space always matches that of the wagon.

\r\n

When the spell ends, any creatures inside the extradimensional space are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance.

","sourceId":null},{"id":412333,"label":"Merrilou's Familiar Resonance","description":"

When you first learn this spell choose an elemental type associated with your familiar from one of, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

\r\n

After years of academic research, the arcanists at Follaghel's institution have managed to reach the depths of the link between a familiar's soul and its master. When both the familiar and the master are in perfect synchrony and have utmost trust in one another they can merge themselves for a short period of time. The familiar gives its power of transformation and pure magical properties to the owner, who switches to a more animalistic and battle ready form.

\r\n

 

\r\n

Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost

    • \r\n
  • You gain damage resistance to the element associated with your familiar.

    • \r\n
  • You gain proficiency with your unarmed strikes, which now deals force damage equals to 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier.

    • \r\n
  • You gain a new ranged spell attack using pure arcane energy,  which deals force damage equals to 1d6 + your spellcasting modifier.

    • \r\n
  • When you hit a target with an attack the target takes an extra 4d6 damage based on the element of your familiar.

    • \r\n
  • You have advantage on all attack rolls.

    • \r\n
  • You have proficiency in Constitution and Charisma saving throws.

    • \r\n
  • You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn. You ignore this benefit if you already have a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives you extra attacks.

    • \r\n
  • You obtain characteristics belonging to your familiar's form, choose 3 benefits from the options below: \r\n
      \r\n
    • Your normal speed doubles.
      • \r\n
    • You gain a flight speed of 60ft.
      • \r\n
    • You gain a swimming speed of 60ft, and the ability to breath underwater. 
      • \r\n
    • You gain a burrow speed of 30ft, and can hold your breath for up to 10 minutes.
      • \r\n
    • You gain a climb speed of 30ft, and can climb without using your hands, even on upside down surfaces.
      • \r\n
    • Your jumping height and distance is tripled.
      • \r\n
    • You gain darkvision up to 120ft.
      • \r\n
    • You gain blindsight up to 60ft.
      • \r\n
    • You ignore movement restrictions caused by environment and dificult terrain.
      • \r\n
    • Attacks of opportunity are made with disavantage against you.
      • \r\n
    • You have advantage on perception checks that rely on sight or hearing or smell.
      • \r\n
    \r\n
    • \r\n
\r\n

Immediately after the spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

\r\n

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the extra damage on hits increases by 1d6 and the temporary hit points increase by 10 for each slot level above 6th.

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":416210,"label":"Polymorph Aspect","description":"

Choose one creature that you can see within range. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw for the spell to have any effect. If the spell succeeds you transform an aspect of them to achieve a desired outcome, simple to complex, see the list below for examples. The more complex the aspect change the more difficult the spell is. Complex changes that the caster has never done successfully before require a successful DC 16 Intelligence check to ensure the change is done to accurately reflect the creatures anatomy. On a failed check the target creature takes 1d4 bludgeoning damage and the spell ends.

\r\n

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the spell lasts for 24 hours or until it is dispelled. If this same spell is cast on the same creature for seven consecutive days it becomes permanent, and can only be undone by the power of Wish (or equivalent), or a similar polymorph effect reversing it.

\r\n

This spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points. An unwilling creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it succeeds, it isn't affected by this spell. 

\r\n

Simple aspects:
Skin colour, 
Claws / spines,
Hair colour / style,
Any change that is largely cosmetic

\r\n

Moderate aspects:
Weight / muscle tone changes,
Height / length changes (no more than two inches)
Any changes that affect simple functions

\r\n

Complex aspects:
Gills / water breathing,
Eagle eyesight,
Improved hearing,
Racial abilities,
Anything that affects or creates complex bodily functions.

\r\n

Discuss your desired change with your DM to determine their difficulty. 

\r\n

 

","sourceId":null},{"id":421969,"label":"All Time Low","description":"

You crush a timepiece in your hand at a creature you can see within range. It must make a Charisma saving throw or be removed from time. If it succeeds, it is stunned until the end of its next turn, wracked with visions of its non-existence. If it fails, it is utterly removed from time, as if it had never existed. It occupies a space outside any plane or reality, frozen, conscious, but unable to sense. Memory of the creature is suppressed from all beings lesser to gods, unconscious but not fully erased. Physical evidence of the creature's existence remains. If the creature has a CR or level of 10 or lower, it automatically fails the saving throw.

\r\n

This spell can alternatively be used to bring a creature back into time that has been cast out by this spell or a similar effect. You speak the creature's name and it returns to time where it was removed, or the closest available space.

\r\n

 

\r\n

created by swordmeow

\r\n

www.patreon.com/meowmagic

","sourceId":null},{"id":422778,"label":"Mental Rewind","description":"

You walk along a creature's own timeline, seeing events from their perspective. One creature that you touch can make a Charisma saving throw. You cannot tell if it succeeded or failed, only that it attempted to resist the spell. A willing creature can choose not to resist.

\r\n

You can see any event experienced by the creature in the last 24 hours that lasted no longer than 1 hour.

\r\n

If the creature failed its saving throw, what you see is true and you gain insight into the creature's emotional state during this time period. If the creature was under the effect of the modify memory spell, you see events as they truly happened.

\r\n

If the creature succeeded on its saving throw, it controls what you see and can show you falsehoods, conceal its feelings about the memories, and alter events to its choosing.

\r\n

You experience the memories at a greater speed than the world around you moves, and no matter how much information you see, the spell lasts only 10 minutes.

\r\n

When this spell is cast at higher levels, you can see longer events from longer ago. At sixth level, you can see any event that took place up to 1 week ago and that lasted no longer than 1 day. At seventh level, you can see any event that took place up to 1 month ago and that lasted no longer than 1 week. At eighth level, you can see any event that took place up to 1 year ago that lasted no longer than 1 month or at 9th level, any event that lasted no longer than 1 year from any time in the creature’s past.

","sourceId":null},{"id":422783,"label":"Redsyn’s Relativity","description":"

You pull an area not exceeding 50 connected 10 foot by 10 foot cubes out of the flow of time and into a pocket dimension. While you and those in your pocket dimension experience 24 hours, you may choose any time period between 1 hour and 1 week to go by in the plane that this spell was cast in. You may leave the demiplane at any time by means of the planeshift spell or other cross-planar travel, but the area taken will not return to its place of origin until the period is over.

\r\n

If a creature is not fully contained in a border cube, the creature is shunted out of the area and is not taken to the demiplane. In the plane of origin, the shape of what was taken remains, though is now greyed out and cannot be interacted with. The area taken returns to the same location once the spell ends.

\r\n

If this spell is cast within a demiplane created by this spell, the effects stack. If the demiplane of origin expires, the area taken returns to its original location. However the time of the second demiplane remains relative to the time of the first, even after the expiration of the first demiplane.

","sourceId":null},{"id":428872,"label":"Create Myrmidon","description":"

You summon an elemental and bind it to the armor component of the spell, creating a myrmidon in your service, the kind determined from the relevant component used (Mordenkainen's Tome of Foes, 202). The myrmidon obeys your commands and takes its turn immediately after yours in combat. If it dies, it is freed and returns to its own plane. The armor is ruined unless the myrmidon is dispelled with dispel magic.

\r\n

If you cast this spell to create a second myrmidon of the same element as any previously created and still in service, the previous gains autonomy and is not bound to your service any longer.

\r\n

 

\r\n

created by swordmeow

\r\n

www.patreon.com/meowmagic

","sourceId":null},{"id":430432,"label":"Resonant Echo","description":"

You are able to focus the powers of dunamis and create an echo of yourself in a space within 15 feet of you. This echo is a magical, translucent, gray image of you that lasts until it is destroyed, until you dismiss it as a bonus action, until you manifest another echo, or until you’re incapacitated.

\r\n

Your echo has AC 14 + your proficiency bonus, 1 hit point, and immunity to all conditions. If it has to make a saving throw, it uses your saving throw bonus for the roll. It is the same size as you, and it occupies its space. On your turn, you can mentally command the echo to move up to 30 feet in any direction (no action required). If your echo is ever more than 30 feet from you at the end of your turn, it is destroyed.

\r\n

You can use the echo in the following ways:

\r\n
    \r\n
  • As a bonus action, you can teleport, magically swapping places with your echo at a cost of 15 feet of your movement, regardless of the distance between the two of you.
    • \r\n
  • When you take the Attack action on your turn, any attack you make with that action can originate from your space or the echo’s space. You make this choice for each attack.
    • \r\n
  • When a creature that you can see within 5 feet of your echo moves at least 5 feet away from it, you can use your reaction to make an opportunity attack against that creature as if you were in the echo’s space.
    • \r\n
  • You can choose to cast a spell of 4th level or lower from the echo's space, and if you do, the echo is destroyed after the spell is cast from that space.
    • \r\n
\r\n

At Higher Levels. For each level above 4th you cast this at, you can cast one level higher of a spell from the echo's space.

","sourceId":null},{"id":431571,"label":"Farcall","description":"

You focus on the component and call upon a particular creature with which you are familiar and that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target becomes aware that you are trying to contact it during the casting of the spell and can choose not to allow the spell to connect.

\r\n

The spell creates a two-dimensional sensor, 2 feet in diameter, within 10 feet of the target. For the duration the component serves as a communication focus, through which creatures on both sides of the spell are able to see and hear. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 10 feet of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous disk, 2 feet in diameter.

\r\n

Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose an object that you are familiar with and which meets the material component requirements of this spell. When you do, the object serves as the sensor.

","sourceId":null},{"id":439993,"label":"Gravitational Ravage","description":"

You make a ranged spell attack roll against a target within 120 feet of you. If your attack hits, the target takes 8d6 force damage as you rip their body apart. At the end of each of their turns a creature can make a constitution saving throw or take 4d6 damage. On a success the spell ends.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you deal one extra d6 of damage.

","sourceId":null},{"id":440828,"label":"Conjure Supreme Elemental","description":"

You call forth an elemental servant. Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water that fills a 20-foot cube within range. An elemental of challenge rating 11 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. For example, a fire elemental emerges from a bonfire, and an earth elemental rises up from the ground. The elemental disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, if the spell ends you must make CHA saving throw against your spell save DC + 1 for each level above 7th, if you fail the elemental becomes uncontrolled by you(see below).

\r\n

If your concentration is broken, the elemental doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you lose control.

\r\n

The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

\r\n

The GM has the elemental's statistics. Sample elementals can be found below.

\r\n

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level you may instead summon an elemental of challenge rating 20 or lower, at 9th level you may instead summon an elemental of challenge rating 25 or lower.

\r\n

Sample Elementals

16Phoenix

","sourceId":null},{"id":453856,"label":"Solomon's Connect Objects","description":"

You touch two identical objects each weighing 5 pounds or less whose longest dimension is 2 feet or less. The spell connects the targeted objects, binding their fates together.

\r\n

Until the spell ends, any alteration to one object also occurs to the connected object. Spells cast on one object also affect the other object. The objects remain connected as long as they are both on the same plane of existence.

\r\n

If either object is used to create a magic item or if both objects are no longer on the same plane of existence, this spell's effect ends.

\r\n

Dispel Magic or a similar effect successfully applied to either of the objects ends this spell's effect.

","sourceId":null},{"id":457899,"label":"Diverge Future","description":"

Immediately when you stop casting the spell, time freezes in the world around you, and you create a divergent timeline that you are able to live through. Events play out as they would if you hadn't cast this spell, but you are in a temporary world. You are able to live through this world, discovering what would happen if you took a certain set of actions. The spell ends if you die in this alternate timeline, or until you use an action to return to your real timeline. 

\r\n

If you gain any levels while under the effect of this spell, you lose them when this spell ends. Any objects you grab or interact with are returned to their original position before you cast this spell. You appear in this timeline in the same condition you were before you cast this spell, holding and wearing everything you had on your person before. Nothing about the world around you changes when you cast this spell, everything appears to be the same and you can interact with the world as usual, but after the spell ends any changes you made to the world around you are undone. 

\r\n

If you take any damage in this alternate world, you don't take it in the real world, and your real form is not damaged or changed at all when you cast this spell. No changes to the world you make while under the effects of this spell are real, all of them stop after you cast this spell. 

","sourceId":null},{"id":474265,"label":"Create Daemon","description":"

You gain the service of a daemon, an extension of your soul that takes an animal form you choose. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the daemon has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, fiend or aberration (your choice) instead of a beast. Depending on the type, this spell has an additional component, worth 50 GP, which is consumed.

\r\n
    \r\n
  • Celestial: holy water or silver and iron filings
    • \r\n
  • Fey: rare mushrooms
    • \r\n
  • Fiend: the blood of a humanoid
    • \r\n
  • Aberration: an intricate sculpture with complex geometry made of glass or crystal
    • \r\n
\r\n

Your daemon acts independently of you, but it always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn.

\r\n

When the daemon drops to 0 hit points, it disappears, leaving behind no physical form, and you take damage equal to its maximum hitpoints. It reappears after you cast this spell again.

\r\n

While your daemon is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action, you can see through your daemon's eyes and hear what it hears until the start of your next turn, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the daemon has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses.

\r\n

As an action, you can temporarily dismiss your daemon. It disappears into a pocket dimension where it awaits your summons. As an action while it is temporarily dismissed, you can cause it to reappear in any unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.

\r\n

You can't have more than one daemon at a time. Finally, when you cast a spell with a range of touch or self, your daemon can deliver the spell as if it had cast the spell. Your daemon must be within 100 feet of you, and it must use its reaction to deliver the spell when you cast it. If the spell requires an attack roll, you use your attack modifier for the roll.

","sourceId":null},{"id":477706,"label":"Arcane Time Travel","description":"

This spell enables you to visit other historical time periods in the DND universe, such as the Sundering, Spellplague, the Netherise Empire, Karsus's Folly, or other times, as well as to travel to the future. Your actions in the past change the present.

\r\n

You draw on the ground a circle of sigils with a diameter of 10ft, placing the material components and the objects or creatures you want to send to another time in the circle, and within a height of 10ft from the floor (a cylinder). The blessing and approval of at least one God for your journey must be secured for the spell to work. Once the casting time is finished, you touch the edge of the circle, the material components are instantly consumed, and you unleash an unimaginable amount of magical energy into the cylinder, which teleports those inside, and the air around them, to a time of your choosing (you can be in the circle as well). A thin slice of the floor will be transported, but not the sigils. A Thunderwave blast will be followed by a strong suction wind as air rushes in to fill the vacuum. The destination time can be no further than 5,000 years into the future or past. The physical location of arrival can be anywhere you decide in the material plane. The time travellers will instantaneously be transported, and will only notice a flash of light and a sudden change of scenery. At the destination, strong winds will erupt away from the time travellers as they appear and air is displaced. If the destination area is occupied, the cylinder will be moved to the closest available free space. Casting the spell is an ordeal, and has a 50% chance of instantly killing and disintegrating the caster. If multiple mages assist in the casting, this risk is reduced by half for each extra caster, with 3 extra casters being the recommended number.

\r\n

The Effects of Time Travel:

\r\n

Time travel to the future is simple. Time travel to the past, however, creates a new history. Time travellers to the past alter the fabric of reality and change the future automatically as soon as they arrive. People in the present are unaware that the past is being altered, as memories change along with buildings and histories. If you make it obvious, intelligent beings and later historians will realise you were from the future. Once the spell has been activated the God’s blessing is no longer required, and the God might not even exist at the destination depending on time chosen. Depending on when they arrive, time travellers might find themselves disconnected from their deities, or cut off from their powers. A Truesight spell will expose a time traveller, who will be detected as an alien planar entity, foreign to that reality. If travellers want to return to their time of origin, magic must exist as it was known in their original time, they will need a mage that knows this spell, and have the material components. (You cannot cast this spell during the historical Spellplague event for example. You can go there, but not leave).

\r\n

When a time traveller returns home to the present he will be confronted by an alternate version of himself, if he hasn’t erased himself already. Travellers can prevent themselves from being born and therefore be erased from history, but their current bodies and souls won’t be erased, since any creature or item that travels through time with this spell becomes automatically immune to changes in history and time paradoxes caused by this spell. Thus a traveller can kill his grandfather in the past and not be affected, but no one in his own time will recognise him on his return to an altered present. When they return they might not recognise their home time, as their actions in the past could have caused a wide variety of changes, decided by the DM. If a time traveller’s mind is read or if they tell others about this spell in the past, it could potentially lead to others learning the Time Travel spell, causing a potential spiral into chaos. Travelling to the past alters and erases the entire universe you came from, and replaces it with an alternate version. For this reason the spell is a complete secret and is nearly impossible to cast. The goddess of magic Mystra forbade the use of this spell after Karsus's Folly, however after her death it is unknown if the spell can be performed again.

\r\n

(This is actually a 13th level spell, not a 9th level spell)

","sourceId":null},{"id":499922,"label":"Timeless Sanctum","description":"

You draw upon the ground, a circle of runes diagrams of time and as the last magical syllable is spoken, the chalk turns invisible. If anyone passes through these runes whilst the spell is being casted, the spell is lost.

\r\n

This spell can have one of two effects, either to quicken time inside, or outside the circle as the spell creates an extradimensional, time-altering sanctum.

\r\n

Slow Time: When quickening the time inside the circle, you have and the creatures in the sphere have one hour where everything outside the circle is, relatively to the time inside the sphere, at a halt. 

\r\n

Accelerate: If you accelerate the time outside the circle, one hour passes in an instant for all inside the circle.

\r\n

Whilst in effect, creatures inside the sphere can interact with or percieve no creatures or objects outside the circle, as can creatures outside not percieve or interact with creatures inside the sphere. If a creature inside the circle moves out of the circle, the spell is dispelled. No sound penetrates the sphere whilst the spell is in effect, nor does any magic that does not dispel it. The only give-away of the spell is that a creature that passes through the sphere whilst it is in affect but is not affected by it has a strong feeling of Déjá Vu.

\r\n

One can detect this spell by casting a detect magic and thereby see the circle of runes drawn. Any creature that can see invisible creatures can observe silhouettes of the creatures inside the sphere. A creature within the effect of a timeless sanctum can be scryed on as any other creature, though if the circle is set to fasten the time outside the circle, the creature scryed upon remains in a still and breathless in position. Creatures residing on parallel planes of existence, such as the ether or the shadowfell may be unaffected or affected differently by this spell since time works differently in these planes. An erase spell can end this spell by dispelling the runes, as can any other spell that can dispell the runes.

\r\n

If the spell is dispelled or the effect is broken by a creature moving outside the sphere, each creature within the sphere takes 2d10 force damage for each hour spend in the Timeless Sanctum as the very fabric of time catches up with them.

\r\n

At Higher Level: If cast at a higher level than sixth, increase the talteration of time with one hour for each spell slot beyond the fifth used. For each spell slot beyond the sixth that is spend, the amount of magical chalk that is used to cast the spell increases with 100gp worth.

","sourceId":null},{"id":502798,"label":"Create Lava Terrain","description":"

Using the magma underneath the ground, you superheat the ground, causing it to become hot lava and magma in a 20-foot wide path that is 30 feet long. Anyone that starts or ends their turn in the path takes 3D10 fire damage, and had their movement speed halved. If something stays in for 3 rounds or more, their flammable, non-magical gear starts to melt. If they leave the area before it is completely melted at the of the 10th round, the object is malleable, and be repaired if it possibly can, otherwise, it is destroyed. 

\r\n

At higher levels, the D10 increases by +1 for every level.

","sourceId":null},{"id":505299,"label":"Create Elemental Myrmidon","description":"

You call forth an elemental spirit binding it to a suit of specially constructed suit of armor, creating a myrmidon. Choose an area of air, earth, fire, or water that fills a 10-foot cube within range. An elemental myrmidon appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. For example, a fire myrmidon emerges from a bonfire, and an earth myrmidon rises up from the ground.

\r\n

The myrmidon is friendly to you and your companions for 1 hour. Roll initiative for the elemental, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

\r\n

After 1 hour or if your concentration is broken, the myrmidon doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack.

\r\n

If the myrmidon's memories are wiped through a 9th lvl Modify Memory spell or similar magic it will be loyal to its creator and serve it until one of them dies.

","sourceId":null},{"id":506738,"label":"Galaholm's Tiny Hut","description":"

A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

\r\n

Five creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than five creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside.

\r\n

Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is opaque from the outside, of any color you choose, but it is transparent from the inside. 

\r\n

As a result of Galaholm's magical tinkering, this version of Tiny Hut has a separate temporal field inside of it, where every minute inside the Tiny Hut is an hour in the material plane, however a flaw in the tinkering resulted in a longer casting time and a reduced size of the Tiny Hut itself.

","sourceId":null},{"id":516324,"label":"Better Demiplane","description":"

You create a shining door on a flat solid surface that you can see within range. The door is large enough to allow Medium creatures to pass through unhindered. When opened, the door leads to a demiplane that appears to be an empty room 100 feet wide, 75 feet deep, and 30 feet tall, being made of wood, stone, or metal. When the spell ends or is dispelled, the door disappears, and any creatures or objects inside the demiplane remain trapped there, as the door also disappears from the other side.

\r\n

Each time you cast this spell, you can create a new demiplane, or have the shining door connect to a demiplane you created with a previous casting of this spell. Additionally, if you know the nature and contents of a demiplane created by a casting of this spell by another creature, you can have the shining door connect to its demiplane instead. The caster can also join two or more demiplanes provided they were created by the caster. Two or more different casters cannot combine their demiplanes.

\r\n

When cast at a higher level, for each spell slot higher than 6th, caster can choose between having the dimensions increase by 15% or have the duration of the extend by 30 mins.

\r\n

Demiplane should be allowed at lower levels of play and to more classes (depending on how the campaign is flavored) if you are doing a large, 20th-level or higher campaign. This is why I made this personal rendition of Demiplane.

\r\n

Credit to Wizards of the Coast for most of the framing of this spell.

","sourceId":null},{"id":523754,"label":"Construct Titan","description":"

Construct a creature with a CR between 14 - 17 out of rubble fashioned in the style of a beast or construct to aid you givin that you enough rubble nearby. This construct crumbles after you cast another construct spell or if construct hits 0hp.

","sourceId":null},{"id":525156,"label":"Polymorph (2-3 Round)","description":"

This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. If the creature is a shapechanger or has 0 hit points, this spell will fail.

\r\n

The transformation lasts for 2 rounds on enemies, 3 rounds on allies, up to 24 hours at caster will or out of combat, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. This form can be reversed by the caster at any time. The new form is in the chart below, it can be any creature that is equal to or lower than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.

\r\n

Enemies that have been Polymorphed are essentially unable to be interacted with and cannot interact with the party giving you and your allies a chance to regroup.

\r\n

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious. The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

\r\n

All can be found in D&D Beyond in the monster section basic rules or PhB.
